Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Intermediate)
Description:
Interaptix builds industrial AR solutions for numerous high-profile clients, working at the intersection of mixed reality, HCI, machine learning, and computer vision. Our team is motivated by hard problems in the AR space and we are looking to hire talented and passionate individuals to join our team!
Responsibilities
Apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to real-time industrial sensor data
Plan and execute on ML system development, including system architecture, data collection, iterative testing and deployment
Feed back and forward to other components of larger computer vision framework
Remain up-to-date with relevant academic publications
Minimum Qualifications
3+ years of applied machine learning experience working with datasets in real-world environments
Experience working with very large datasets and real-time systems
Experience with statistics, probability theory, and data modeling
Experience in one or more of the following areas: classification systems, ranking systems, recommender systems, predictive modeling, and/or artificial intelligence
Experience with Python Machine Learning libraries, such as TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Strong C++ experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in applying ML to AR, specifically for industrial applications
Experience with analytical tools supporting data analysis
Demonstrable understanding of deep learning
Contributions to open-source or personal projects
Publications in AI space
About Us
Interaptix is a venture-backed augmented reality company working at the intersection of mixed reality, HCI, machine learning, and computer vision to fundamentally revolutionize how people interact with the world and one another. With its headquarters in downtown Toronto, Interaptix is funded by some of the most prominent tech investors and entrepreneurs. If you believe that augmented reality will be an integral part of the next computing platform and are passionate about making an impact in this exciting space, join our growing team in building new realities!
How to reach us
If you want to grab our attention, include a resume, cover letter and samples of your work.
Resume: We don't want to see the same old resume – make sure to highlight the skills and talents that make you the right person.
Cover letter: Forget the generic ‘to whom it may concern' greeting. Share your passion for this exciting industry with us!
Samples: Please include descriptions and links to examples of your best work (Github, Bitbucket, videos, etc.).

Title: Applied Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About You:
You are a software engineer who thrives on solving wicked problems that are multi-faceted and algorithmic in nature. You love researching and applying the latest computer vision or machine learning techniques. You can persevere through complex problems to find an optimal solution. You have the wisdom to know when an existing approach can be applied, but can reason from first principles and invent novel approaches when required. You are excited to contribute to the next big leap forward in computing.

Objectives:
Within one month
Understand our users, our existing product design, and the related software architecture at a high level
Understand the fundamentals of building, deploying, and testing code on Focals
Implement a new experimental feature that utilizes computer vision or machine learning inference on Focals
Optimize and debug existing image recognition solutions to reduce latency and improve accuracy
Within three months
Implement prototypes utilizing computer vision and inference on an embedded device to prove technical feasibility of various new product concepts
Educate other team members on different machine intelligence and algorithmic approaches to facilitate creative exploration of solutions to user problems
Combine your knowledge of the state-of-the-art in embedded artificial intelligence with user research insights to suggest novel concepts for new products
Participate in the design of a software architecture that achieves advanced contextual awareness without sacrificing privacy
Beyond
Lead development of new software technologies to add contextual awareness and machine intelligence to our wearable platform
Make improvements to existing processes, tools, and techniques
Work with production design and engineering teams to ensure research projects are successfully implemented in shipped products
Invent novel software systems to enable the next generation of computing
Mentor other software developers on the team and nurture a culture of generous excellence

What You'll Need:
Ability to optimize and adapt existing machine intelligence solutions to the limitations of an embedded device
Past success in applying a machine intelligence solution to solve a real-world problem
An open and collaborative attitude with a focus on team success
Broad knowledge of the state of the art within the fields of computer vision, machine learning, or algorithms
Strong coding skills in C/C++ and Python
Experience with accelerated inference or algorithms using OpenCV, OpenCL, OpenVX, or TensorFlow Lite
Degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent (in lieu of degree, minimum four years of relevant work experience)

Bonus points for:
Embedded systems programming experience
Experience with geometric computer vision applications like Visual SLAM, Sensor fusion, or 3D reconstruction
Proven ability to quickly learn new languages, frameworks, and platforms
Relevant personal projects or open source work
Proficiency with git

Feel like you can't tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we're looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!
Why North:
Day-to-day, we challenge each other to constantly raise the bar, encourage unconventional thinking to achieve innovative breakthroughs, and are passionately committed to surpassing our goals. We advocate a healthy lifestyle and promote continuous learning in a flexible work environment. Most of all, we set visionary goals, and we're passionate about building the best, most impactful products that people will love.
About us:
North, formerly Thalmic Labs, builds products that change the way we see and engage with our world. North's latest product, Focals, are custom-built glasses with a display only the wearer can see. Focals let you see texts, get turn-by-turn directions, check the weather, request an Uber, ask Alexa, and more — seamlessly and immediately. Founded in 2012, North has grown to a world-leading team of engineers, researchers, designers, and creators committed to building a future where technology is there when you need it and gone when you don't, hidden by design.
thixGECeMY

Title: AI-ML Data Engineer
Description:
Join the Winning Team at ATS Automation, a great place to automate your future! Take your place among the best in the business, and grow your career with ATS Automation. Join an environment where a passion for innovation is combined with an uncompromised commitment to quality.
We attract some of the most talented and motivated individuals from a range of fields, with our global offering and growth opportunities as we expand on a global scale.

Why Join ATS?
RSP with employer match
Eligibility to participate in Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Comprehensive benefits (including health, dental, employee assistance program)
Special discount program on products and services including gym membership discount
Ability to participate in a variety of charitable events
Social Club that offers BBQs and other social events throughout the year
Work with other bright, talented people and discover opportunities for professional growth
Be a part of a global organization that is a leader in its industry
And much more!

Job Description
MAJOR DUTIES:
As a member of a highly motivated, dynamic team, you will select, design and deploy world-class advanced machine learning and intelligent solutions that will be implemented on a wide range of automation equipment.
Duties involve:
determining and documenting data analytics requirements
the evaluation of 3rd party AI and ML algorithms and/or solutions
developing design concepts and architectures that incorporate 3rd party algorithms and/or solutions
the integration of appropriate 3rd party AI and ML algorithms and/or solutions.
The successful candidate will support software engineers in gathering and handling of appropriate data and assist with deploying systems in specific applications.
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with customers, project managers, machine designers, service and software designers to design and deploy industry leading analytics with the goals of enhanced data analysis
Working with external vendors and additional AI/ML resources to develop your personal capabilities and the AI/ML capabilities of the ATS team.
Required to understand and evaluate ML and AI providers and algorithms and assist in determining which algorithms or packages to deploy
Collaboratively evaluate the data required for effective machine learning and AI algorithms
Select features for building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Assist with the development and deployment of data pipelines
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Working with machine data, images and image processing data sets
Doing ad-hoc AI and ML analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Evaluation and sourcing of automated anomaly detection systems and tracking of its performance
Support others who are deploying and testing developed systems
Provide accurate documentation for each project
Advise customer on solving technical problems.
Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct
Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures
These responsibilities are subject to change as a function of the individual’s abilities.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
A post-secondary engineering degree, diploma or equivalent, specializing in mathematics, Machine Learning, Artificial intelligence, electrical, software, systems or computer engineering.
A Master’s degree is considered beneficial.
Experience:
Direct experience with the development and deployment of multiple successful AI/ML based solutions
Data analytics experience
Statistical analysis experience
Experience with both Cloud based and on-prem / edge based computing architectures
Experience with software development in a team environment
Strong problem solving skills
Programming / software development skills is an asset
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team in a fast paced environment with minimal supervision
ATS is in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA), 2005 and will, upon request, assist those who may require specific accommodations due to a personal disability. We would ask that those who require assistance to notify our offices as soon as possible if accommodation is necessary.

Title: Principal Artificial Intelligence Developer
Description:
Is your passion for the art of Artificial Intelligence? Do you enjoy the opportunity to employ Machine Learning and Deep Learning solutions to solve real-world problems?

Prophix has an exciting opportunity for the right person to join our team as a Principal Artificial Intelligence Developer. This is a hands-on and highly-visible role within the company. We seek a world-class AI engineer, with both the education and skills in architecting, designing and implementing machine learning and deep learning solutions.
Prophix is revolutionizing the CPM industry with innovative products and processes, and you would break new ground by applying artificial intelligence in our products and solutions. Reporting directly to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), you will play an essential role in helping Prophix’s Technology Office bring AI innovation to our product through guidance, influence, design assistance, and research and development.
Key Responsibilities:
Work hands-on with Product Management teams to identify opportunities utilizing AI.
Work closely with development teams to identify use cases, select a technical approach, define evaluation and test criteria, and refine methods and tools used to build technical solutions.
Define a strategy and roadmap for ensuring continuous introduction of novel AI-related technologies and help deliver on it by staying abreast of research and technology developments.
Design and deliver innovative AI solutions to the Prophix CPM solution.
Identify appropriate models to be used and improve model accuracy in Prophix-specific applications.
Create new, or modify existing models, in areas that the academic or industry state-of-the-art solution is unable to satisfy the product requirements.
Scaling of AI models to execute at-edge with potentially reduced power and processing capabilities.
Responsibility for one or more specialties:
Predictive failure analysis using time-series data
Decision-making models and autonomous operation of intelligent devices and appliances on behalf of finance
Optimizing of choices or behavior given a set of identified constraints
Participate in the product definition, especially around the aspects of AI, attempting to resolve ambiguity into concrete technical proposals.
What you will bring to Prophix:
D. in Computer Science or equivalent experience with a demonstrated track record of research and hands-on development in AI or related fields spanning 10+ years
Demonstrated ability to bring out the best in R&D teams
Strong leadership skills and effective collaboration abilities
Effective communication skills with small teams and working with large groups
Ability to participate in a highly collaborative environment
Deep experience with one or more frameworks such as TensorFlow, Caffe2, Keras, Numpy, Torch, and Theanu
Experience leveraging cloud technologies to speed AI and ML development, including technologies like EC2 and the AWS ML suite of tools
Desirable to have experience deploying production-grade solutions on both public cloud and on-premise platforms
What People Say About Prophix
About working with Prophix…“As a customer, you can tell how an organization is run by how its employees behave. When they’re bright people, who consistently demonstrate commitment to providing great products and service, you know that there is a strong, positive work culture where employees are truly valued. Prophix’s Management has got it right.” – Tim McCarthy, Finance Manager, Feeding America – A Prophix Customer since 2009
About why Prophix is a great place to work…“We have built a place for talented people to develop their skills and tap into their passions. But, one of the things that makes Prophix unique is that we are always doing something to further enrich the lives of our team. That’s the only way to attract and keep great people." – Paul Barber, CEO of Prophix
COMPANY BENEFITS AND PERKS
Competitive Compensation:
Excellent Base Salary
Lucrative Bonus Program
Candidate Referral Bonus Program
Rewards and Recognition programs including Presidents Club (trip) and numerous departmental awards
Comprehensive Benefits:
Wide-ranging Health Benefits including: Vision care, EAP, short and long term disability (Canada & USA). Benefits may vary by country.
Company matched RRSP, 401(k), or UK Pension
Company-paid fitness club/gym membership
Training reimbursement and internal training programs to enhance learning opportunities for employees
Company cell phone or cell reimbursement for designated roles
Employee Participation:
Corporate Social Responsibility Committee
Prophix-sponsored sports teams
Semi-Annual Town Hall meetings
Social Committee events
Departmental and Company Social Events
WORKING CONDITIONS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time for meetings or work, travel to different locations via plane within Canada and the United States, operate a motor vehicle (with a valid driver’s license), operate a personal computer, visually inspect forms, conduct oral communication via telephone and in person, retrieve and return files in storage cabinets, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and meet the physical requirements satisfactorily.

Title: Developer, Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to grow your career by taking on a new role at Bell? We always look for qualified internal applicants within our own team to support their development.

Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

We have been building our Business Intelligence team and have made tremendous strides in creating the BEST BI environment this industry has seen! As a result, we've been able to provide strategic data guidance and intelligence that has contributed to Bell's success. If you want to work with the latest & greatest BI tools like, Best in Class Teradata, SAS and Hadoop all within an Agile Methodology environment, then this may be the role for you!

If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team. Our people are empowered to make big things happen and are supported by growth, training and personal development opportunities.

Bell is seeking experienced ETL Developers/Data Engineers for both our SAS/Teradata and Hadoop platforms. Please specify which you are interested in when applying. ETL Developers make up a core group of the Data Engineering team and are responsible for the creation of the well structured and organized data asset leveraged across Customer Operations and many other Business Units in Bell for advanced analytics, reporting, and a number of other functions. In these roles you will help guide the evolution of the Business Intelligence Data Lake and have opportunities to work on projects spanning a wide variety of data sources driving our most strategic data initiatives.

Much of the work is project based and you will be required to work closely with project managers and business stakeholders to ensure target completion dates are met. The role requires you to work with the business to understand high level requirements and then design an optimized and scalable solution using either SAS/Teradata or Hadoop. You may also have the opportunity to work with many of our other BI tool stack including visualization tools, virtualization tools, metadata tools, and open source technologies.

This is a great opportunity to work on a team that is continually pushing the limits of driving value through data. The opportunities for growth are endless as the ecosystem is continually evolving and we are investing in people and technology to stay current.

Skills:
Expert level ETL/ELT skills to aggregate, filter and manipulate large data sets on either SAS/Teradata or Hadoop.
Code and design optimization to produce efficient and scalable production ready code
Documentation of all development code with logical error/exception handling to reduce complexity for the Production Support team.
Ability to debug/enhance code written by other developers including understanding the business logic implemented.
Ability to work closely with business stakeholders to translate ambiguous requirements into efficient code to deliver expected results.
Experience reading and understanding business documents (SRS, BRD).
Able to prioritize, multitask and execute tasks in a high pressure environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills is required.
Proven thought leadership to drive continuous improvement in processes and identify new opportunities related to data pipelines
The Hadoop role also has some focus on working with emerging technologies in the Open Source ecosystem (Kafka, Containers, APIs, etc.) related to Data Engineering but not necessarily ELT specific.

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years ETL/ELT experience
5+ year of SQL experience or 5+ years of programming languages such as Python, Java, Spark C++, C#, etc.
2+ years in ETL/ELT code optimization
Proven experience using ETL tools such as SAS Data Integration Studio (or equivalent) or Proven experience in developing Big Data ingestion/transformation frameworks in Spark
Experience in the telecom industry is an asset
Experience in Kafka and Container technologies is an asset

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Regular - Full Time
Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Application Deadline: 10/04/2019

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

Title: Machine Learning Intern (Computational Biochemistry)
Description:
FULL-TIME TERM POSITION: 6 MONTHS (WITH POSSIBILITY OF PERMANENT POSITION)

OVERVIEW
We are currently seeking a recent BSc or MSc graduate to join our Research & Development team as a Machine Learning Intern with a focus on Computational Biochemistry. We are working on ambitious high-throughput screening projects to accelerate our scientific work and develop new products that reduces the use of synthetic chemical pesticides around the world. The Machine Learning Engineer will work closely with our Machine Learning group as part of our overall Research & Development team.

YOUR MISSION
As a key member of Terramera's Machine Learning group, you will support our work in computational biochemistry and artificial intelligence to develop machine learning models that lead to the discovery of new materials with desired properties in the treatment of plant diseases, as well as the enhancement of crop quality.

OUTCOMES

Research chemical compounds and natural materials' information from internal and external data sources (e.g. chemical compound databases, experiment databases);
Help implement computational models to calculate various descriptors based on molecular structures;
Help design and implement machine learning models to screen through a large number of chemical compounds/natural materials and recommend those with desired properties; and
Work with and receive guidance from our Software and Machine Learning Engineers to put your models and algorithms into production.
REQUIREMENTS

Post-secondary degree in Computational Biochemistry, Computer Science or related discipline (Masters an asset);
Familiarity with chemical compounds and natural materials' information (structure, molecular descriptors, chemical and physical properties, bioactivity properties);
Experience with machine learning/deep learning concepts and frameworks, such as Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Caffe;
Solid programming skills with a focus on writing clean/maintainable code, with experience in Java, Python, R, or Matlab programming; and
Familiarity with statistical analysis (experiment design, hypothesis testing).
PREFERENCES

Exposure to in-silico drug design and drug discovery, such as identification of physico-chemical characteristics that are responsible for drug activity, and development of quantitative structure-activity relationship (QSAR) models from experimental efficacy data;
Exposure to mapping chemical space from public databases;
Familiarity with open-source computational biochemistry software and chemical databases;
Familiarity with plant Genomics, Proteomics, and Phenomics data;
Knowledge of Molecular Dynamic (MD) Simulations and Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations; and
Knowledge of the Agile project management methodology.
QUALITIES WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Aptitude for interdisciplinary collaboration;
Highly conscientious with strong follow-through;
Capable of performing research on best practices and communicating results to a non-expert audience; and
Able to apply domain knowledge to ambiguous and novel situations.
LOCATION

Vancouver, BC
WHO WE ARE
Terramera is a global leader in Technology for Clean Food with a mission to increase global yields while decreasing synthetic chemical loads, so we can grow affordable, clean food for everyone. We are committed to cultivating safe, healthy homes and environments, and developing highly effective natural products for consumers and farmers. Terramera uses technology to unlock the power in nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world.

Our success begins with our people. We're looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team.

While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on Terramera, please visit our website at www.terramera.com ( http://www.terramera.com/ )

Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer.

APPLICATION DEADLINE

September 30, 2019

Title: Data Scientist - KTP Associate
Description:
An exciting opportunity is available to take ownership of a leading-edge KTP project in a collaboration between the University of Reading and Optimal Monitoring Ltd. The project is to develop an automated artificial intelligence system to analyse natural language user feedback and incorporate this into a software tool to address exceptional utility consumption in business premises. The project is in the forefront of the market and the position is a 24-month fixed term contract. It’s likely the project will continue beyond the KTP therefore, there is potential for a successful candidate to continue with the company beyond the initial two years.
About Optimal Monitoring:
Established in 1994 Optimal Monitoring develops a web based energy monitoring and analytics platform, which collects disparate data and produces simple to understand actionable reports automatically. We help organisations use less electricity, gas and water. Find out more by visiting: www.optimalmonitoring.com
About KTP:
This position forms part of the Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) funded by Innovate UK. It’s essential you understand how KTP works with business and the University, and the vital role you will play if you successfully secure a KTP Associate position.
Skill development through training:
Additionally there is a £4k dedicated training budget for you to tailor to your own personal development plus attendance on residential management skills training modules.
The successful candidate must possess:
Minimum First Class degree or Masters degree in Computer Science with specialisation in natural language processing or machine learning or relevant areas
Knowledge of machine learning, NLP and signal processing
Programming in Python
Essential skills we require as a minimum:
Able to develop a sound understanding of the energy and utility sector, along with the ability to quickly learn existing technical systems within the company
An appetite for commercial awareness with strong self-motivation with a desire to drive a project forward
Effective communication to both technical and non technical audiences

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
At integrate.ai, our mission is to build a future in which AI enriches people's lives while creating better, more valuable businesses. Our AI-powered platform helps B2C enterprises become customer-centric, identifying what customers value in businesses and applying AI to guide customers to valuable experiences. We care about privacy and ethics, and are working to make Responsible AI a reality across consumer enterprise. We are proudly based in downtown Toronto, Canada at the center of an exciting AI ecosystem.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our client team. This role will be working to develop statistical and machine learning models to power our AI platform and making traditional businesses customer centric using artificial intelligence. This is a unique opportunity for someone who wants to grow in the world of machine learning and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise. This role will play a key role in the development of what makes our platform unique and push our science team to build new and innovative machine learning models.

What you will be doing:
Researching, developing, and validating generalizable models to power the platform capabilities and automate client-facing business processes.
Researching and developing innovative methods to better facilitate a wide-variety of machine learning tasks including feature engineering and selection, hyperparameter tuning, and optimization.
Researching and developing unsupervised machine learning methods to discover behavioural patterns across multiple datasets using representation learning, transfer learning, deep nets, etc.
Working with business stakeholders and product managers to translate product requirements into machine learning research and development activities.
Working with architects, data and quality assurance engineers to develop statistical inference processes, monitoring and testing automation frameworks to ensure data, insights, and model quality while delivering analytical insights into the product.
You have:
5+ years of hands-on machine learning experience, ideally in a high growth software development environment.
Experience in developing machine learning models and machine learning frameworks that have had impact in real life production
Experience in one or more of the following fields: NLP, image annotation, video segmentation, quantum computing, Combinatorics
Experience in transfer learning, representation learning, and domain adaptation
A Masters or PhD in Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative discipline.
Understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning.
Deep understanding of Deep Learning, or Reinforcement Learning, or Optimization Techniques
Passion about deriving insights from large datasets and communicating those insights to clients, product managers and engineers.
Experience in the use of statistical analysis and machine learning tools, packages and languages such as TensorFlow, Python, Spark MLlib, MXNet, Theano, and PyTorch.
The diverse experiences, ideas, and identities of integrate.ai's team members help us make better decisions and drive great results. We foster an inclusive work environment that welcomes team members of all backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to providing a meaningful environment for every member of our team. We hire exceptional people and reward them with trust, autonomy, mentorship, and growth.

We are naturally curious and have strong attention to detail. We love working in a team environment where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day. If this sounds like the right fit, please apply and come work with us.

Title: Casual Software Developer
Description:
This position has an end date of 1 year from hire, with the possibility of extension based on funding.
The Software Developer will work within a multidisciplinary project team in the Division of Pediatric Neurology to develop an Artificial Intelligence (AI) powered Chatbot, which will assist families of individuals with neurodevelopmental disabilities. The Chatbot will require further development, as well as the creation of a database to contain resources and to collect information from users. The Software Developer will assist with programming the Chatbot alongside a team of other developers.
Duties
Front-end web development of the Chatbot project.
Establishment of questions and resource annotation.
Development of one secure database containing the questions and response for the Chatbot.
Development of one secure database recording the response of users, as well as their user profile.
Integration with existing AI tools such as MedFact.
Creation of website annotation tools using web scraping and semantic web knowledge.
Work on a collaborative team with undergraduate, graduate, and post-doctoral students.
Qualifications
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in science.
BSc in computer science or equivalent preferred.
Ability to identify the most pressing matters and work efficiently to complete tasks in a timely manner; flexibility is key.
Strong communication and teamwork skills; friendly and outgoing.
Ability to take initial direction from another member of the research team in order to complete tasks independently.
Experience with web architecture.
Experience with Python, SQL, Django, Javascript, HTML, CSS and Git fundamentals is required.
Experience with Redux, React.js, Angular or Vue.js is an asset.
Experience with Basic knowledge of containerization is an asset.
Experience with Agile methodology and Natural Language Processing is an asset.

Software Development Engineer (Machine Learning)

Additionally, this position provides an opportunity to apply Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to large-scale ecommerce data.

Work with researchers (Ph.D.’s) and senior software engineers to implement scalable algorithms for several tasks that require NLP and ML.
Design NLP and ML algorithms for multiple languages, such as Japanese, Chinese, French, etc.

Work in an agile environment.

Detail oriented.

Title: Data Scientist/Artificial Intelligence Expert
Description:
Job Description
RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary

The AIPHL lab of McGill University Health Center and Department of radiology is looking for a data scientist as part of a multi-disciplinary clinical team for developing medical AI applications
The successful candidate will be joining a dynamic team within an academic health center and leading research and development in medical applications of AI in collaboration with other academic groups as well as industry partners.
The approach will be open and multi-disciplinary, including working with different medical specialties within the hospital as well as collaborators from other institutions including health centers, non-medical academic groups with AI expertise, and industry.
General Duties

The candidate would be expected to take a leadership role under the supervision of the principle investigators in overseeing and developing optimal strategies and developing of algorithms for various AI applications that include but is not limited to analysis of medical images such as CT and MRI scans.
The candidate would be working with other team members within and outside the lab and would be expected to oversee successful completion of different projects conducted by the team from a data science perspective.
Provide supervision to trainees and necessary training to other lab members and/or trainees.
The successful candidate would be expected to take a leadership position and lead projects to completion.
Participate in grant writing, and manuscript preparation.
Website of the organization
https://rimuhc.ca/en

Education / Experience
Should have a PhD degree
A successful candidate should have a strong background in machine learning applications including deep learning applications for medical image analysis.
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing would be a bonus.
Familiarity with medical physics and/or imaging would be an asset but not a requirement.
Knowledge/experience in radiomics would be an asset but not a requirement
Outgoing, excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiatives, set priorities, time-manage, and resolve problems
Additional information
Status : Full time
Pay Scale : Salary competitive based of candidate’s qualifications and experience
Work Shift : 8am – 4pm, as per standard
Work Site : MUHC RI and department of radiology

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

NOTE: The masculine gender has been used for brevity and includes the feminine gender.
Equal Opportunity Employment Program

Le CUSM applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d’adaptation peuvent être offertes aux personnes handicapées qui en font la demande en fonction de leurs besoins.

Title: Data Wrangler (Systems Analyst)
Description:
It's an exciting time to join our Data Analytics and Data Warehouse team as we begin to collect, normalize and prepare data for big data studies, as we look to the future of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. As such, we are looking for a Systems Analyst, acting as a ‘Data Wrangler’, to work within our Data Analytics and Data Warehouse team. The successful candidate will have the ability to harmonize and rationalize disparate data together for analysis and will be responsible for all aspects of data management using Microsoft Azure.
A problem-solver, with keen attention to detail and strong process improvement skills, the candidate will need to comfortable multi-tasking as the role supports incremental and static data from current and legacy systems on a wide range of database platforms. The Candidate will be able to translate the data to ensure that our report writers are able to use the data to create meaning for our clinical & research end users.
Here's What You'll Get To Do
Prepare, parse and ingest structured and unstructured data by setting up new connections to live sources and exporting legacy data via our Microsoft Azure SQL Data Warehouse.
Ensure data is cleansed by applying logic and business rules.
Define and setup schemas and structures to ensure that the data is readily available, while also ensuring cost efficiency by avoiding duplication and streamlining approaches.
Document all processes to ensure clarity for team members
Work closely with report writers to ensure that they have the datasets they require in a normalized structure.
Extract data on request, via SQL, for clinical and research purposes.
Design and execute testing plans to ensure quality assurance.
Monitor data to ensure that errors/issues are acted on in a timely manner
Ensure privacy and security standards are always adhered to.
Other administrative responsibilities include access management, monitoring usage metrics, and preparing reports for senior management
Here’s What You’ll Need:
Bachelor's degree in an Information Technology related field is required
3+ years of experience in database concepts, management and design, including experience with ETL processing.
Fluent with SQL, and experienced with SSMS
Familiarity with Hadoop, Azure SQL DW, and Azure Data Factory is highly recommended.
Experience with SSAS is highly recommend.
Previous healthcare experience is highly recommended
Prior experience in big data is highly recommended
Understanding of a wide variety of database designs and tools is nice to have.
Knowledge of AI and/or Machine Learning are nice to haves.
Effective interpersonal skills in a cross-functional environment - able to interact with all levels of technical ability and comfortable with translating business requirements.
Forward thinker, able to prioritize tasks and design the data environment at SickKids.
A problem solver, with out of the box thinking, a drive for innovation and the ability to execute ideas.
Strong project management, time management and organizational skills, with the proven ability to prioritize and execute multiple competing tasks.
A proven self-starter and idea generator.
Inclination towards taking the organization from Business Intelligence (BI) to an Artificial Intelligence (AI) landscape in long-term.
The ability to work independently, and as part of a diverse team.
Excellent written and verbal skills
Attention to detail
A drive to ensure privacy and security standards are always adhered to.
Employment Type: 1 year CONTRACT, Full-time, 35 hours per week .

Title: Data Science Intern - Winter 2020 (Toronto)
Description:
Interested in joining a team of data scientists and developers? We are currently looking for interns for our Data Lab - R&D department! You will take on challenging projects that provide tremendous opportunities to learn and grow, surrounded by a multi-disciplinary team that constantly pushes to develop and implement innovative products.

Why join us?

In a world where data is changing the way we live, the Data Lab team leverages a variety of sources of information coming from all touchpoints with our customers. We also use state of the art technologies to explore new possibilities and help us become one of the smartest players in the game. From analyzing our customers driving behaviours to state of the art technology for determining accurate prices on intangible products, the opportunities stemming from being the largest P&C insurer in Canada are endless.

To get a glimpse of our ongoing projects, have a look at this blog post.

WORKPLACE: Toronto (700, University Ave)

THE ROLE:
Stay current on new approaches or opportunities, and bring them to the solutions you design
Transform complex data sets into meaningful conclusions and recommendation
Develop novel and innovative solutions for pattern recognition using machine learning and statistical approaches


Your Skills


QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor, Master or PhD in progress related to artificial intelligence, computer science or data science
Open-source frameworks: Python, R, Spark, Hadoop
Work environment: GitHub, Git, Agile, Scrum
Understanding of the underlying Machine Learning theory an asset
Understanding in any specific field: Computer vision, Natural Language Processing or Artificial Intelligence an asset
Practical experience with machine learning or deep learning framework an asset
Ability to concentrate on loosely defined problems which require application of creative approaches
Strong communication, time-management, organization, and prioritization skills
Understanding of data science approaches in consumer research domains an asset
Cooperative team player

WHAT WE OFFER:
Open, collaborative and tech-driven workspace
Possibility to build a career
Competitive salary
Flexible hours
Open, collaborative and tech-driven workspace


Closing Statement


Eligibility to work in Canada
It’s important that you are eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

Background Checks
Prior to receiving a job offer, you may be asked to consent to background checks if it’s a requirement for the role. These checks could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record.
A career in Insurance has never been this exciting.
Evolving consumer expectations and technology have helped to shape a new vision for our industry – and we are leading the way. Our Technology teams are reshaping the way we do business and setting new industry benchmarks. Our Claims representatives are helping customers to get back on track after they experience a loss. Our product teams are developing products that protect people and businesses so they can focus on what matters to them most.
Our success story is written by our passion for living our values and creating a better tomorrow. We’re re-writing the future of insurance - are you ready to be a part of the story?

Title: Data Scientist, Data Science & Risk Management
Description:
Johnson & Johnson, Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCCP) is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist, to join the Data Science & Risk Management Team.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer

The Data Scientist is a core member of the Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCC&P) Global Operations Center of Excellence team, reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Science & Risk Management. You will be responsible for partnering with Global Operations team members (Compliance & Technology Integration, Testing & Monitoring, Regional Centers of Excellence); the Franchise / Company HCC&P Compliance Officers and business partners to identify, develop and implement innovative solutions that enhance our data, analytic & visualization capabilities.
As the Data Scientist:
You will be responsible for Identifying and understanding key business questions to be addressed using the appropriate analytical approaches
You will model data to build innovative solutions to solve complex analytical problems;
You will lead or support projects that will facilitate advancement in predictive analytics;
You will develop methodologies that allow for efficient and repetitive data extraction; using existing and new data bases (structured & unstructured) focused on identifying potential compliance risk areas
You will provide input/recommendations to the Data Science & Risk Management Governance team regarding development, standardization and delivery prioritization
You will partner with Data Science & Risk Management and Compliance & Technology Integration team members to evaluate and develop system platforms and technology to enhance our data science capabilities



Qualifications
Required:
A minimum of a Master’s degree with 2 years of experience or Ph.D degree in, Computer Sciences, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Computational Informatics, Medical Informatics, Computational Biology or a related discipline.
Experience with data mining methodology, common modeling techniques, and presenting data insights
Good analytical skills. You should be able to analyse and interpret complex data from multiple sources using R, Python, SAS, Java, SQL
A broad knowledge of existing data science techniques (such as decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models) and creativity to invent and customized algorithms when necessary
Experienced working in a multinational environment and with cross-functional and/or cross-sector teams
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills
Ability to successfully lead multiple critical priorities/issues
Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both internal and external customers is required
Must be able to travel up to 10% of the time, mainly to domestic destinations.
This position can be based in New Brunswick, NJ; Toronto, Ontario Canada; or Guelph, Ontario Canada.
Preferred
Project Management and / or Process Excellence training / certification
You are a highly motivated individual with demonstrated analytical, communication and social skills. A keen data science curiosity and strong leadership skills are important in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced work environment.
Previous experience within the pharmaceutical, consumer and/or medical device industries
Experience in identifying viable data mining opportunities and then conceive, develop and implement end to end data analytical solutions



Primary Location
United States-New Jersey-New Brunswick-
Other Locations
North America-Canada-Ontario-Toronto, North America-Canada-Ontario-Guelph
Organization
Johnson & Johnson International (6078)
Job Function
Digital Product Development
Requisition ID
4073190905

Title: Research Intern, Artificial Intelligence
Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Facebook is seeking Research Interns to join Facebook AI Research (FAIR). We are committed to advancing the field of artificial intelligence by making fundamental advances in technologies to help interact with and understand our world. We are seeking individuals passionate in areas such as deep learning, computer vision, audio and speech processing, natural language processing, machine learning, reinforcement learning, computational statistics, and applied mathematics. Our interns have an opportunity to make core algorithmic advances and apply their ideas at an unprecedented scale. Many of our interns publish at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, and ACL. This internship has a minimum 12-week duration beginning in January. We have openings in our Menlo Park, New York, Seattle, and Pittsburgh offices. Internships will be awarded on a rolling basis and candidates are encouraged to apply early. Applicants are expected to be pursuing a PhD in one of the areas listed above; outstanding Masters and Bachelor students may also be considered. The application deadline for a Summer Internship is March 27, 2020. To learn more about our research visit https://research.facebook.com.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines
Perform research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities)
Devise better data-driven models of human behavior, and/or
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a degree (PhD, Masters, or Bachelors with relevant research experience) in Computer Science or related field
Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization in the country of employment in 2020
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Publications or experience in machine learning, AI, computer vision, optimization, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, or data science
Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Ability to manipulate and analyze complex, large scale, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
Ability to communicate complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Knowledge in C, C++, Python, Lua or other related programming language
Experience building systems based on machine learning and/or deep learning methods
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Title: Site Admin
Description:
Who Are We:
IMI is a leading provider of labor solutions and workforce management in the material handling sector. With 20 years in the industry, we have established ourselves in the industry by creating great relationships with both our employees and clients.

Our main goal is to provide hard-working individuals with great jobs for some of the most progressive material handling companies in the world – if you can think of a company, we’ve probably worked with them.

Not only has our company grown based on the great work our employees provide for our clients, but we are also always looking for innovative ways to make everyone’s job a little bit easier – whether that be through our developing artificial intelligence or what we offer our employees for their hard work.

We’re hoping you trust us with your career, as it’s just important to us as it is to you.

Position Overview:
The candidate will provide administrative, clerical, operational and payroll support. You will assist in meeting the installation targets, recruitment goals, and objectives of the organization and provides quality customer service to both external and internal employees and applicants. The successful candidate will have experience in the material handling and or construction industry as well as being Spanish bilingual.

You’ll be providing support in dealing and responding to correspondence, emails, and phone inquiries. There will also be ad-hoc administrative tasks and special projects assigned occasionally. We hope you’re a team player!

You’ll be responsible for the following:
Monitor and track daily emails
Alignment with site supervisors on personnel requests and logistics
Liaison between site supervisors and recruitment department
Orientation and processing of contract labor
Complete weekly timesheets and assist with payroll concerns
Data entry, record keeping and electronic filing
Track and log rental equipment, daily safety sheets
Set up accounts as needed and tracking of project activities
Collect and submit daily labor log data, manage expenses and travel
Enter new hire paperwork.
Track employee day-off requests.
Monitor Employee statuses. (Attendance, sick days, etc.)
Additional responsibilities if applicable:
Keep up with safety posters and administrative regulations
Execute tool inspections and log inventory
Check dated safety items (Fire extinguishers, Safety Harnesses, etc.)
Experience/Education:
We are looking for those who have their high school diploma or GED and a minimum of 1-year administrative experience working in a fast pace, front office environment or customer service-related position. Bi-lingual preferred

We Require the Following from You:
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Applicant Tracking Systems
Flexible in terms of work hours, open to shifting schedules, extended work hours and working on holidays and weekends
Ability to maintain satisfactory attendance and punctuality standard
Effective time management skills that allow you to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Professional demeanor and ability to handle confidential and delicate employee information
