Title: Data Architect
Description:
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
Intelligence automatisée (Machine Intelligence) chez Ericsson:
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser un réseau 5G, l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies d'Intelligence artificielle (IA) - il sera vital pour nous de nous occuper de cette complexité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures que nous utilisons pour alimenter nos réseaux et services 5G. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie. Notre groupe international met au point des produits de pointe qui simplifient et automatisent les processus de nos produits et services, et apportent une nouvelle valorisation grâce à des informations sur les données.
Ericsson recrute des architectes expérimentés et seniors des données pour enrichir de manière significative son équipe Global AI Accelerator .
Description du poste :
Ericsson est à la recherche d'architectes des données compétents pour rejoindre son équipe d'experts MI en pleine évolution. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez évoluer et optimiserez notre architecture de données et de traitement en cascade (data pipeline), tout en optimisant la circulation et le recueil des données pour les équipes plurifonctionnelles. Vous êtes un expert en établissement de traitements en cascade (data pipeline) et du Datawrangling, qui aime optimiser les systèmes de traitement des données et les faire évoluer. L'Ingénieur de données soutiendra nos concepteurs de logiciels, architectes de bases de données, analystes de données et scientifiques en traitement des données concernant les initiatives portant sur les données, et assurera l'optimisation de ces dernières et des modèles. L'architecture devOps (dataOps) est la même pour tous les projets en cours. Vous êtes autonome et à l'aise lorsqu'il s'agit de réagir face aux besoins en DataOps de plusieurs équipes, systèmes et produits. Vous serez également responsable de les intégrer à l'architecture utilisée dans l'entreprise. Le bon candidat sera enthousiasmé par la perspective d'optimiser ou même de reconcevoir l'architecture dataOps de notre entreprise, afin de soutenir notre nouvelle génération de produits et de solutions stimulés par la MI.
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Créer et gérer des données optimales et modéliser l'architecture Pipeline en dataOps
Assembler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, qui satisfont aux conditions opérationnelles fonctionnelles / non fonctionnelles.
Découvrir, concevoir et améliorer les procédés internes : automatisation des procédés manuels, optimisation de la délivrance des données, re-conception de l'infrastructure au bénéfice d'une plus grande possibilité d'évolution, etc.
Établir l'infrastructure requise pour l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement optimaux de données, à partir de différentes sources de données en faisant appel à SQL et à des technologies « Big Data » reposant sur le cloud d'AWS, Azure et autres.
Travailler avec les parties prenantes, notamment l'équipe de la Direction, du service Produits, du service Données et Conception, pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et à satisfaire à leurs besoins en infrastructure de traitement des données.
Faire en sorte que les données soient séparées et sécurisées au-delà des frontières nationales, grâce à plusieurs centres de traitement des données et à des clients / partenaires stratégiques.
Créer des chaines de compilation (toolchain) pour l'équipe des scientifiques en traitement des données et d'analyse, qui les aident à créer et à optimiser notre produit, afin qu'il devienne le premier produit de l'industrie de par son degré d'innovation.
Coopérer avec les experts en apprentissage automatique et en traitement des données, afin d'améliorer le fonctionnement de nos systèmes de gestion du cycle de vie des modèles et de traitement de nos données.
Appuyer l'accumulation de compétences en DapaOps dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Ce que nous aimerions constater:
BS, MS ou doctorat en informatique, en informatique, en systèmes de traitement des informations ou dans un autre domaine connexe.
Au moins 3 ans d'expérience en utilisation des logiciels / outils suivants :
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Expérience en bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres et Cassandra.
Expérience en outils de traitement en pipeline de modèles et des données, en gestion du déroulement des travaux : Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont très poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont très solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.
*IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Machine Intelligence at Ericsson:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, MachineLearning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution
Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through datainsights.
Ericsson is hiring Experienced and Senior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.
Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing datasystems and evolving them. The Data Architect will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
What we would like to see:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
At least 3 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
You have advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
You have experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
You have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
You have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Data Architect: 3 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Language:
English (Preferred)
French (Preferred)

Title: Junior Full Stack Developer
Description:
Based in Toronto, Fortran Traffic Systems Limited is a leader in the North American traffic industry and at the forefront of innovation in intelligent transportation management systems. With the arrival of transportation technologies such as Connected Vehicle/Automated Vehicle (CVAV) and Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X), Fortran is advancing its platforms to harness the multitude of benefits that these emerging technologies can provide to road operators and traffic management agencies. Fortran offers a challenging environment, rich in R&D, that fosters creativity and rewards excellence.
Job description
The Junior Full Stack Developer will be entrusted to develop cutting-edge software solutions for the next-generation of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) designed and produced by Fortran.
Recent graduates are encouraged to apply.
The successful candidate will be an integral part of a team developing high performance and sustainable V2X and ITS systems. Responsibilities include:
Utilizing quality focused software development practices and standards to develop full stack software solutions
Performing detailed analysis, design, unit-level code development, software integration and testing
Analyzing complex functions, procedures and problems to deliver creative, logical, and effective solutions that meets the specified requirements
Conducting / participating in design and code reviews, identifying potential problems and performance issues, providing feedback and corrections and evaluating code compliance to standards
Preparation of application operational / procedural documentation for users and technical support staff
Requirements
Experience and working knowledge in the following areas:
Web-based front-end application framework and web-based UI programming
Understanding of web development languages and technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavasScript/jQuery and NodeJS
SQL and NoSQL experience including (PostgresDB/PostGIS and MongoDB)
C++ back-end programming
Linux (or Unix) environment Operating systems principles and communication protocols
Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Organized, focused and persistent with the ability to work to the plan and meet delivery dates
Excellent problem solver and quick learner
Further consideration will be given to candidates that possess:
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Machine Learning, Data Mining or Machine Intelligence (Artificial Intelligence)
Real-time software development experience
Native mobile app development (Android or iOS)
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Head of Data and Analytics
Description:
Canada Drives embraces an innovative, experimental, and data-driven mindset that encourages creative solutions and relentless progress. Guided by young leadership and defined by its innovative, out-of-the-box thinking, Canada Drives attracts the best talent in Vancouver by combining the electrifying energy of a start-up with the hard-earned stability of an established company.

We have been recognized as the fastest growing company in Canada by PROFIT 500 and the winner of Entrepreneur of the Year in 2016 by the Ernst & Young Pacific Division fintech category award. We were named as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 2019. The company’s growth means there are tons of opportunities on the horizon. This millennial-friendly company is committed to developing leaders from within as it fine-tunes an online service that satisfies over one million customers a year.

Our office is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver and we want you to join our fast-growing team. Come and discover your potential with us!

The Opportunity - Head of Data and Analytics

Canada Drives is enhancing our operations through skills and technology; we’re building a unique team, processes, and technology to collect, aggregate, and analyze raw data into accurate, understandable, and actionable reports and strategies.

The Data Analytics Manager will lead a team of analysts and be responsible for defining the overall departmental vision, strategy, and roadmap. They will also help organize and align the Sales and Marketing departments with their day-to-day reporting and analytics.

The right candidate will have a combination of leadership, technical, analytical, and communication skills. By successfully leveraging these skills, the Data Analytics Manager will help improve our business operations across multiple departments.

Take your career to the next level and be part of a winning team!

What you’ll be doing:
Owning the data analytics processes and tools across the company
Managing the Data Analytics team (current staff of 4) and providing direction, vision, motivation, and mentorship
Developing a deep understanding of the key business drivers and revenue
Supporting data-driven decision making by providing stakeholders with accurate and timely information
Setting expectations for data analytics and providing clear communication to stakeholders
Providing meaningful insights to business managers
Managing dashboards, metrics, and reports to assist Sales, Marketing, Design, Customer Service, Dealer Services, and IT with their day-to-day operations and challenges
Managing and implementing new data projects such as data centralization and creating underwriting models
Supporting and promoting data governance
Analyzing data for new insights, loan performance, and optimization of underwriting models
Participating in strategic and tactical planning with Stakeholders
Using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Predictive Analytics
Analyzing website traffic and advertisement data including the daily tracking of customer applications and conversion rates
Working together with our in-house designers and developers to maintain and enhance our internal marketing tags and advertisements
Planning, executing, analyzing results of A/B test variations on our websites as well as providing recommendations for improvements
What you should already have:
Minimum 10 years of experience working with BI or Analytics
Minimum 5 years of experience directly managing and mentoring staff
Strong business-oriented skills to oversee the business strategy and processes, while turning data analysis into actionable information and insights
Strong leadership, problem-solving, and communications skills
Previous experience leading the development of data warehouses, data marts, dashboards, performance metrics, and reports
Hands on experience analyzing and mining data, slicing and dicing structures, and finding new areas of opportunity
Previous experience with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Predictive Intelligence
Excellent with Python, R and SQL
Excellent with Tableau, Microsoft Power BI and Excel
Deep understanding of dimensional data modelling
Good understanding of Google Analytics and Tag Manager
Familiarity with the Salesforce platform and modules (or comparable CRM)
Assets

Financial Industry experience
Master’s degree in Analytics related studies
Working knowledge of Project Management and Business Analysis
Experience with Agile methodologies
Good understanding of Adobe Target Manager and Audience

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
****English Version included below***
Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.
Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques expérimentes et seniors en traitement des données (Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.
Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.
Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Spécialiste Apprentissage Automatique-Scientifique en traitement des données (Data Scientist), vous devez très bien connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté
Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’apprentissage automatique ou en Science des données.
Expérience éprouvée dans la rédaction de logiciels de production
Grande expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Très bonnes compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Compétences éprouvées de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Bonnes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
* IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.
Ericsson is now looking for Experienced and Senior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.
Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data?
Role Summary:
As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.

Title: Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Specialist – Auto...
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Job #: 199395

Currently we are seeking individuals for the following position, please take note that this position is time sensitive and we advise you to apply immediately and express your skills and abilities that pertains to the job description.
If you are an experienced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Specialist looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help!
***** Opportunity with a top Client in Automotive Industry *****
Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Specialist
12 Months Contract (Long Term Contracts, Extension available)
Oshawa, ON
The Opportunity
Being part of the innovation team, you will support activities involving cross-functional teams of engineers.
You will work on diverse range of projects including, Natural Language Processing, Time Series data and Computer Vision.
You will not only be surrounded by experienced AI/ML specialists, but also by Domains experts and AI/ML software leads to complement your work and help push it to production level software.
The latest hardware and software IT support including High Performance Computers will be made available to run seamless training and testing tasks.
We are looking for individuals who can demonstrate innovation, creativity, initiative and a high level of independent judgment.
However, to truly help us in driving the future of technology, you must share a genuine passion for technology and mobility systems.
What We Need You To Do
Create internal comprehensive documentation with links to the relevant functions/classes
Collaborate with the product owner and the rest of the team to understand key functional and operational properties of each project
Collaborate on integrating core AI functions into production ready software
Interface with various cross-functional teams to align with global specifications
Stay ahead of the technology curve and in tune with competitive products
Documenting and co-authoring internal technical specifications, and patents


Qualifications
Must have:
Master’s or PhD in Engineering, or related degree; Electrical, Mechatronics, Computer Vision, Computer or Systems Design
0-1+ Years' experience
Familiar with programming in Python (Tensorflow/Keras/PyTorch, etc..) and versioning tools
Expertise in one or more of the following machine learning domains: Image Processing, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Speech/Signal processing
Advanced knowledge in deep learning algorithms
Development skills to rapidly deliver minimum viable products

Preferred:
Experience in data visualization tools and methods (Tableau, Matplotlib, Power BI, etc..)
Knowledge in ensemble and online learning
Experience with SQL and other Database related languages
Familiar with parallel computing using GPUs and Unix based systems
When you join The Bartech Group, an Impellam company you launch a career. Bartech one of North America's largest and fastest-growing staffing firms, continues to elevate the staffing industry to a higher level of thinking. We specialize in Contract and Direct Placement of Engineering, IT, Technical, Professional and Finance & Accounting specialists.
Bartech values diversity and inclusion in its workforce and we invite all applicants to apply. We review all applications and will contact candidates whose skills are best suited for this role. Title: Data Scientist, Data Science & Risk Management
Description:
Johnson & Johnson, Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCCP) is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist, to join the Data Science & Risk Management Team.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer

The Data Scientist is a core member of the Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCC&P) Global Operations Center of Excellence team, reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Science & Risk Management. You will be responsible for partnering with Global Operations team members (Compliance & Technology Integration, Testing & Monitoring, Regional Centers of Excellence); the Franchise / Company HCC&P Compliance Officers and business partners to identify, develop and implement innovative solutions that enhance our data, analytic & visualization capabilities.
As the Data Scientist:
You will be responsible for Identifying and understanding key business questions to be addressed using the appropriate analytical approaches
You will model data to build innovative solutions to solve complex analytical problems;
You will lead or support projects that will facilitate advancement in predictive analytics;
You will develop methodologies that allow for efficient and repetitive data extraction; using existing and new data bases (structured & unstructured) focused on identifying potential compliance risk areas
You will provide input/recommendations to the Data Science & Risk Management Governance team regarding development, standardization and delivery prioritization
You will partner with Data Science & Risk Management and Compliance & Technology Integration team members to evaluate and develop system platforms and technology to enhance our data science capabilities



Qualifications
Required:
A minimum of a Master’s degree with 2 years of experience or Ph.D degree in, Computer Sciences, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Computational Informatics, Medical Informatics, Computational Biology or a related discipline.
Experience with data mining methodology, common modeling techniques, and presenting data insights
Good analytical skills. You should be able to analyse and interpret complex data from multiple sources using R, Python, SAS, Java, SQL
A broad knowledge of existing data science techniques (such as decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models) and creativity to invent and customized algorithms when necessary
Experienced working in a multinational environment and with cross-functional and/or cross-sector teams
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills
Ability to successfully lead multiple critical priorities/issues
Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both internal and external customers is required
Must be able to travel up to 10% of the time, mainly to domestic destinations.
This position can be based in New Brunswick, NJ; Toronto, Ontario Canada; or Guelph, Ontario Canada.
Preferred
Project Management and / or Process Excellence training / certification
You are a highly motivated individual with demonstrated analytical, communication and social skills. A keen data science curiosity and strong leadership skills are important in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced work environment.
Previous experience within the pharmaceutical, consumer and/or medical device industries
Experience in identifying viable data mining opportunities and then conceive, develop and implement end to end data analytical solutions



Primary Location
United States-New Jersey-New Brunswick-
Other Locations
North America-Canada-Ontario-Toronto, North America-Canada-Ontario-Guelph
Organization
Johnson & Johnson International (6078)

Digital Product Development

Title: CO OP/Intern: Data Analytics
Description:
Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

Responsabilités :

Apporter un soutien aux ingénieurs principaux pour le codage d’algorithmes d’analyse ainsi que participer à l’élaboration d’algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique (ML) et d’intelligence artificielle (IA);
Soutenir les simulations de réseaux en laboratoire servant à valider les algorithmes;
Contribuer aux tests de la codification précédent son déploiement avec les données réelles de réseaux existants.

Activités générales :

Aider l’ingénieur(e) principal(e) en analyse de données à coder et tester des algorithmes.

Travail de collaboration :

Collaboration au jour le jour avec l'ingénieur principal des données sous forme de réunions ou de courriels

Expérience requise :

Bonne connaissances en télécommunication réseautique
Solide expérience en programmation, python, R
Connaissances de base en programmation Linux et shell
Familiarisation avec les services Web (API REST, SOAP)
De l’expérience en science des données et en apprentissage automatique est considérée un atout
De l’expérience en modélisation et en structures de données ainsi qu’en construction d’algorithmes est considérée un atout
___________________________________________________________________________________________

Responsibilities:

Help Senior Engineers code analytics algorithm and work on Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) algorithms
Support lab or simulation network to validate such algorithms
Help test the code once ready for deployment using real network data

General Activities:

Help senior data analysis engineer on coding and testing of algorithm.
Collaboration with stakeholders:
collaboration will be daily with Senior Data engineer via meetings and email

Experience:

Good knowledge of Telecommunication network
Strong coding background, python, R,
Basic knowledge in Linux & shell programming
Basic understanding of Web Services (REST APIs, SOAP)
Experience in Data Sciences & Machine Learning is a plus
Data Modeling, Data Structures, and Algorithms is a plus
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Description:
Organization Description
Headquartered in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, TerraSense Analytics uses and develops remote sensing technologies with a focus on deep learning for sensor intelligence. We are an innovative company, partnered with several research institutions to advance the development of UAV remote sensing technology, providing services to both the government and the private sector in the fields of utilities, natural resources, and security.
We appreciate and support our employees' diverse backgrounds and talents, and see their creativity as our greatest resource. We are developers, data scientists, resource professionals, and biologists living in the Okanagan who understand the industry inside and out. We have expertise with safety procedures, standard operating procedures, copying from Stack Overflow, and legislation and regulations in a variety of jurisdictions.
We strive for true innovation in the field of intelligent remote sensing. Our machine learning team develops custom deep learning solutions in-house to extract information from our sensor data. Our team has delivered Artificial Intelligence powered products to several industry clients and has developed industry-leading expertise in UAV remote sensing analysis using AI. From individual tree counts and species identification, ultrasonic utility monitoring systems, to aerial intelligence and surveillance, our AI Team continues to push the envelope on what is possible with deep learning and sensor data.
Job Requirements & Qualifications
Applicants should have the following experience:
Applicants should be able to program in Python and C++
They will have experience developing and maintaining deployable code
Ideal candidates will have experience developing/training deep learning algorithms
They will be a self-starter and enjoy working on a diversity of tasks in a start-up environment
Job Description
If successful, you will be working with the TerraSense Analytics machine learning team adjacent to UBC Okanagan to develop new AI platforms for the utilities, natural resource, and defense sectors. Integrating deep learning into deployable software will be your primary objective.
You will work to develop research-grade code as well as deploy industry-grade software solutions utilizing deep learning algorithms. Working closely with our data scientists who will provide you with high-quality datasets and even models, you will solve the challenges of creating deployable machine learning solutions at the edge.
Working in a start-up environment means working closely with a multidisciplinary team, including imaging specialists, data scientists, and other developers. Identifying creative solutions to challenging problems will be a constant part of this role, whether it be in data fusion, ensembles of neural networks, human-computer interaction and explainable AI, or IOT solutions.
*
*
Bonus Job Qualifications
The following skills count for bonus points:
Working with image / audio data processing, signal processing
A well-curated GitHub portfolio / open source contribution
Experience working with ‘cloud’ compute infrastructure (AWS, GCP)
Experience building GUI / interface using ( QT, C#)
Experience working with industrial IOT solutions ( LoRa, SigFox)
Due to the volume of applications we receive, only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
Machine Learning: 3 years (Required)
Language:
English (Required)

Title: TM1/Planning Analytics (PA) Developer, Omnia AI
Description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Job Description
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.
As a member of our Data & Analytics Modernization team, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures – be it in the cloud or on-premise – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.
Your role at Deloitte
As a TM1 / Planning Analytics (PA) Developer, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. You will play an active role to implement innovative performance management solutions for our clients, to support enterprise-wide decision-making, improve finance operations, and create impact within their organization. You are enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development.
In this role, you will:
Be engaged in a variety of hands-on development tasks of IBM Cognos TM1/PA solutions, testing and training.
Work with a team of professionals to consult with clients to understand business challenges.
Identify business requirements
Design and prototype solutions.
Qualifications
1+ years hands-on experience building models with IBM Cognos TM1/PA or other widely used planning and/or analytics applications such as Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC, Adaptive Insights, etc.
Strong level Microsoft Excel and data manipulation skills
Willingness for travel
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience
Proven skills as a team member, team lead or project manager on at least one full life cycle implementation
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Ability to collaborate with clients
We also value:
Relevant hands-on experience implementing IBM Cognos TM1/PA
Strong functional knowledge around financial systems and processes
If you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. The TM1/PA Developer role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.
The time is right for you to join Deloitte. Get your career off to great start. What impact will you make?
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.
At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.
Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.
Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Title: Software Developer, University Graduate
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with Data Structures or Algorithms (i.e. data structures /algorithms class, coursework/projects, research, internships, or other practical experience in/outside of school or work (including open source hobby coding).
Software development experience coding in a general purpose programming language.
Examples of coding in one of the following programming languages including but not limited to: C, C++, Java, JavaScript or Python.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience programming with two or more of the following languages: C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Go and/or Python.
Experience working one or more of the following: web or mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages.
Working proficiency in verbal and written English.
Ability to start in 2020.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.
Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Specific responsibilities may vary, but in general may include:
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
Take on tasks as requested, following through to completion despite roadblocks or distractions.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Data Scientist/Artificial Intelligence Expert
Description:
RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary

The AIPHL lab of McGill University Health Center and Department of radiology is looking for a data scientist as part of a multi-disciplinary clinical team for developing medical AI applications
The successful candidate will be joining a dynamic team within an academic health center and leading research and development in medical applications of AI in collaboration with other academic groups as well as industry partners.
The approach will be open and multi-disciplinary, including working with different medical specialties within the hospital as well as collaborators from other institutions including health centers, non-medical academic groups with AI expertise, and industry.

General Duties

The candidate would be expected to take a leadership role under the supervision of the principle investigators in overseeing and developing optimal strategies and developing of algorithms for various AI applications that include but is not limited to analysis of medical images such as CT and MRI scans.
The candidate would be working with other team members within and outside the lab and would be expected to oversee successful completion of different projects conducted by the team from a data science perspective.
Provide supervision to trainees and necessary training to other lab members and/or trainees.
The successful candidate would be expected to take a leadership position and lead projects to completion.
Participate in grant writing, and manuscript preparation.
https://rimuhc.ca/en
Education / Experience
Should have a PhD degree
A successful candidate should have a strong background in machine learning applications including deep learning applications for medical image analysis.
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing would be a bonus.
Familiarity with medical physics and/or imaging would be an asset but not a requirement.
Knowledge/experience in radiomics would be an asset but not a requirement
Outgoing, excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiatives, set priorities, time-manage, and resolve problems
Additional information
Status : Full time
Pay Scale: Salary competitive based of candidate’s qualifications and experience
Work Shift: 8am – 4pm, as per standard
Work Site: MUHC RI and department of radiology

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Category: Engineering
Department/Group: AI
Position Type: Full-time – Permanent
Location: Montreal
Manager: Scott Dickson Dagondon
About us
Born in one of North America’s largest hubs for Artificial Intelligence, Motorleaf is able to disrupt the agricultural industry by using its software platform to monitor and predict for large commercial greenhouse clients and indoor farmers. Delivering actionable, data-driven insights to greenhouse operators to increase their bottom-line profits is the name of the game.
Using machine learning and artificial intelligence for yield predictions and optimization, we are committed to helping greenhouse operators match their supply with demand dynamics to help them optimize their marketing dollars, plan their labour needs, and increase profit margins. Motorleaf is a software company with products that change the way food and crop producers run their businesses.
We are an equal opportunity employer with a culture that thrives on radical innovation and creativity. We are a close team and our motto is to work hard, play hard and always find time to laugh. We offer comprehensive employee benefits, a stock option plan and enjoy several team events. Located in Cote St Paul across from the canal on St Patrick, employees can enjoy a nice walk or a bike ride during breaks.
Job Function
Reporting to the Director of Artificial Intelligence, the Data Scientist will be responsible for training and testing machine learning and AI algorithms that solve complex problems in controlled environment farming. You will also be responsible for engineering the process of extracting, porting, and parsing huge amounts of climate data from greenhouses. You will design robust and scalable data models, and define data integrity metrics. The ideal candidate must be comfortable working with scripting languages, and familiar with API and cloud technology.
Soft Skills:
The candidate must be dedicated, focused, and well-organized – analyzing huge amounts of data requires a deep interest in problem space, and the ability to target clear goals and execute plans.
You must be both a forward thinker and a challenge-seeker – simple solutions work most times, other times you have to look at problem upside down.
You must have excellent documentation and communication skills – whether you’re stuck in a problem or have just discovered something amazing, your co-workers (and other stakeholders) will want to hear about it!
Technical Skills:
Degree in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science and/or relevant work experience.
Open to fresh graduates with extensive and relevant coding portfolio.
Experience with scripting languages
Basic to intermediate level statistics
Machine learning frameworks
Familiarity with data mining and/or data modeling
Familiarity with APIs and cloud technology
Responsibilities:
Design AI/machine learning algorithms that model, predict, or identify multiple complex indoor farming variables
Design and develop efficient systems to move data from the clients to our platform
Identify data problems and automate corrective measures
Differentiate between data and information – always be ready to answer the question: What do the numbers mean?
Develop and find methods of efficient data storage and visualization
Understand and measure the effects of various data input to algorithm accuracy
Conduct system simulations prior to production deployment
Simulate bugs in data handling and develop corrective measures
Contribute ideas for new features and products in the Motorleaf ecosystem
submit your application to info@motorleaf.com

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Machine Learning/AI)
Description:
The Startup
Briq is altering the landscape for construction decision making. We are harnessing the power of data to build the industry's first construction data cloud. Leaders in automation, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Briq is helping construction companies minimize risk and maximize success.
The Skinny
Briq is ready for curious, charismatic, creative people to join the Engineering Team at one of the fastest-growing construction analytics companies.
Our team of strategists, leaders, data scientists, and change-makers are revolutionizing the world by providing data tools that improve decision-making in one of the most predominant industries today. Our clients are among the largest builders in the world; responsible for creating the infrastructure you thrive on and designing the cities you live, work and play in. They are hungry for better, smarter data and we are hungry for your talents to help make it happen.
The Skill
The Briq Engineering team is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to fuel our accelerated growth. We are rapidly growing and ready for someone who harbors a passion for crafting and deploying top quality, high-performing, secure systems to join the Briq family in evolving our platform and changing the world of construction.
The Principal Software Engineer will guide the engineering team in decision-making and best practices; ensuring a consistently high-quality product while:
Driving engineering culture of excellence in partnership with product teams
Leading technical direction on design, implementation, and deployment of software that satisfies the evolving needs of our customers
Coordinating leadership contribution and buy-in to design planning process across Briq products and services
Ensuring the use of data is woven throughout the Briq enterprise
Establishing organizational best-practices scalable across teams and products resulting in consistent, high-quality, industry standard-setting software systems
Building internal and external relationships as a Briq evangelist and thought leader
The Standard
To be successful as a principal software engineer, you will have exceptional leadership, communication and project management skills with a deep understanding of software systems at multiple levels of abstraction and an intrinsic desire to develop the skills and talents of others. You take a keen interest in international trends in engineering and leadership and harbor an above average emotional intelligence. Moreover, your background likely looks a lot like this:
Fifteen (15) years of experience in web-based software development/software engineering, data warehousing, or other client/server applications
Experience with a range of engineering skills including requirements collection, architectural design, documentation organization, and operations management
Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, PhD preferred
Actively participated in a development team operating at large scale
Technically led a team of software developers and demonstrated mentoring skills within the group
Experience with a wide range of programming language paradigms
Experience with relational and noSQL databases
Experience with web development platforms such as Rails
Experience with real world applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning
Proficiency with cloud computing providers such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Services, or Microsoft Azure
The Briq platform is used by construction leaders looking for meaning in their data. You'll join a highly collaborative and passionate engineering and product organization who are on a mission to help people see and understand data, dedicated to building a fantastic company and workplace, and are relentlessly focused on our customers and on building amazing products. Principal software engineers report directly to the CTO and work closely with the director of engineering to support all aspects of developing and operating our products.
Briq is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you think you have what it takes to thrive here, we want you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At MobSquad, we're a team of diverse and curious people who are committed to helping start-ups grow. We write some of the most advanced, useful, and compelling code, and we do it in an environment that values free expression and inquiry. The Squad is bound together by our mutual respect for each other and our hunger to create.

The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a Canada-based team working remotely with a leading US start-up. Your team will operate alongside many other talented developers and data scientists in Canada, and you will be an integral part of the tech community that MobSquad has built.

This role requires someone who has demonstrated an ability to bridge the gap between the theoretical and the practical. The ideal candidate has deployed or attempted to execute Artificial Intelligence theories from various Machine Learning (ML) models and algorithms, and also has some experience in data engineering. MobSquad is looking for proven researchers with a track record of publishing in impactful journals and conferences, or those with years of hands-on industry experience.

This role offers the opportunity to apply your knowledge of statistics and your analytical skills to mine data at scale and develop large-scale ML models to reveal the value in data. You will support feature prototyping and utilize best practices to write production-grade code. You will build data pipelines, implement ML-based analytical algorithms, and work closely with the software development team to set up back-end systems and interfaces that will deliver next-generation analytics.

Qualifications and Skills

An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a comparable analytical field from an accredited institution
Expert in data mining, machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling and data visualization techniques using data-oriented tools and languages such as Python, R, and MATLAB
3+ years experience or demonstrated fluency in relevant programming languages (Python, R, Scala, Java, C/C++/C# a plus)
3+ years experience writing SQL as well as NoSql queries and databases
Experience setting up and using large-scale distributed data-processing frameworks such as Apache Spark and Hadoop Map-Reduce
Experience working with enterprise-grade cloud computing platforms such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS
Demonstrated ability to develop high-quality code adhering to industry best practices (i.e., code review, unit tests, revision control)
Familiarity with designing experiments and collecting data for the purpose of deriving data analytics insights and solutions
Work/project history reflective of a self-motivated professional who excels when given open-ended problems and broadly-defined goals, having an innate desire to discover the patterns and relationships in data that can be leveraged to provide business value
Who You Are

You understand that writing code is as much about functionality as it is about communication, and that shines through in the clarity of your code and how you describe it to your teammates
You are a self-starter who can work autonomously and drive your success within a team
You are comfortable when things go according to plan, and you are energized when chaos strikes and the team's well-laid plans need to be overhauled
You know that start-up life involves continual adaptation and change, and that excites you!
What You'll Get @MobSquad

A full-time position that offers competitive compensation
A benefits program delivered through our bespoke digital platform, giving you control, choice, and flexibility. We give you the ability to build your package of benefits covering health (think medical, dental, vision), wellness (think gym, workout gear, ski pass, massage, transit) and RRSP (think retirement)
A downtown office location with first-rate amenities, surrounded by great restaurants and easily-accessible transit
For international candidates: Sponsorship for an immediate work permit through Canada's Global Talent Stream and in many cases, expedited permanent residency and a path to citizenship
What You'll Experience @MobSquad

Exposure and engagement with world-class start-ups where you will be helping to build the next big thing many times over
A team-based environment where our culture and community are deeply rooted in our core values
A diverse and inclusive workplace; we know conscious and subconscious discrimination exists and we work hard to uncover and remove biases and barriers, so everyone realizes their actual - not perceived - potential
Opportunity. And lots of it.

Title: Software Developer, CUDA

Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide retailers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.

You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.

Technical Skills
