Title: Developer, Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to grow your career by taking on a new role at Bell? We always look for qualified internal applicants within our own team to support their development.

Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.

We have been building our Business Intelligence team and have made tremendous strides in creating the BEST BI environment this industry has seen! As a result, we've been able to provide strategic data guidance and intelligence that has contributed to Bell's success. If you want to work with the latest & greatest BI tools like, Best in Class Teradata, SAS and Hadoop all within an Agile Methodology environment, then this may be the role for you!

If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team. Our people are empowered to make big things happen and are supported by growth, training and personal development opportunities.

Bell is seeking experienced ETL Developers/Data Engineers for both our SAS/Teradata and Hadoop platforms. Please specify which you are interested in when applying. ETL Developers make up a core group of the Data Engineering team and are responsible for the creation of the well structured and organized data asset leveraged across Customer Operations and many other Business Units in Bell for advanced analytics, reporting, and a number of other functions. In these roles you will help guide the evolution of the Business Intelligence Data Lake and have opportunities to work on projects spanning a wide variety of data sources driving our most strategic data initiatives.

Much of the work is project based and you will be required to work closely with project managers and business stakeholders to ensure target completion dates are met. The role requires you to work with the business to understand high level requirements and then design an optimized and scalable solution using either SAS/Teradata or Hadoop. You may also have the opportunity to work with many of our other BI tool stack including visualization tools, virtualization tools, metadata tools, and open source technologies.

This is a great opportunity to work on a team that is continually pushing the limits of driving value through data. The opportunities for growth are endless as the ecosystem is continually evolving and we are investing in people and technology to stay current.

Skills:
Expert level ETL/ELT skills to aggregate, filter and manipulate large data sets on either SAS/Teradata or Hadoop.
Code and design optimization to produce efficient and scalable production ready code
Documentation of all development code with logical error/exception handling to reduce complexity for the Production Support team.
Ability to debug/enhance code written by other developers including understanding the business logic implemented.
Ability to work closely with business stakeholders to translate ambiguous requirements into efficient code to deliver expected results.
Experience reading and understanding business documents (SRS, BRD).
Able to prioritize, multitask and execute tasks in a high pressure environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills is required.
Proven thought leadership to drive continuous improvement in processes and identify new opportunities related to data pipelines
The Hadoop role also has some focus on working with emerging technologies in the Open Source ecosystem (Kafka, Containers, APIs, etc.) related to Data Engineering but not necessarily ELT specific.

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years ETL/ELT experience
5+ year of SQL experience or 5+ years of programming languages such as Python, Java, Spark C++, C#, etc.
2+ years in ETL/ELT code optimization
Proven experience using ETL tools such as SAS Data Integration Studio (or equivalent) or Proven experience in developing Big Data ingestion/transformation frameworks in Spark
Experience in the telecom industry is an asset
Experience in Kafka and Container technologies is an asset

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Regular - Full Time
Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Application Deadline: 10/04/2019

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.

Created: Canada, ON, Toronto

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Machine Learning/AI)
Description:
The Startup
Briq is altering the landscape for construction decision making. We are harnessing the power of data to build the industry's first construction data cloud. Leaders in automation, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Briq is helping construction companies minimize risk and maximize success.
The Skinny
Briq is ready for curious, charismatic, creative people to join the Engineering Team at one of the fastest-growing construction analytics companies.
Our team of strategists, leaders, data scientists, and change-makers are revolutionizing the world by providing data tools that improve decision-making in one of the most predominant industries today. Our clients are among the largest builders in the world; responsible for creating the infrastructure you thrive on and designing the cities you live, work and play in. They are hungry for better, smarter data and we are hungry for your talents to help make it happen.
The Skill
The Briq Engineering team is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to fuel our accelerated growth. We are rapidly growing and ready for someone who harbors a passion for crafting and deploying top quality, high-performing, secure systems to join the Briq family in evolving our platform and changing the world of construction.
The Principal Software Engineer will guide the engineering team in decision-making and best practices; ensuring a consistently high-quality product while:
Driving engineering culture of excellence in partnership with product teams
Leading technical direction on design, implementation, and deployment of software that satisfies the evolving needs of our customers
Coordinating leadership contribution and buy-in to design planning process across Briq products and services
Ensuring the use of data is woven throughout the Briq enterprise
Establishing organizational best-practices scalable across teams and products resulting in consistent, high-quality, industry standard-setting software systems
Building internal and external relationships as a Briq evangelist and thought leader
The Standard
To be successful as a principal software engineer, you will have exceptional leadership, communication and project management skills with a deep understanding of software systems at multiple levels of abstraction and an intrinsic desire to develop the skills and talents of others. You take a keen interest in international trends in engineering and leadership and harbor an above average emotional intelligence. Moreover, your background likely looks a lot like this:
Fifteen (15) years of experience in web-based software development/software engineering, data warehousing, or other client/server applications
Experience with a range of engineering skills including requirements collection, architectural design, documentation organization, and operations management
Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, PhD preferred
Actively participated in a development team operating at large scale
Technically led a team of software developers and demonstrated mentoring skills within the group
Experience with a wide range of programming language paradigms
Experience with relational and noSQL databases
Experience with web development platforms such as Rails
Experience with real world applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning
Proficiency with cloud computing providers such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Services, or Microsoft Azure
The Briq platform is used by construction leaders looking for meaning in their data. You'll join a highly collaborative and passionate engineering and product organization who are on a mission to help people see and understand data, dedicated to building a fantastic company and workplace, and are relentlessly focused on our customers and on building amazing products. Principal software engineers report directly to the CTO and work closely with the director of engineering to support all aspects of developing and operating our products.
Briq is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you think you have what it takes to thrive here, we want you!

Title: Data Scientist/Artificial Intelligence Expert
Description:
Job Description
RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary

The AIPHL lab of McGill University Health Center and Department of radiology is looking for a data scientist as part of a multi-disciplinary clinical team for developing medical AI applications
The successful candidate will be joining a dynamic team within an academic health center and leading research and development in medical applications of AI in collaboration with other academic groups as well as industry partners.
The approach will be open and multi-disciplinary, including working with different medical specialties within the hospital as well as collaborators from other institutions including health centers, non-medical academic groups with AI expertise, and industry.
General Duties

The candidate would be expected to take a leadership role under the supervision of the principle investigators in overseeing and developing optimal strategies and developing of algorithms for various AI applications that include but is not limited to analysis of medical images such as CT and MRI scans.
The candidate would be working with other team members within and outside the lab and would be expected to oversee successful completion of different projects conducted by the team from a data science perspective.
Provide supervision to trainees and necessary training to other lab members and/or trainees.
The successful candidate would be expected to take a leadership position and lead projects to completion.
Participate in grant writing, and manuscript preparation.
Website of the organization
https://rimuhc.ca/en

Education / Experience
Should have a PhD degree
A successful candidate should have a strong background in machine learning applications including deep learning applications for medical image analysis.
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing would be a bonus.
Familiarity with medical physics and/or imaging would be an asset but not a requirement.
Knowledge/experience in radiomics would be an asset but not a requirement
Outgoing, excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiatives, set priorities, time-manage, and resolve problems
Additional information
Status : Full time
Pay Scale : Salary competitive based of candidate’s qualifications and experience
Work Shift : 8am – 4pm, as per standard
Work Site : MUHC RI and department of radiology

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

Title: Data Scientist - KTP Associate
Description:
An exciting opportunity is available to take ownership of a leading-edge KTP project in a collaboration between the University of Reading and Optimal Monitoring Ltd. The project is to develop an automated artificial intelligence system to analyse natural language user feedback and incorporate this into a software tool to address exceptional utility consumption in business premises. The project is in the forefront of the market and the position is a 24-month fixed term contract. It’s likely the project will continue beyond the KTP therefore, there is potential for a successful candidate to continue with the company beyond the initial two years.
About Optimal Monitoring:
Established in 1994 Optimal Monitoring develops a web based energy monitoring and analytics platform, which collects disparate data and produces simple to understand actionable reports automatically. We help organisations use less electricity, gas and water. Find out more by visiting: www.optimalmonitoring.com
About KTP:
This position forms part of the Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) funded by Innovate UK. It’s essential you understand how KTP works with business and the University, and the vital role you will play if you successfully secure a KTP Associate position.
Skill development through training:
Additionally there is a £4k dedicated training budget for you to tailor to your own personal development plus attendance on residential management skills training modules.
The successful candidate must possess:
Minimum First Class degree or Masters degree in Computer Science with specialisation in natural language processing or machine learning or relevant areas
Knowledge of machine learning, NLP and signal processing
Programming in Python
Essential skills we require as a minimum:
Able to develop a sound understanding of the energy and utility sector, along with the ability to quickly learn existing technical systems within the company
An appetite for commercial awareness with strong self-motivation with a desire to drive a project forward
Effective communication to both technical and non technical audiences
Interview date: 6 November 2019

Informal contact details
Alternative informal contact details

Academic Supervisor
Contact role:

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Description:
Organization Description
Headquartered in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, TerraSense Analytics uses and develops remote sensing technologies with a focus on deep learning for sensor intelligence. We are an innovative company, partnered with several research institutions to advance the development of UAV remote sensing technology, providing services to both the government and the private sector in the fields of utilities, natural resources, and security.
We appreciate and support our employees' diverse backgrounds and talents, and see their creativity as our greatest resource. We are developers, data scientists, resource professionals, and biologists living in the Okanagan who understand the industry inside and out. We have expertise with safety procedures, standard operating procedures, copying from Stack Overflow, and legislation and regulations in a variety of jurisdictions.
We strive for true innovation in the field of intelligent remote sensing. Our machine learning team develops custom deep learning solutions in-house to extract information from our sensor data. Our team has delivered Artificial Intelligence powered products to several industry clients and has developed industry-leading expertise in UAV remote sensing analysis using AI. From individual tree counts and species identification, ultrasonic utility monitoring systems, to aerial intelligence and surveillance, our AI Team continues to push the envelope on what is possible with deep learning and sensor data.
Job Requirements & Qualifications
Applicants should have the following experience:
Applicants should be able to program in Python and C++
They will have experience developing and maintaining deployable code
Ideal candidates will have experience developing/training deep learning algorithms
They will be a self-starter and enjoy working on a diversity of tasks in a start-up environment
Job Description
If successful, you will be working with the TerraSense Analytics machine learning team adjacent to UBC Okanagan to develop new AI platforms for the utilities, natural resource, and defense sectors. Integrating deep learning into deployable software will be your primary objective.
You will work to develop research-grade code as well as deploy industry-grade software solutions utilizing deep learning algorithms. Working closely with our data scientists who will provide you with high-quality datasets and even models, you will solve the challenges of creating deployable machine learning solutions at the edge.
Working in a start-up environment means working closely with a multidisciplinary team, including imaging specialists, data scientists, and other developers. Identifying creative solutions to challenging problems will be a constant part of this role, whether it be in data fusion, ensembles of neural networks, human-computer interaction and explainable AI, or IOT solutions.
*
*
Bonus Job Qualifications
The following skills count for bonus points:
Working with image / audio data processing, signal processing
A well-curated GitHub portfolio / open source contribution
Experience working with ‘cloud’ compute infrastructure (AWS, GCP)
Experience building GUI / interface using ( QT, C#)
Experience working with industrial IOT solutions ( LoRa, SigFox)
Due to the volume of applications we receive, only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
Machine Learning: 3 years (Required)
Language:
English (Required)

Title: Data Scientist, Data Science & Risk Management
Description:
Johnson & Johnson, Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCCP) is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist, to join the Data Science & Risk Management Team.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer

The Data Scientist is a core member of the Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCC&P) Global Operations Center of Excellence team, reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Science & Risk Management. You will be responsible for partnering with Global Operations team members (Compliance & Technology Integration, Testing & Monitoring, Regional Centers of Excellence); the Franchise / Company HCC&P Compliance Officers and business partners to identify, develop and implement innovative solutions that enhance our data, analytic & visualization capabilities.
As the Data Scientist:
You will be responsible for Identifying and understanding key business questions to be addressed using the appropriate analytical approaches
You will model data to build innovative solutions to solve complex analytical problems;
You will lead or support projects that will facilitate advancement in predictive analytics;
You will develop methodologies that allow for efficient and repetitive data extraction; using existing and new data bases (structured & unstructured) focused on identifying potential compliance risk areas
You will provide input/recommendations to the Data Science & Risk Management Governance team regarding development, standardization and delivery prioritization
You will partner with Data Science & Risk Management and Compliance & Technology Integration team members to evaluate and develop system platforms and technology to enhance our data science capabilities



Qualifications
Required:
A minimum of a Master’s degree with 2 years of experience or Ph.D degree in, Computer Sciences, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Computational Informatics, Medical Informatics, Computational Biology or a related discipline.
Experience with data mining methodology, common modeling techniques, and presenting data insights
Good analytical skills. You should be able to analyse and interpret complex data from multiple sources using R, Python, SAS, Java, SQL
A broad knowledge of existing data science techniques (such as decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models) and creativity to invent and customized algorithms when necessary
Experienced working in a multinational environment and with cross-functional and/or cross-sector teams
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills
Ability to successfully lead multiple critical priorities/issues
Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both internal and external customers is required
Must be able to travel up to 10% of the time, mainly to domestic destinations.
This position can be based in New Brunswick, NJ; Toronto, Ontario Canada; or Guelph, Ontario Canada.
Preferred
Project Management and / or Process Excellence training / certification
You are a highly motivated individual with demonstrated analytical, communication and social skills. A keen data science curiosity and strong leadership skills are important in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced work environment.
Previous experience within the pharmaceutical, consumer and/or medical device industries
Experience in identifying viable data mining opportunities and then conceive, develop and implement end to end data analytical solutions



Primary Location
United States-New Jersey-New Brunswick-
Other Locations
North America-Canada-Ontario-Toronto, North America-Canada-Ontario-Guelph
Organization
Johnson & Johnson International (6078)
Job Function
Digital Product Development
Requisition ID
4073190905

Title: Computer vision expert / artificial intelligence team
Description:
You are passionate about sport and AI? Then we like you :) We are looking for an expert in the application of deep learning to computer vision. You will develop and deploy algorithms of image classification, object detection and image captioning applied to sport. You will be a strong contributor or lead the development of the image recognition API, available on our developers portal (https://developers.decathlon.com/products). You will share your projects and knowledge within and outside the company, and contribute to the Sports Tech and AI ecosystem in Montreal.
Requirements
What we are looking for
A passion for sport
Great soft skills (teamwork, communication, sharing mindset)
Strong programming skills (preferably in Python/Tensorflow/Keras)
2+ years of experience and demonstrated skills in image classification, object detection and/or image captioning
Experience in AI model deployment
Experience with GCP
Good knowledge of APIs/AI products
What we will provide you
The opportunity to grow your skills. We care deeply about letting you learn new skills and innovate
The opportunity to tailor your job around what you believe in. You care about hosting a meetup, to share your knowledge? There's a new algorithms you want to try, that you believe will make sport more accessible? We will give you the opportunity to try it
A stimulating work environment, surrounded by a growing team of sport enthusiasts
A stimulating work place, with focus rooms, a lounge, afterhours and the possibility to work remotely and in our network of stores
The opportunity to connect with our network of data science teams in 16 countries
The opportunity to make a difference across a variety of projects and topics
Benefits
Working at Decathlon Canada
Monthly bonuses based on Decathlon Canada performance
Social benefits and coverage

Title: Machine Learning/ AI Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence Engineer

Are you ready for a career change to somewhere where you can really make a difference, be constantly challenged and be in an environment that offers you the opportunity to…
Work with an international and strong team where each and every member’s opinion matters
Have flexible working hours, home office and learning & development opportunities
Build up our fast-growing team in downtown Montreal (team size increased 5x over a year)
Then please check out what we do and who we are at https://www.jumio.com

If we have your attention now, then please check out whether this is the role for you.

Your daily responsibilities:
Develop machine learning algorithms in collaboration with top notch R&D engineers
Closely work with the product and engineering teams to ensure our products are leading on the marketplace
Drive research projects to enable future product development
Expertise, Knowledge and Skills you need:
Strong experience in Machine Learning
Background in Computer Vision and/or Natural Language Processing
Strong background in Python with production-grade coding
Experience with Tensorflow, Keras, or other frameworks
Experience with scikit-learn, OpenCV, pandas
Published ML/CV articles and ability to implement published papers
Data-driven mindset
Think further than the solution appears to require and go the extra mile
Excellent analytical, conceptual and communication skills in spoken and written English
Fast learner, high capacity for abstract thinking and structured approach to work
Hands-on mentality and international mindset
The will to learn new things and bring in new ideas
We offer an annual competitive full time salary based on qualifications and experience, plus we offer a success sharing plan for all employees

Title: Customer Service Representative, Cablevision
Description:
Req Id: 239429

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.
Description:
The service we provide is the foundation of Bell's competitive advantage and a critical step in achieving the company's goal: that Bell be recognized by customers as Canada's premier communications company.

You are someone who:
Can interact easily with customers
Has strong communication and problem-solving skills
Is a team player

Your time will be spent tackling the following challenges:
Answering customer calls regarding sales, billing, claims and various requests concerning Cablevision products and services
Checking the accuracy of information contained in customer files and making any necessary corrections
Promoting the company's different offers
Performing any other related tasks

The selected candidate must have:
A High school diploma is required
Pertinent customer service experience
Solid knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite and the Internet

Working conditions :
Employment status: Regular - Full Time
Work location : 45 Hôtel de Ville blvd, Val D'Or
Work schedule: Monday to Friday between 8h00 AM – 5H00PM
We offer excellent working conditions and a competitive salary

Bilingualism is required (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:
Position Type: Non Management
Job Status: Regular - Full Time
Job Location: Canada : Quebec : Val-d'Or
Application Deadline: 09/29/2019

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Job #: 199395

Currently we are seeking individuals for the following position, please take note that this position is time sensitive and we advise you to apply immediately and express your skills and abilities that pertains to the job description.
If you are an experienced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Specialist looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help!
***** Opportunity with a top Client in Automotive Industry *****
Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Specialist
12 Months Contract (Long Term Contracts, Extension available)
Oshawa, ON
The Opportunity
Being part of the innovation team, you will support activities involving cross-functional teams of engineers.
You will work on diverse range of projects including, Natural Language Processing, Time Series data and Computer Vision.
You will not only be surrounded by experienced AI/ML specialists, but also by Domains experts and AI/ML software leads to complement your work and help push it to production level software.
The latest hardware and software IT support including High Performance Computers will be made available to run seamless training and testing tasks.
We are looking for individuals who can demonstrate innovation, creativity, initiative and a high level of independent judgment.
However, to truly help us in driving the future of technology, you must share a genuine passion for technology and mobility systems.
What We Need You To Do
Write well commented, efficient (memory & processing power) and version-controlled AI related software code (NLP, Image Processing and Time Series Data)
Collaborate with the product owner and the rest of the team to understand key functional and operational properties of each project
Collaborate on integrating core AI functions into production ready software
Interface with various cross-functional teams to align with global specifications
Stay ahead of the technology curve and in tune with competitive products
Documenting and co-authoring internal technical specifications, and patents


Qualifications
Must have:
Master’s or PhD in Engineering, or related degree; Electrical, Mechatronics, Computer Vision, Computer or Systems Design
0-1+ Years' experience
Familiar with programming in Python (Tensorflow/Keras/PyTorch, etc..) and versioning tools
Expertise in one or more of the following machine learning domains: Image Processing, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Speech/Signal processing
Advanced knowledge in deep learning algorithms
Development skills to rapidly deliver minimum viable products

Preferred:
Experience in data visualization tools and methods (Tableau, Matplotlib, Power BI, etc..)
Knowledge in ensemble and online learning
Experience with SQL and other Database related languages
Familiar with parallel computing using GPUs and Unix based systems

Title: Unity Developer
Description:
Don’t miss this one. Join one of the fastest growing tech companies around as a Unity Developer. Come and work on the hottest applications & experiences for a range of diverse clients across a range of platforms.
From mobile applications to AR/VR, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, and IoT products, the successful candidate will get to work on selection of innovative products for clients like Lululemon, Enbridge and Microsoft, just to mention a few.
We’re looking for a talented Unity developer, with great technical skills, and a desire to own their work, as well as an eagerness to learn and grow. We’re looking for developers who can work with teams (other developers, designers, artists and QA) and have a proven track record of shipping software.
We need someone with the confidence and skills to champion and drive best-in-class interactive design experiences for discerning clients.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate in small teams to design, develop and deploy high quality apps and games
Estimate tasks and manage time effectively
Embrace new technologies and have an eagerness to learn
Develop experiences in the Unity engine using C#
Work closely with the other developers, designers, artists and QA to develop and polish features
Use tools such as Visual Studio, Git and JIRA.
Work from our offices, or on-site with a client (as necessary)
QUALIFICATIONS
2-year Computer Science diploma, or equivalent experience
Passionate about creating high quality products and software development
Developed and deployed one or more Unity apps or games
Proficient in C#, and object-oriented programming concepts
Knowledge of common code architectural patterns and anti-patterns
Strong 3D math skills, including but not limited to: practical knowledge of vectors and vector operations, matrix and matrix transformations, Euler angles and quaternions
Understanding of the software development lifecycle
Good communicator with the ability to work in a team environment
Ability to find creative solutions to difficult problems
NICE TO HAVES
AR/VR or console game development experience
Proficient in C++
Experience with native development for iOS or Android
Experience integrating web services and public APIs using JSON
TO APPLY
Please submit your Resume and Cover Letter
All candidates must be willing and able to work onsite
Please ensure that you are eligible to work in Canada prior to sending your application
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, regret to inform only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Junior Full Stack Developer
Description:
Based in Toronto, Fortran Traffic Systems Limited is a leader in the North American traffic industry and at the forefront of innovation in intelligent transportation management systems. With the arrival of transportation technologies such as Connected Vehicle/Automated Vehicle (CVAV) and Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X), Fortran is advancing its platforms to harness the multitude of benefits that these emerging technologies can provide to road operators and traffic management agencies. Fortran offers a challenging environment, rich in R&D, that fosters creativity and rewards excellence.
Job description
The Junior Full Stack Developer will be entrusted to develop cutting-edge software solutions for the next-generation of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) designed and produced by Fortran.
Recent graduates are encouraged to apply.
The successful candidate will be an integral part of a team developing high performance and sustainable V2X and ITS systems. Responsibilities include:
Utilizing quality focused software development practices and standards to develop full stack software solutions
Performing detailed analysis, design, unit-level code development, software integration and testing
Analyzing complex functions, procedures and problems to deliver creative, logical, and effective solutions that meets the specified requirements
Conducting / participating in design and code reviews, identifying potential problems and performance issues, providing feedback and corrections and evaluating code compliance to standards
Preparation of application operational / procedural documentation for users and technical support staff
Requirements
Experience and working knowledge in the following areas:
Web-based front-end application framework and web-based UI programming
Understanding of web development languages and technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavasScript/jQuery and NodeJS
SQL and NoSQL experience including (PostgresDB/PostGIS and MongoDB)
C++ back-end programming
Linux (or Unix) environment Operating systems principles and communication protocols
Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Organized, focused and persistent with the ability to work to the plan and meet delivery dates
Excellent problem solver and quick learner
Further consideration will be given to candidates that possess:
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Machine Learning, Data Mining or Machine Intelligence (Artificial Intelligence)
Real-time software development experience
Native mobile app development (Android or iOS)
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Développeur QA de logiciels - Software Developer in Test
Description:
Company Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Today, we have some exciting news to share, as we officially announce the name of Nuance’s upcoming Automotive spin-off: Cerence! Upon spinning off from Nuance on October 1, our Automotive team will begin a new journey as Cerence, a pure-play, next-generation automotive software company fully focused on providing intelligent mobility solutions to our customers. “Cer” that rhymes with “air,” “ence” that rhymes with “sense,” Cerence is a new word for a new company. Visit cerence.com to follow along with our journey!

C’est avec fierté que nous vous annonçons aujourd’hui le nom de la nouvelle société issue de la scission de la division Automobile de Nuance qui sera : Cerence ! À la suite de la scission, notre division automobile entamera une nouvelle aventure sous le nom de Cerence, une société de logiciels automobiles de nouvelle génération, entièrement dédiée à fournir des solutions de mobilité intelligentes à nos clients. "Cer" qui rime avec "air", "ence" qui rime avec "sens", Cerence est un nouveau mot pour une nouvelle entreprise. Visitez cerence.com pour suivre notre voyage!
Job Summary / Sommaire du poste:
*English will follow*
Résumé :

L’équipe du serveur de traitement des langues naturelles (STLN) est responsable de la conception, du développement et de l’intégration de divers modules logiciels dans un environnement d’applications langagières comprenant des applications d’assistant personnel pour les plus grands fabricants de téléphones, de voitures et d’autres appareils intelligents.

Nous proposons à un développeur QA de logiciels l’occasion formidable de se joindre à une équipe de renommée internationale et de bâtir des fonctionnalités de serveurs qui sont au cœur des applications d’agents virtuels de Nuance alimentées par toute une gamme de technologies de pointe, comme la reconnaissance vocale, la compréhension des langues naturelles, l’intelligence artificielle, les données massives, l’infonuagique et plus encore.

Responsabilités :
Bâtir des essais de haut niveau pour les services infonuagiques liés au STLN
Collaborer avec les équipes de la recherche et développement, des gestionnaires de produits et des activités pour assurer la satisfaction de la clientèle sur toute la ligne
Participer aux sessions de conception technique des solutions
Contribuer à la résolution de problèmes d’assurance qualité de l’ingénierie en évaluant les différentes technologies et les divers outils
Travailler dans un environnement AGILE en intégration continue et la livraison continue
Concevoir et développer des projets d’assurance qualité de bout en bout, de développement des automatisations et de test d’exécution.
Effectuer les tâches liées à la sécurité et à la conservation des produits, outils et processus sous sa responsabilité.

Années d’expérience de travail :
De 2 à 4 ans

Compétences requises
Très bonne connaissance des normes d’assurance qualité comme la gestion des défauts, les tests de fumée, les tests de régression, les tests de caractéristiques, les tests de chargement et de rendement, etc.
Expérience avérée du scriptage, dont les scripts bash, shell ou python
Expérience avec l’environnement de développement Java
Expérience de programmation de systèmes d’exploitation répartis (avec les protocoles HTTP et REST, WebSockets, SOAP et gRPC)
Expérience des essais d’applications infonuagiques natives à l’aide de Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
Capacité d’analyser et de résoudre des problèmes complexes de façon rapide et créative
Bonnes aptitudes de communication écrite et orale; le langage d’entreprise est l’anglais
Excellent esprit d’équipe; savoir travailler avec des collègues à distance et de façon indépendante

Compétences privilégiées

Bonne connaissance de JavaScript et des autres éléments côté clients des applications Web
Connaissance de base en informatique Configuration et mise à niveau des machines et des systèmes d’essai

Études :
Baccalauréat ou diplôme d’études supérieures en génie électrique, en génie informatique, en informatique ou l’équivalent

Summary:

The Natural Language Processing Server (NLPS) team is responsible for designing, developing and integrating multiple software modules for the speech application environment, including multi-modal, personal agent applications for some of the world’s largest phone, automobile and other smart devices manufacturers.

We have an exciting opportunity for a software developer in test to join a world-class team building server-side functionality that is at core of all Nuance's virtual agent applications powered by a diverse array of state-of-the-art technologies such as voice recognition, natural language understanding, artificial intelligence, big data, cloud computing, and more.

Responsibilities:

2-4 years

Required Skills:
Strong understanding of standard QA practices such as defect management, smoke tests, regressions tests, feature tests, load and performance tests, etc.
Good scripting experience e.g. bash, shell, python
Experience with Java development
Experience with distributed systems programming (protocols: HTTP/REST, WebSockets, SOAP, gRPC)
Experience with testing cloud native applications using Docker, Kubernetes etc.
Have the ability to analyze and solve complex problems quickly and creatively.
Good written and verbal communication skills; the language of business is English.
Strong team player, working also with remote peers, independent

Preferred Skills:

Good knowledge of JavaScript and other aspects of client-side web applications
Basic IT-knowledge: Setup and maintenance of test machines/systems

Education:
Bachelors or Graduate University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent

Title: Compute DSP/AI Systems Engineer
Description:
Location
Canada - Markham

Job Overview
Qualcomm is a company of inventors that unlocked 5G ushering in an age of rapid acceleration in connectivity and new possibilities that will transform industries, create jobs, and enrich lives. But this is just the beginning. It takes inventive minds with diverse skills, backgrounds, and cultures to transform 5Gs potential into world-changing technologies and products. This is the Invention Age - and this is where you come in. Do you ever wonder when will connected devices become thinking devices? Be part of the group that is working on technology that will bring Cognition to all connected devices: That means devices that dont just think, but instinctively react to their surroundings. We are searching for a Machine Learning based Systems Engineer to be part of the Compute DSP/ AI Processor systems team responsible for developing machine learning based applications and use cases developed for Qualcomm Snapdragon processors. The candidate will contribute to the research, design, integration and/or commercialization of Multi-Media applications and use cases that bring artificial intelligence to Qualcomm Snapdragon DSP and AI processors in real time at low power and high accuracy. The responsibilities of this role include:
Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; Impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct).
Using verbal and written communication skills to convey basic, routine factual information about day-to-day activities to others who are fully knowledgeable in the subject area.
Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.
Exercising some creativity to troubleshoot technical problems or deal with novel circumstances.
Using deductive problem solving to solve moderately complex problems; most problems have defined processes of diagnosis/detection; some limited data analysis may be required. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Executes individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Communicates with project lead via email and direct conversation to provide status and information about impending obstacles.
Regularly discusses issues with team lead and peers to maintain open communication.
Collaborates with individuals inside own team to complete the team's work.
Adapts to changes and setbacks in order to manage pressure and meet deadlines with some supervision.
Actively seeks answers for new challenges.
Collaborates with project team to accomplish project objectives.
Avoids distractions and deals with setbacks in a timely manner
Seeks out learning opportunities to increase own knowledge and skill.
Escalates technical issues to an appropriate party (e.g., project lead, colleagues).
Contributes to conversations during technical team discussion.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor or masters degree in electrical or computer engineering or related fields

Preferred Qualifications
Basic understanding of operating systems concepts such as synchronization and memory management; Understanding of general SoC hardware architecture Excellent programming skills in Python Strong knowledge of C/C++ Strong knowledge of real-time embedded development Knowledge of the ARM development environment a plus Knowledge of Embedded Linux and\or Win Mobile a plus Knowledge of Java/Android a plus Basic understanding of machine learning algorithms and frameworks like Tensorflow is a plus; Basic understanding of image and video processing and computer vision algorithms is a plus; Strong motivation and capabilities in learning new subjects especially in the field of artificial intelligence; Strong academic records; Strong problem-solving skills; Effective interpersonal communications skill (written and verbal); Analytical, thorough, resourceful and detail-oriented; Self-motivated, hardworking, and flexible.


Education Requirements
Bachelor or masters degree in electrical or computer engineering or related fields

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable insurance companies to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide insurers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.
Duration: Permanent
Location: Keele and Steeles (TTC Accessible, free parking). Moving to Downtown Toronto soon.
Job Description
You will work with the data engineering at Daisy Intelligence and act as a valued member of the Research & Development team. You will be conducting applied research in the areas of farud detection optimization, biomimicry, statistics, machine learning, reinforcement learning, visualization and numerical methods.
Daisy Intelligence solutions involve modeling vast volumes of our clients' data, which requires leading edge computing and machine learning methods. You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.
Key Accountabilities
Mathematical model research, as well as literature research.
Mathematical models for fraud detection and risk management
Software solution design, programming development and testing.
Documenting and co-authoring internal research papers and patents.
Commercialization of successful applied research into software products that will be used by Daisy Intelligence delivery teams to service clients in the Insurance, Retail and Healthcare industries.
Technical Skills
You possess a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, where your research focused on the development of numerical methods.
You have strong programming skills with a minimum of 1000 hours experience using C/C++, and/or Python.
Experience using CUDA in a GPU development environment is an asset.
You have a working knowledge of database technologies with very strong SQL skills or ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data.
Strong mathematical skills with knowledge/interest in machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced statistics, parallel computing and operations research.
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
General skills and Attitude
You have strong leadership skills and leverage them to manage deadlines and priorities.
You are an excellent learner who can adopt to new technologies quickly.
You have an interest in solving complex business problems.
You are interested in the creation of new and leading-edge technology.
You possess strong English written and oral communication skills.
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines.
You desire to advance the world of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Skills & Qualifications
Have 5-10 years’ experience in the areas of machine learning and mathematical modeling.
3+ years of experience in the area of fraud detection and/or risk management
Have a strong work ethic and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery.
Have an ability to find creative solutions to complex leading-edge problems.
Enjoy working on small high-performance teams.
Learn new capabilities and grow your expertise.
Why Daisy Intelligence?
Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line.
You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics. Daisy Intelligence is located in Toronto, Ontario area. Please note our candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
Perks
Annual performance bonus
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
Skills development
Flexibility
Start-up culture

No agencies or B2B services please.
