Title: Machine Learning Engineers / Machine Vision Engineers (two p...
Description:
We are a consulting firm specializing in technology and product development that provides engineering, research and development services to our customers. With a team of world-class engineers, scientists and project managers supported by a proven methodology in product development, we ensure predictable costs and schedules. Our customers trust us to deliver breakthrough innovations that help them create and maintain market leading positions. Join one of the most recognized teams in the electronic product development industry. We offer highly competitive compensation and benefits.
EXCLUSIVE BENEFITS
The candidate will have the opportunity to work on applied solutions where Artificial Intelligence (AI) is embedded into products to increase their performance.
The candidate will have access to a diversity of datasets, tools and frameworks required to develop algorithms and deep neural networks.
The candidate will be part of a team developing end to end AI solutions to be embedded into high performance vision sensors (synthetic image generation, image processing, deep neural network research and development, features extraction and algorithm development, inference acceleration on hardware platforms, system performances optimization and support).
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the development of algorithms and methods to automatically detect, classify, and track objects produced by high-performance embedded vision sensors (camera, thermal, RADAR, etc.)
Being part of a small team of engineers working in an energetic fast paced start-up environment
Must be able to complete assignments independently and on time
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Genuinely excited and enthusiastic about learning and pushing technical limits and finding new solutions
Strong programming skills including knowledge of: Open CV, Matlab, Python, CUDA, and C++
Familiarity with NVIDA and/or INTEL hardware
Strong organizational and analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Attention to detail, data accuracy and quality of output
REQUIREMENTS
Master’s in Sciences + 5 years’ or PH.D. + 2 years’ practical experience in an Engineering field related to machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, or data science.
Practical experience in most of the following areas is required:
feature extraction and algorithm development using optical and thermal data sources
deep learning, CNN, semantic segmentation, object classification
deep learning frameworks, such as Tensor Flow, Keras, PyTorch, NVIDIA Deep Stream
classic machine learning approaches such as SVM, LDA, PCA, Naïve Bayes, k-Means, etc.
image processing, machine vision approaches

To apply, send your resume to cv@orthogone.ca

Title: TM1/Planning Analytics (PA) Architect, Omnia AI
Description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Job Description
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.
As a member of our Data & Analytics Modernization team, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures – be it in the cloud or on-premise – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.
Your role at Deloitte
As a TM1 / Planning Analytics (PA) Architect, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. You will play an active role to implement innovative performance management solutions for our clients, to support enterprise-wide decision-making, improve finance operations, and create impact within their organization. You are enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development.
In this role, you will:
Be responsible for hands-on SME advising and implementing solutions, technical quality assurance testing of developer work products and training.
Lead a team of TM1/PA Developers.
Consult with clients to understand business challenges.
Identify functional requirements.
Drive the solution design and prototyping.
Qualifications
3+ years relevant experience implementing IBM Cognos TM1/PA.
Advanced development (rules/TI process authoring, complex calculation modeling) and troubleshooting skills in IBM TM1/PA.
Proven skills as a team lead or project manager on at least three full life cycle implementations.
Ability to guide and mentor a team of experienced developers.
Willingness for travel.
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Strong level Microsoft Excel and data manipulation skills
We also value:
IBM Certifications in Planning Analytics.
Strong functional knowledge around financial systems and processes.
If you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. The TM1/PA Architect role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.
The time is right for you to join Deloitte. Get your career off to great start. What impact will you make?
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.
At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.
Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.
Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted
45502

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable insurance companies to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide insurers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.
Duration: Permanent
Location: Keele and Steeles (TTC Accessible, free parking). Moving to Downtown Toronto soon.
Job Description
You will work with the data engineering at Daisy Intelligence and act as a valued member of the Research & Development team. You will be conducting applied research in the areas of farud detection optimization, biomimicry, statistics, machine learning, reinforcement learning, visualization and numerical methods.
Daisy Intelligence solutions involve modeling vast volumes of our clients' data, which requires leading edge computing and machine learning methods. You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.
Key Accountabilities
Mathematical model research, as well as literature research.
Mathematical models for fraud detection and risk management
Software solution design, programming development and testing.
Documenting and co-authoring internal research papers and patents.
Commercialization of successful applied research into software products that will be used by Daisy Intelligence delivery teams to service clients in the Insurance, Retail and Healthcare industries.
Technical Skills
You possess a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, where your research focused on the development of numerical methods.
You have strong programming skills with a minimum of 1000 hours experience using C/C++, and/or Python.
Experience using CUDA in a GPU development environment is an asset.
You have a working knowledge of database technologies with very strong SQL skills or ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data.
Strong mathematical skills with knowledge/interest in machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced statistics, parallel computing and operations research.
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
General skills and Attitude
You have strong leadership skills and leverage them to manage deadlines and priorities.
You are an excellent learner who can adopt to new technologies quickly.
You have an interest in solving complex business problems.
You are interested in the creation of new and leading-edge technology.
You possess strong English written and oral communication skills.
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines.
You desire to advance the world of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Skills & Qualifications
Have 5-10 years’ experience in the areas of machine learning and mathematical modeling.
3+ years of experience in the area of fraud detection and/or risk management
Have a strong work ethic and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery.
Have an ability to find creative solutions to complex leading-edge problems.
Enjoy working on small high-performance teams.
Learn new capabilities and grow your expertise.
Why Daisy Intelligence?
Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line.
You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics. Daisy Intelligence is located in Toronto, Ontario area. Please note our candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
Perks
Annual performance bonus
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
Skills development
Flexibility
Start-up culture

No agencies or B2B services please.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position Description:
CGI has a future opportunity for a Data Scientist to join our team in Ottawa. Attributes that define our ideal candidates will include:

Have analytical curiosity, strong data-oriented skills and a statistical programming background
Possess a successful track record of designing and developing AI/ML algorithms for private or public sector solutions
Up-to-date with the latest technology trends, have a strong desire to constantly learn and be ready to put on the hacker's hat at any time to convert an idea into a demonstration
Highly detailed-oriented with exceptional organizational and follow-through skills
Self-started and able to execute without a lot of direction or oversight
Exceptional communication skills, with an ability to make advanced analytics concepts accessible and understandable to non-technical business users
Value collaboration and urgency; and have a passion for driving impact
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Solve some of the most challenging and impactful problems for financial services, insurance and the government by using artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing and big data
Drive innovation into Analytics solutions and focus on humanizing enterprise software to achieve better customer experience and to enable data-driven business decisions
Work on high priority initiatives using advanced analytics, predictive modeling and a variety of data sources to produce actionable business insights
Ideate, conceptualize, design, develop and maintain AI/ML algorithms that provide data insights that drive operational efficiencies and cost savings
Build production grade models on large-scale datasets. Utilize advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, and data mining techniques
Provide guidance to a customer and project team with respect to technical feasibility, complexity, and level of effort required to deliver a solution
Work closely with other team members to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insights that measure business performance improvements
Assist in the development and delivery of pre and post sales POCs, presentations and proposals for client engagements
Travel periodically in support of sales and delivery as needed
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
At least 2 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects
2 years of hands-on experience using complex machine learning methods and algorithms
At least 2 years of experience working with one or more data mining tools such as R, Python, Scala or SAS
Hands-on experience working with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Cassandra, and/or Hadoop
Hands-on experience writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases such as Oracle, DB2 or SQL Server
Hands-on experience constructing and manipulating JSON and XML documents and working with NoSQL databases such as MangoDB and CouchDB
Good understanding of microservices architecture and hands-on experience working with REST APIs
Self-directed and demonstrable problem-solving skills
Knowledge of modern software development techniques and methodologies
Knowledge and practice of secure software development processes
Ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or information systems (or equivalent combination of skill and experience)
What grabs our attention

4 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects
4 years of hands-on experience using Machine Learning, Cognitive, and AI APIs
4 years of experience with both relational and NoSQL technologies
2 years of experience using data transformation and integration services such as Kafka Connect and/or Py.Spark
Knowledge of the Python data ecosystem using pandas and NumPy Experience building and deploying ML pipelines
2 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects for financial services, insurance, healthcare or the government
Expertise with Agile development methodology and Continuous delivery best practices
Knowledge of RPA automation tools such as UIPath or Blue Prism
Master's or PhD degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or information systems
What you can expect from us:
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Each day our Software Developers get to work on challenging problems. No two days are the same, each day you’ll collaborate with other Software Developers to problem solve and write code that has an impact in the real world. Our product, Verafin, helps fight crime by stopping fraud and money laundering. Stopping the flow of this money means stopping crimes such as human trafficking, elder abuse, and drug trafficking. Our Software Developers get the opportunity to move around the business as there are new teams and projects developed all the time to help us towards our mission of stopping crime. Being a Software Developer at Verafin means getting the opportunity to have an impact on criminal activity by getting to do what you love – solve cool problems using code.

Essential Qualifications
A university degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a combination of education and previous experience would be considered
Strong analytical skills for complex and creative problem solving
Experience in object-oriented software development
Automated testing
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills; able to work closely with team members
Would be good to have experience in a few of the following areas
Java
Experience using JavaScript, CSS, REST
Previous experience working with Core Banking Systems
Amazon Web Services
Intelligent systems, artificial intelligence and data science
Distributed computing
Database technologies (PostgresSQL)
Big data technologies
Data extraction, manipulation/cleansing and integration

Industry and on-the-job training is provided for all roles at Verafin.

Verafin places a high value on building a diverse team, candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Title: Software Developer Intern, PhD, Summer 2020
Description:
Applications are due by February 7, 2020.
To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English. Click on the “Apply” button on this page and provide the required materials in the appropriate sections (PDFs preferred):
1. In the “Resume Section:” attach an updated CV or resume.
2. In the “Education Section:” attach a current or recent unofficial or official transcript in English.
Under “Degree Status,” select “Now attending” to upload a transcript.

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada
Minimum qualifications:
Currently pursuing a PhD degree in Computer Science or related technical field.
Programming experience in one or more of the following: C/C++, Java or Python.

Preferred qualifications:
Returning to a degree program after the completion of the internship.
Research experience in Algorithms, Architecture, Artificial Intelligence, Compilers, Database, Data Mining, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning, Networking, or Systems.
Experience in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.
Implementation skills with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, or Go.
About the job
This internship is intended for students currently enrolled in an accredited degree program in Computer Science who will be returning to school after the completion of the internship to continue working towards degree program completion.
Software Developers at Google are researchers and developers who yearn to create and implement complex computer science solutions. Our developers create massively scalable, distributed software systems and also collaborate on multitudes of smaller projects that have universal appeal - requiring awareness and comprehension of the latest research in the field. We focus on being a collaborative, global organization consisting of developers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skills and a keen eye for quality.
As a Software Developer Intern, you will work on our core products and services as well as those who support critical functions of our engineering operations. You will build competencies in data structures and algorithms, along with a technical fascination for how stuff fits together. You need to have a good foundation in computer science in order to consistently come up with new ideas as well as strive for a deep understanding of our products and services in order to continually improve upon them. Typically our PhD Interns are expected to work in the following area:
Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems, you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers).
Engineering Productivity
As a Software Developer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated test systems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure.
,
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offering.
Contribute to a wide variety of projects utilizing natural language processing, artificial intelligence, data compression, machine learning and search technologies.
Collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: New College Graduate - Sensor Sales Engineer
Description:
Job Description
Job Description
Who: Cognex Corporation
Cognex is the global leader in the exciting and growing field of machine vision. With over $800 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup. Our people, proudly called “Cognoids,” take their work seriously, but not themselves. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.
Where:
We are looking to fill multiple positions based Toronto.
When:
We are seeking newly graduating seniors who will be available in June of 2020 when they finish their final year of school to start our comprehensive sales training program.
What:
Cognex Corporation invests in talent. One way we do this is through our Technical Sales Training Program, a full-time opportunity for recent college undergraduates. This program is designed to train and engage emerging engineering professionals that are interested in a career in technical sales. You will be solving real world problems for our customers in the manufacturing industry. We will train you to combine your technical and sales skills to provide cutting edge technology solutions to Cognex customers, in a consultative manner. Our accelerated and comprehensive on-boarding and training will enable you to Work Hard, Play Hard, and Move Fast!
The Technical Sales Training Program seeks to cultivate highly skilled, productive and committed Cognoids who will help drive Cognex’s future sales growth.
You won’t have to wait long to experience the life a tenured sales engineer. Our accelerated 13 week on-boarding program incorporates travelling and working in multiple cities throughout the country. New Cognoids will learn from VP’s, Director’s, Managers, and proven Sales Engineers on topics including:
Cognex Essentials: Cognex Culture, Company History, Machine Vision, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Identification
Industrial Technology: Robotics, Internet of Things, Sensors, PLC’s, Pneumatics
Industry Knowledge: Automotive, Food & Beverage, Packaging, Consumer Electronics, Pharmaceuticals, Logistics
Sales Skills: Prospecting, Sales Calls, Closing a Sale, Negotiation
Business Skills: Time Management, Presentation Skills, C-Level Meetings, IT Tools, CRM
From classrooms, labs, and actual customer visits, you will spend your days immersing yourself in both Cognex Culture and learning to become a successful sales engineer. Once you have completed your on-boarding and training, the expectation is that you will be assigned to a territory that you will run with an entrepreneurial spirit, with the goal of growing the sales. Below are the requirements for the Sensor Sales Engineer position:
Essential Functions:
Responsible for achieving a defined sales quota at both current and prospective customer in the designated territory.
Travel onsite to customer manufacturing facilities and review applications / issues in order provide solutions to these applications
Follow up on sales leads and schedule customer onsite visits
Assists at trade shows and other marketing events
Coordinate more complex evaluations utilizing the Cognex Applications Engineering team
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Interested in a career in technical sales
Action-oriented mind set
PC literate with a working knowledge of MS Windows applications
Ability to work independently is required
Minimum education and work experience required:
Currently pursuing a STEM degree at a top school.
Engineering internship experience a plus
Additional Job Description

Title: Technical Solution Specialist - IBM Summit 2020 (Calgary)
Description:
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill consultative, client-focused, technical roles.

At IBM, we’re motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind, and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBM’s sales team, you will work with clients as they advance their digital transformation. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

Our Technical Solution Specialists are guided by IBM's purpose – To Be Essential.

Joining IBM is also more than joining a company, you are joining a community.
At IBM we are focused on helping communities take on challenges big and small. IBM brings the power of its technology, resources, and people to help with initiatives around the world, from education to health to resilience. As an IBMer, you would have opportunities to give back to your local community and make a difference through various programs.

Join a company where you can do your best work!

You will actively:
Engage clients to develop trust, credibility and develop long-term relationships
Help clients grow their businesses by solving strategic, technical and tactical business problems with IBM’s proven cognitive and cloud technology solutions
Partner with clients and demonstrate your technical expertise to assist your sales counterparts and maintain client satisfaction
Deliver industry-centric technology solutions to clients of all sizes and markets
Work in a changing environment where no two days are ever the same
Work with the client account team and drive revenue through in-depth, complex technical demonstrations, designing solutions, technical evaluations, and/or proof-of-concepts
Be ready to interact with a variety of other smart and highly motivated people daily
Please note: this is not a coding or development role. You will have the opportunity to leverage your strong technical expertise to consult with clients, helping them design technical solutions. This position requires a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients, IBM sellers and other teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Cloud, Cognitive/Artificial Intelligence, Internet of Things, Cyber Security, Technology Services, Systems Hardware, Global Finance or Digital Sales.

Summit Training
During the nine-month development program, we provide extraordinary technology, industry solution training, shadowing opportunities and consultative sales training through a combination of classroom and online resources, hands-on field experiences, and structured mentorship. We will equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to match the technical capabilities of IBM offerings to client requirements and help you grow as a leader.

After competing your Summit training, you will continue to develop your skills over the next 6 months “on the job” working with a job role mentor, engaging with clients shadowing and gaining deeper skills aligned to your business unit, offerings and territory. IBM is investing in more than one year of sales training and is committed to your success. After your first year, you transition to a full sales plan and continue working with clients and building a successful technical sales career. Are you ready to take your sales career to the next level?

This role may be for you if you show a proven track record of accomplishment in:
Conversant, knowledgeable and passionate about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
Team collaboration and leadership
Experience demonstrating business insight for long-lasting client relationships and results
Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction
We are currently hiring for the January 2020 cohorts.

Training period requires 30% travel.
All applicants must have the required work authorization to be able to travel to the US, and must have a valid driver’s license.

If you would like additional information about the Summit Program, please visit: http://www-03.ibm.com/employment/summit

Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent
Must be able to travel to the US
Valid Driver’s license
English: Fluent

Prior work experience in sales or service in the technology industry (up to 5 years)
Programming coursework or experience
Readiness to travel up to 25% annually

IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.

What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Position Title: Principal Data Scientist Scientist
Mission:
Sanofi Pasteur is looking for an innovative Data Scientist to join our team to help create the next generation of analytics and artificial intelligence solutions. As part of Toronto Data Science team in Manufacturing Technology department, you will work with modern cloud based technologies to deliver high value advanced analytics use cases across the bio-manufacturing lifecycle covering bio-process development, manufacturing, quality and compliance, and supply chain.
Key Accountabilities:
Ability to follow multiple approaches for data science project execution from adapting existing assets to new use cases, exploring third-party tools and open source solutions for speed, to execution and for specific use cases, engaging in fundamental research to develop novel solutions.
On-going consultative engagement with subject matter experts to understand needs, challenges, key business decisions and existing process workflow.
Build data pipelines including collection, cleaning and integration of relevant data.
Rigorous model development process, including training, validation and deployment of advanced predictive models.
Strong user centric approach to ensure that ML/AI solutions developed have high business value, and are well embedded in the business workflow.
Provide scientific and technical leadership in machine learning / AI in the data science community.
Education and Experience:
Masters or Ph.D. in one of the following quantitative fields: Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research
Minimum of three (3) years industry experience
Practical hands on experience in developing, testing and deploying machine learning algorithms
Strong programming skills in Python with a solid training on best practices in code development and management
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as Sagemaker, Databricks, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Theano, Keras
Applied statistics skills such as distributions, statistical testing, probability modelling
Working experience with distributed computing environments and cloud environments (specifically AWS)
Familiar with agile methodology and product management in software development
Experience with developing full stack applications, both front-end and back-end is a plus
Experience with analyzing high volume, high velocity time series data is a plus
Experience with NLP, Image Analytics, Search, Graph databases a plus
Prior experience in a pharma industry with a knowledge of good practices of validation for technology systems, tools and models in a GMP environment is plus
Sanofi Pasteur: The world’s leading vaccine company
Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.
Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.
Sanofi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants. Accommodations for persons with disabilities required during the recruitment process are available upon request.
Thank you in advance for your interest.
Only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
Sanofi, Empowering Life
#GD-SP#LI-SP
At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

Title: Intelligent Automation Developer
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
The Automation Developer will be a part of the Automation Centre of Excellence. They will design and program Process Automation solutions (Bots) by analyzing operational processes and recommending scope for automation; using advanced programming and configuration skills to deliver on automation projects across the enterprise.
What you’ll do
Seek opportunities for automation
Determine business needs, and recommend suitability for automation
Elicit, document and manage stakeholder requirements in order to meet business and project objectives
Build sufficient controls and metrics into processes being automated
Develop solutions by preparing and evaluating alternative workflow solutions
Development and configuration of systems
Coding and configuring Bots
Rapidly develop Bots based on process designs
Draft test plans and validate results by testing automated processes
Provide reference by writing documentation
Building Proficiency / knowledge of Robotic Process Automation suites
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
A software professional with 2-3 years’ experience in software requirements analysis
Experienced in programming concepts and multiple programming languages
A quick learner and have an ability to adapt to new and emerging situations
Curious about the emerging field of Robotic Process Automation, Cognitive learning and Artificial Intelligence
Experienced with Agile and DevOps methodologies
Driven by problems and challenges that require critical thinking
Passionate about leveraging emerging technology to simplify processes
Constantly seeking continuous improvement
An individual with strong analysis and problem-solving skills
An “Out of the box” thinker
A strong communicator - Verbal and Written
A Technical/functional expert with strong analysis and problem-solving skills
About Canadian Tire Corporation
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers .
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn .

Title: Data Scientist/Artificial Intelligence Expert
Description:
RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary

The AIPHL lab of McGill University Health Center and Department of radiology is looking for a data scientist as part of a multi-disciplinary clinical team for developing medical AI applications
The successful candidate will be joining a dynamic team within an academic health center and leading research and development in medical applications of AI in collaboration with other academic groups as well as industry partners.
The approach will be open and multi-disciplinary, including working with different medical specialties within the hospital as well as collaborators from other institutions including health centers, non-medical academic groups with AI expertise, and industry.

General Duties

The candidate would be expected to take a leadership role under the supervision of the principle investigators in overseeing and developing optimal strategies and developing of algorithms for various AI applications that include but is not limited to analysis of medical images such as CT and MRI scans.
The candidate would be working with other team members within and outside the lab and would be expected to oversee successful completion of different projects conducted by the team from a data science perspective.
Provide supervision to trainees and necessary training to other lab members and/or trainees.
The successful candidate would be expected to take a leadership position and lead projects to completion.
Participate in grant writing, and manuscript preparation.
https://rimuhc.ca/en
Education / Experience
Should have a PhD degree
A successful candidate should have a strong background in machine learning applications including deep learning applications for medical image analysis.
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing would be a bonus.
Familiarity with medical physics and/or imaging would be an asset but not a requirement.
Knowledge/experience in radiomics would be an asset but not a requirement
Outgoing, excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiatives, set priorities, time-manage, and resolve problems
Additional information
Status : Full time
Pay Scale: Salary competitive based of candidate’s qualifications and experience
Work Shift: 8am – 4pm, as per standard
Work Site: MUHC RI and department of radiology

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

NOTE: The masculine gender has been used for brevity and includes the feminine gender.
Equal Opportunity Employment Program
Le CUSM applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d’adaptation peuvent être offertes aux personnes handicapées qui en font la demande en fonction de leurs besoins.

Title: Research Assistant (Data Science)
Description:
POSITION: PART-TIME, 12 MONTH TERM (WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF EXTENSION)
REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR, RESEARCH & BEST PRACTICE IMPLEMENTATION
UNIT: TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH
The Rick Hansen Institute (RHI) is a Canadian-based not-for-profit organization that drives innovation in spinal cord injury (SCI) research and care. By facilitating an international network of researchers, healthcare professionals, entrepreneurs, investors, people with SCI and their supporters, we strive to improve the lives of people living with SCI in Canada and around the world. The Rick Hansen Institute is proudly accredited by Imagine Canada.
This position presents a great learning opportunity for a candidate looking to build upon or expand their experience in the fields of computer science, engineering science, or statistics. RHI provides a multi-disciplinary environment where autonomy, critical and creative thinking are encouraged. The values that drive our mission are teamwork, collaboration, innovation, integrity and trust and exceptional outcomes.
Reporting to the Director, Research & Best Practice Evaluation, the Research Assistant will work closely with and take direction from the Senior Biostatistician on assigned projects. The Research Assistant will also work collaboratively with other RHI internal and external project team members and assist with the preparation of a technical report, possibly a manuscript for publication.
JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Research Assistant is responsible for:
Supporting the application of new methods in Data Science (e.g. machine learning, Fuzzy theory) using SCI data;
Linking and integrating data in different formats from a variety of data sources (both internal and external to RHI);
Writing and executing computer programs as required, using Matlab or R;
Generating standard and customized data reports;
Conducting data reviews, data quality assessments, and data analyses using databases, spreadsheets, and statistical software such as SPSS and R;
Learning programming techniques, health services and population health research methods, and other relevant information related to the project as required;
Working collaboratively with other RHI team members, including providing regular updates on activities, ensuring timely notification of issues or problems, and communicating with internal and external project team members;
Assisting with the preparation of a technical report, and possibly a manuscript for publication; and
Performing other duties as requested.
QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal candidate will have:
A Masters or PhD in a relevant discipline (Computing Science, Engineering Science, Statistics, etc.)
Experience using Matlab and R
Understanding of other statistical software such as SPSS and SAS
Two years of work experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence
Effective oral and written communication
Effective time management skills
Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy, analyzing and attention to detail
Ability to exercise tact, discretion, and confidentiality
Ability to interact effectively and positively with others
Ability to work independently and within a team environment in a fast-paced environment
Ability to identify and solve problems
HOW TO APPLY
Interested and qualified candidates can apply here by October 14, 2019. While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on the Rick Hansen Institute, please visit our website at www.rickhanseninstitute.org.

Title: CO OP/Intern: Data Analytics
Description:
Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

Responsabilités :

Apporter un soutien aux ingénieurs principaux pour le codage d’algorithmes d’analyse ainsi que participer à l’élaboration d’algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique (ML) et d’intelligence artificielle (IA);
Soutenir les simulations de réseaux en laboratoire servant à valider les algorithmes;
Contribuer aux tests de la codification précédent son déploiement avec les données réelles de réseaux existants.

Activités générales :

Aider l’ingénieur(e) principal(e) en analyse de données à coder et tester des algorithmes.

Travail de collaboration :

Collaboration au jour le jour avec l'ingénieur principal des données sous forme de réunions ou de courriels

Expérience requise :

Bonne connaissances en télécommunication réseautique
Solide expérience en programmation, python, R
Connaissances de base en programmation Linux et shell
Familiarisation avec les services Web (API REST, SOAP)
De l’expérience en science des données et en apprentissage automatique est considérée un atout
De l’expérience en modélisation et en structures de données ainsi qu’en construction d’algorithmes est considérée un atout
___________________________________________________________________________________________

Responsibilities:

Help Senior Engineers code analytics algorithm and work on Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) algorithms
Support lab or simulation network to validate such algorithms
Help test the code once ready for deployment using real network data

General Activities:

Help senior data analysis engineer on coding and testing of algorithm.
Collaboration with stakeholders:
collaboration will be daily with Senior Data engineer via meetings and email

Experience:

Good knowledge of Telecommunication network
Strong coding background, python, R,
Basic knowledge in Linux & shell programming
Basic understanding of Web Services (REST APIs, SOAP)
Experience in Data Sciences & Machine Learning is a plus
Data Modeling, Data Structures, and Algorithms is a plus
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
What you can expect from us
You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Boeing Vancouver houses an eclectic group of passionate data scientists who help customers by making sense out of big, complex systems in the world of aviation. We combine deep scientific thinking, mathematical prowess and analytics technology with creativity and detective work to uncover rare insights hidden within the data. We harness practical knowledge of engineering, business, and aviation to build customer solutions. Together, we deliver the power of understanding to change the world above and on the ground.
Position Responsibilities:
We are looking for skilled, inquisitive analysts to bring the fast-growing, ever-evolving power of data science to aviation and aerospace. As a Data Scientist, you will have to combine the skills of a developer and a detective, drawing on a wide palette of mathematics, statistics, machine learning, and programming techniques to unravel mysteries too subtle for the naked eye. You will get to work closely with our customers, building their trust, studying their problems and business needs, and you will blend artistry with science to visualize and explain your findings and stories. We want you to invent new ways of doing things, and to contribute your own specialties to problem-solving teams of diverse backgrounds. We want you to help us craft and launch leading-edge operational solutions around the world.
Above all, we are seeking someone who will value and champion our culture of learning, trust, and relentless collaborative energy. We love breathing new science into the industry, and we love sharing the journey. We believe that thirst for knowledge and having fun go hand-in-hand. Does this sound like you? Come build Vancouver’s local data science community with us and make a global impact.
We Want to Hear From You If
You are a technical jack-of-all-trades and master of one – uncommonly familiar with a wide array of data analytic techniques, applications, and programming languages; you know the methods, their strengths and weaknesses, and how to use the right tool for the job. But more than that, you possess uncommon or exceptional proficiency in at least one technical specialty (e.g. programming languages, statistical techniques, machine-learning analytics, web development, etc.) You are a business thinker – project-minded, down-to-earth and strategic. You focus on customers, their viewpoints and real-world priorities. You balance pragmatic choices, and you appreciate the robust elegance in the path of least resistance to a solution. And you stay always on the lookout for new problems and new possibilities for growth. You love learning – You don’t rest on your laurels, and you enjoy honing your mind. You have diverse interests; you have fun learning new ideas, growing your skills and sharing the experience with others. You communicate and collaborate effectively– you know how to collaborate in diverse teams both large and small. You can switch confidently between following and leading as circumstances dictate. You are respectful, honest, and you strive to understand as much as to be understood.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience)
3+ years relevant work experience Data Engineer or Data Science
Must be proficient in Python (special emphasis on Pandas) and SQL
Must have experience in formal collaborative development environment and version control (e.g., Gitlab)
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Confident communication skills
Critical-thinking skills (formal training in Kepner-Tregoe, Root-Cause Analysis, or similar)
Project management knowledge (PMBOK, Agile, Kanban) is an asset
Domain knowledge in the aviation & aerospace industry is an asset
Expertise or specializations in the following areas:
Statistics & Data Mining
Forecasting & Time-series Analysis
Signal Analysis
Machine-learning or Artificial Intelligence
Large-scale data analysis technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, Pig, Hive)
Simulation, Numerical Modeling
Mathematical Optimization
Visualization Techniques & Technology (e.g. Tableau, D3.js)
Databases & Data Management (e.g., SQL, NoSQL )
Programming (e.g., Java, Python, R)
Typical Education:
Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical discipline. For Master degree and above a combination of education and experience will be considered.

Title: Principale d'intélligence artificièle (AI) - Montréal - Prin...
Description:
Date: Aug 28, 2019
ENGLISH VERSION TO FOLLOW

Ericsson permet aux fournisseurs de services de communication de saisir toute la valeur de la connectivité. Le portefeuille de la société touche les réseaux, les services numériques, les services gérés et les entreprises émergentes. Il permet d'aider nos clients à passer au numérique, à accroître leur efficacité, à trouver de nouvelles sources de revenus. Les investissements d’Ericsson dans l’innovation ont permis à des milliards de personnes du monde entier, de bénéficier des avantages de la téléphonie et du haut débit mobile. L'action Ericsson est cotée au Nasdaq de Stockholm et au Nasdaq de New York. www.ericsson.com

Le site d’Ericsson de Montréal compte plus de 1 200 professionnels travaillant dans notre centre de R & D et de services.

Nombreux sont les experts de classe mondiale opérant dans la création et l’installation de systèmes sans fil, évolués et de la nouvelle génération,
pour nos nombreux clients au Canada, en Amérique du Nord et dans le monde.

Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l’homme de comprendre comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil. La combinaison de réseaux sans fil 5G, de l'Edge computing réparti et de l'accès aux données en temps réel dans un environnement d’appareils portatifs, orientera les réseaux et les produits de la prochaine génération vers une évolution économique et sociale de tous les aspects de la société. Les techniques d'Intelligence Artificielle (acronyme « AI » en anglais) et de l'Apprentissage Automatique (acronyme « ML » en anglais) seront essentielles pour nous-mêmes et nos clients, si nous voulons tirer parti de ces opportunités. À cette fin, nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée. L’équipe canadienne, située à Montréal, comptera plus de 30 employés.

L'Intelligence automatisée (acronyme « MI » en anglais), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres techniques liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une administration réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions pour simplifier et automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.

Ericsson recherche actuellement un dirigeant expérimenté pour diriger son équipe de MI à Montréal. Le poste relèvera de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Directeur du MI à Montréal, vous devez très bien connaitre la Science des données (DS), l’apprentissage automatique et la programmation, ainsi qu’être compétent en direction afin de constituer une solide équipe locale. Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour diriger une équipe de professionnels, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et internationale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et les idées, dans le cadre d'initiatives très influentes dans le domaine de l’Intelligence automatisée, afin de stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en décuplant ce que propose actuellement Ericsson. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G dirigés par MI, du cloud réparti, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités.

Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.

Diriger une équipe pour créer rapidement et répétitivement un système viable et sûr répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique.

Participer à des études et trouver une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler en utilisant des données.

Travailler auprès de scientifiques et d'architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.

Établir une équipe MI à Montréal et diriger son travail afin qu'il corresponde aux objectifs, plans et tâches de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Collaborer avec les équipes de création de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux.

Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.

Aider les entreprises et les services à la clientèle d’Ericsson, à accumuler des compétences en MI.

Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et techniques consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants.

Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.

Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez détenir :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté.

Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience en apprentissage automatique en Science des données.

Expérience confirmée dans la direction et la constitution d'équipes hautement motivées et axées sur les résultats.

Capacité de travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance.

Expérience en création de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application.

Compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++.

Compétences en apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.

Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.

Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation.

Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.

Grandes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée.

Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir, capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance.

Bon anglais et français, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral

Sont un « plus » :
Certifier MI MOOCS.

Connaissances en applications / domaines des réseaux de télécommunication et / ou IoT.

Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes.

Expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord.

Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats.

ENGLISH VERSION:

Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency and find new revenue streams. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world. The Ericsson stock is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm and on Nasdaq New York. www.ericsson.com

Ericsson’s Montreal site has more than 1,200 professionals working in our R&D and Services Centre. Many are world-class experts developing and implementing advanced and next generation wireless systems for our many customers in Canada, North America and across the world.

It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks. The combination of 5G wireless networks with distributed edge compute and access to real-time data in a mobile environment, will drive next-generation networks and solutions towards economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) technologies will be vital for us and our customers to take advantage of these opportunities. To that end, we are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution. The Canadian team, based in Montreal, will be >30 employees.

Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.

Ericsson is now looking for a senior and experienced leader to head-up its Montreal-based MI team. The position will report into the Global AI Accelerator team.

Role Summary:
As the Montreal MI team head, you will need to have an advanced understanding of Data Science (DS), Machine Learning and programming, as well as, managerial skills to build a strong local team. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies to lead a team of professionals in solving challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. Working in a highly collaborative environment, where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas, on high impact initiatives in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.

Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities.

Lead a team for rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems.

Participate in studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Scientists and Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.

Build the Montreal-based MI team and manage their work to be in-line with the Global AI Accelerator team’s objectives, plans and assignments.

Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents.

Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.

Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson businesses and Customer serving units.

Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives.

Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs.

To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field.

Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.

Proven track-record in management and building highly motivated and results-oriented teams.

Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence.

Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain.

Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++

Skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.

Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.

Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability.

Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc.

Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis.

Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence.

Good communication skills in written and spoken English and French.

You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS.

Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication networks and/or IoT.

Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities.

Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation.

Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results.

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
