Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At MobSquad, we're a team of diverse and curious people who are committed to helping start-ups grow. We write some of the most advanced, useful, and compelling code, and we do it in an environment that values free expression and inquiry. The Squad is bound together by our mutual respect for each other and our hunger to create.

The Role

As a Data Scientist, you will be part of a Canada-based team working remotely with a leading US start-up. Your team will operate alongside many other talented developers and data scientists in Canada, and you will be an integral part of the tech community that MobSquad has built.

This role requires someone who has demonstrated an ability to bridge the gap between the theoretical and the practical. The ideal candidate has deployed or attempted to execute Artificial Intelligence theories from various Machine Learning (ML) models and algorithms, and also has some experience in data engineering. MobSquad is looking for proven researchers with a track record of publishing in impactful journals and conferences, or those with years of hands-on industry experience.

This role offers the opportunity to apply your knowledge of statistics and your analytical skills to mine data at scale and develop large-scale ML models to reveal the value in data. You will support feature prototyping and utilize best practices to write production-grade code. You will build data pipelines, implement ML-based analytical algorithms, and work closely with the software development team to set up back-end systems and interfaces that will deliver next-generation analytics.

Qualifications and Skills

An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a comparable analytical field from an accredited institution
Expert in data mining, machine learning, deep learning, statistical modeling and data visualization techniques using data-oriented tools and languages such as Python, R, and MATLAB
3+ years experience or demonstrated fluency in relevant programming languages (Python, R, Scala, Java, C/C++/C# a plus)
3+ years experience writing SQL as well as NoSql queries and databases
Experience setting up and using large-scale distributed data-processing frameworks such as Apache Spark and Hadoop Map-Reduce
Experience working with enterprise-grade cloud computing platforms such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS
Demonstrated ability to develop high-quality code adhering to industry best practices (i.e., code review, unit tests, revision control)
Familiarity with designing experiments and collecting data for the purpose of deriving data analytics insights and solutions
Work/project history reflective of a self-motivated professional who excels when given open-ended problems and broadly-defined goals, having an innate desire to discover the patterns and relationships in data that can be leveraged to provide business value
Who You Are

You understand that writing code is as much about functionality as it is about communication, and that shines through in the clarity of your code and how you describe it to your teammates
You are a self-starter who can work autonomously and drive your success within a team
You are comfortable when things go according to plan, and you are energized when chaos strikes and the team's well-laid plans need to be overhauled
You know that start-up life involves continual adaptation and change, and that excites you!
What You'll Get @MobSquad

A full-time position that offers competitive compensation
A benefits program delivered through our bespoke digital platform, giving you control, choice, and flexibility. We give you the ability to build your package of benefits covering health (think medical, dental, vision), wellness (think gym, workout gear, ski pass, massage, transit) and RRSP (think retirement)
A downtown office location with first-rate amenities, surrounded by great restaurants and easily-accessible transit
For international candidates: Sponsorship for an immediate work permit through Canada's Global Talent Stream and in many cases, expedited permanent residency and a path to citizenship
What You'll Experience @MobSquad

Exposure and engagement with world-class start-ups where you will be helping to build the next big thing many times over
A team-based environment where our culture and community are deeply rooted in our core values
A diverse and inclusive workplace; we know conscious and subconscious discrimination exists and we work hard to uncover and remove biases and barriers, so everyone realizes their actual - not perceived - potential
Opportunity. And lots of it.

Title: Software Developer, PhD University Graduate, Machine Learnin...
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
PhD degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
Experience with one or more of the following: Recommendation/Ranking/Prediction (RRP), Computer Vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Speech/Audio, Deep Learning/Neural Networks, Reinforcement Learning, Distributed Machine Learning.
Examples of coding in one of the following programming languages including but not limited to: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, or Python.

Preferred qualifications:
A solid foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Specific responsibilities vary by project area.
General responsibilities include: Write server-side code for web-based applications. Develop prototypes quickly and create robust high-volume production applications. Develop for specialist domains: client application development for Windows/Mac (Chrome, Toolbar, etc.), embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers), infrastructure, internationalization, networking, and more.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Expert, R&D - Technology Management
Description:
Expert, R&D - Technology Management
Expert, R&D

At CN Rail, we work together to move our company—and our country—forward. We invest more than $100 million every year on projects and infrastructure. We harness the power of information to guide our decisions, and the Enterprise Architecture team is a critical part of the engine that keeps us in motion.
CN’s Enterprise Architecture Team is transforming our organization and is focused on building the future of rail technology. We are looking for the brightest, collaborative and most innovative minds in the industry to help us achieve our goals. If you are passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Industrial Internet of Things, big data platforms and enjoy solving complex problems, CN is looking for you.
Want to know more about the Enterprise Architecture team, and the meaningful work we do in Information & Technology?

The R&D team performs technology watch and engages with business stakeholders to identify new applications based on innovative technologies that can lead to improved productivity. The R&D team will then incubate those concepts into a set of Minimum Viable Products. Once validated, these MVPs can be transferred to a productization team for further development.
As part of this R&D team, the Expert, R&D is either responsible for the success of one or more R&D initiatives; or he/she is responsible for contributing to the R&D technology innovation strategy and its implementation based on his/her domain(s) of expertise; or he/she has some responsibilities for both. In all cases, the Expert, R&D, will work with teams and stakeholders across CN and across the industry. To be successful, he/she will need good influential leadership to align everyone with the overall goals set by the R&D team, by the Enterprise Architecture organization and by the CN leaders.

We have many different initiatives and we are looking for people with significant expertise in one or more of these fields:

Industrial Internet of Things
Embedded Systems / Locomotive Onboard Systems
Train Control Systems
Cloud-based Systems Architecture
Advanced Technologies for Rail / Automotive / Aerospace
Advanced Technologies for Information Systems
Artificial Intelligence
Wireless Communications
Systems Engineering
Systems Integration

RESPONSIBILITIES

R&D Initiatives Leadership
Leads at least one medium size R&D initiative ($1M - $5M), or multiple smaller ones, where an R&D initiative is either a stand-alone initiative, or a well-defined component of a larger R&D initiative.
Is fully accountable for the success of the initiatives under leadership.
Defines the keys deliverables and the definition of success of the R&D initiatives.
For incubation initiatives, establishes the Minimum Viable Products (MVP) to be built, their scope and how to transfer them to productization teams.
Negotiates for resources with relevant skillset and expertise for the initiatives: from the R&D team; from other CN teams; and from external partners.
Assembles the team; sets the direction; identifies synergies; establishes ways of working; assigns roles; and follows-up on results.
Sets and tracks milestones.
Manages the initiative budget.
Reports on progress to stakeholders; manages their expectations and integrates their feedback.
Makes sure that technologies selected meet the R&D initiative mandate.
Negotiates with external vendors to align their technologies to the initiatives needs.
Technology Innovation Leadership
Engages with key stakeholders involved with technology at CN.
Supports R&D technical strategy by identifying and assessing technologies relevant to CN.
Leads concept analysis and definition for R&D portfolio and pipeline management.
Drives technical evaluations of products with potential for CN applications.
Drives collaboration with vendors in exploring technologies aligned with CN’s vision.
Provides technical leadership to R&D Specialists and other resources involved in R&D initiatives.
Actively contributes to R&D initiatives by writing technical specifications and checklists; driving for technology selection; monitoring technical progress and evaluating solution quality.
Writes white papers on novel technology concepts and usage.
Develops and continuously assess/update the technology map and IP landscape around his/her domain(s) of expertise: reflecting the maturity of emerging concepts; their relevance to CN operations; and their potential impact on CN’s practices and value for CN’s customers.
Works in close relationship with external partners belonging to the Rail business and technology ecosystem, as well as with regulation authorities.
Attends industry committees working on the technologies for the future of railways and of freight transportation.
Defines objectives and oversee progress of R&D initiatives within the particular domain(s) of technology expertise.
Provides expert advice and guidance to other business and I&T teams regarding the subject of the particular domain(s) of technology expertise.
Promotes technology innovation across CN.

Skills Development and Sharing
Continuously explores advanced technologies with the potential to improve the efficiency, reliability and safety of freight transportation by rail and by truck.
Maintains outstanding technical knowledge up-to-date in his/her domain(s) of expertise; as well as in other technical domains as necessary.
Provides learning sessions to R&D team members.
Exchanges on new technologies and their applications on an ongoing basis within I&T and with CN stakeholders CN.
Reaches out to technology industries outside the regular rail domain to determine how their technical solutions could be applied to help address CN challenges.
Presents new technology concepts to representatives within CN and at industry events.

REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Science; Masters degree or higher an asset.
Proven experience in team management, including in a matrix context
Proven experience delivering technology projects involving multiple parties
Good expertise in agile project delivery and methodologies
Good expertise with multiple technologies related information technology applications
Good expertise with multiple technologies related to Internet of Things (IoT) applications
Good experience in applying a structured approach for exploring the potential of new technologies
Good knowledge of most technologies below, with at least one where knowledge is at the expert level:
Cloud-based systems and big data systems
Linux; container technologies; virtual machines and micro-cloud systems
Artificial Intelligence; Deep Learning; Machine Learning
Video Analytics Capabilities
Electronic control systems and their reliability
High-availability systems & Safety-critical systems
Connectivity technologies (wired; wireless; mesh; cellular; satellite; etc.)
Advanced sensing systems; data fusion; and predictive analytics
New Human Computer Interaction systems (wearables, etc.)
Cybersecurity of connected systems
Strong systems engineering knowledge
Software development experience
Good influencing and presentation skills
Excellent and proven leadership skills, both technical and people
10+ years experience in roles involving complex hardware/software systems and advanced IT, sensor, controls and communication technologies
5+ years experience in team and/or technical leadership roles
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Title: Data Scientist, Data Science & Risk Management
Description:
Johnson & Johnson, Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCCP) is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist, to join the Data Science & Risk Management Team.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

With $81.6 billion in 2018 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 126,500 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer

The Data Scientist is a core member of the Health Care Compliance & Privacy (HCC&P) Global Operations Center of Excellence team, reporting to the Sr. Manager, Data Science & Risk Management. You will be responsible for partnering with Global Operations team members (Compliance & Technology Integration, Testing & Monitoring, Regional Centers of Excellence); the Franchise / Company HCC&P Compliance Officers and business partners to identify, develop and implement innovative solutions that enhance our data, analytic & visualization capabilities.
As the Data Scientist:
You will be responsible for Identifying and understanding key business questions to be addressed using the appropriate analytical approaches
You will model data to build innovative solutions to solve complex analytical problems;
You will lead or support projects that will facilitate advancement in predictive analytics;
You will develop methodologies that allow for efficient and repetitive data extraction; using existing and new data bases (structured & unstructured) focused on identifying potential compliance risk areas
You will provide input/recommendations to the Data Science & Risk Management Governance team regarding development, standardization and delivery prioritization
You will partner with Data Science & Risk Management and Compliance & Technology Integration team members to evaluate and develop system platforms and technology to enhance our data science capabilities



Qualifications
Required:
A minimum of a Master’s degree with 2 years of experience or Ph.D degree in, Computer Sciences, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Computational Informatics, Medical Informatics, Computational Biology or a related discipline.
Experience with data mining methodology, common modeling techniques, and presenting data insights
Good analytical skills. You should be able to analyse and interpret complex data from multiple sources using R, Python, SAS, Java, SQL
A broad knowledge of existing data science techniques (such as decision trees, clustering, regression, neural networks, Bayesian models) and creativity to invent and customized algorithms when necessary
Experienced working in a multinational environment and with cross-functional and/or cross-sector teams
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills
Ability to successfully lead multiple critical priorities/issues
Ability to influence, negotiate and communicate with both internal and external customers is required
Must be able to travel up to 10% of the time, mainly to domestic destinations.
This position can be based in New Brunswick, NJ; Toronto, Ontario Canada; or Guelph, Ontario Canada.
Preferred
Project Management and / or Process Excellence training / certification
You are a highly motivated individual with demonstrated analytical, communication and social skills. A keen data science curiosity and strong leadership skills are important in our entrepreneurial, fast-paced work environment.
Previous experience within the pharmaceutical, consumer and/or medical device industries
Experience in identifying viable data mining opportunities and then conceive, develop and implement end to end data analytical solutions



Primary Location
United States-New Jersey-New Brunswick-
Other Locations
North America-Canada-Ontario-Toronto, North America-Canada-Ontario-Guelph
Organization
Johnson & Johnson International (6078)
Job Function
Digital Product Development
Requisition ID
4073190905

Title: Computer Hardware Engineer
Description:
About us:
Intelligent Haptronic Solutions Inc. (IHS) is a medical robotics start-up company that focuses on research and development of industry leading surgical training simulation system. IHS has a team of industry leading researchers and experienced engineers that strive for advancing Haptic, VR and AI technology for surgical training applications. IHS is in partnership with Shenzhen Zhichu Computer System Co., Ltd which is responsible for product manufacturing, marketing and sales. IHS is also in partnership with the department of gastroenterology, Beijing Tsinghua Changgung Hospital which will provide clinical trial/evaluation platforms for product development.
Company Website: www.intelligent-haptronic-solutions.com
Company Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/intelligent-haptronic-solutions/
Job Description:
Are you excited about Artificial Intelligence, Virtual Reality and Haptic technology? You have a unique opportunity to join a team of industry leading researchers and experienced engineers with diverse backgrounds in haptics, VR, robotics, AI, computer hardware and software to develop haptic and VR based surgical training simulation systems. These systems will be used by a vast number of hospitals, medical schools and surgical training institutes and to significantly improve the efficiency of surgical training.
Your responsibilities include but not limited to:
Designand bringup PCBs for a variety of electronic devices, including novel sensing systems, tracking systems and haptic devices
Design, develop and debug embedded software for IHS haptic device
Workclosely with engineering team to integrate VR software with the haptic systems.
Job Requirements:
3+ years of experience in Schematic Capture and PCB layout
3+ years of experience in PCB testing and bringup, familiar with lab testing equipment (ie. Oscilloscope, Power Supplies, Multi-meter etc.)
3+ years of experience in C/C++ programming
3+ years of experience working with embedded system
Knowledge in mechanical design and modeling will be a plus
Haptic/Robotics knowledge will be preferred
Benefits of working at IHS:
A generous compensation package which includes extended health and dental benefits.
Excellent fitness facilities and conveniently located on Skytrain.
A flexible work environment and an opportunity to grow into a larger role within the company.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
C/C++ programming: 3 years (Preferred)
PCB design: 3 years (Preferred)
embedded software design: 3 years (Preferred)
Language:
English (Required)

Title: Architectes des données juniors/ Junior Data Architects - ML...
Description:
Date: Aug 27, 2019
*** English Version included below ***

Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.

Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.

Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.

Intelligence automatisée (Machine Intelligence) chez Ericsson:
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser un réseau 5G, l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies d'Intelligence artificielle (IA) - il sera vital pour nous de nous occuper de cette complexité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.

L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures que nous utilisons pour alimenter nos réseaux et services 5G. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie. Notre groupe international met au point des produits de pointe qui simplifient et automatisent les processus de nos produits et services, et apportent une nouvelle valorisation grâce à des informations sur les données.

Ericsson recrute des Architectes Junior des données pour enrichir de manière significative son équipe Global AI Accelerator .

Description du poste :
Ericsson est à la recherche d'Architectes Junior des données compétents pour rejoindre notre équipe d'experts MI en pleine évolution. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez évoluer et optimiserez notre architecture de données et de traitement en cascade (data pipeline), tout en optimisant la circulation et le recueil des données pour les équipes plurifonctionnelles. Vous êtes un expert en établissement de traitements en cascade (data pipeline) et du Data wrangling, qui aime optimiser les systèmes de traitement des données et les faire évoluer. L'Ingénieur de données soutiendra nos concepteurs de logiciels, architectes de bases de données, analystes de données et scientifiques en traitement des données concernant les initiatives portant sur les données, et assurera l'optimisation de ces dernières et des modèles. L'architecture devOps (dataOps) est la même pour tous les projets en cours. Vous êtes autonome et à l'aise lorsqu'il s'agit de réagir face aux besoins en DataOps de plusieurs équipes, systèmes et produits. Vous serez également responsable de les intégrer à l'architecture utilisée dans l'entreprise. Le bon candidat sera enthousiasmé par la perspective d'optimiser ou même de reconcevoir l'architecture dataOps de notre entreprise, afin de soutenir notre nouvelle génération de produits et de solutions stimulés par la MI.

Vos fonctions et responsabilités
Aider à la création et au maintien d'une architecture optimale en pipeline dataOps de modèles et de données
Assembler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, qui satisfont aux conditions opérationnelles fonctionnelles / non fonctionnelles.
Découvrir, concevoir et améliorer les procédés internes : automatisation des procédés manuels, optimisation de la délivrance des données, re-conception de l'infrastructure au bénéfice d'une plus grande possibilité d'évolution, etc.
Établir l'infrastructure requise pour l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement optimaux de données, à partir de différentes sources de données en faisant appel à SQL et à des technologies « Big Data » reposant sur le cloud d'AWS, Azure et autres.
Travailler avec les parties prenantes, notamment l'équipe de la Direction, du service Produits, du service Données et Conception, pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et à satisfaire à leurs besoins en infrastructure de traitement des données.
Faire en sorte que les données soient séparées et sécurisées au-delà des frontières nationales, grâce à plusieurs centres de traitement des données et à des clients / partenaires stratégiques.
Créer des chaines de compilation (toolchain) pour l'équipe des scientifiques en traitement des données et d'analyse, qui les aident à créer et à optimiser notre produit, afin qu'il devienne le premier produit de l'industrie de par son degré d'innovation.
Coopérer avec les experts en apprentissage automatique et en traitement des données, afin d'améliorer le fonctionnement de nos systèmes de gestion du cycle de vie des modèles et de traitement de nos données.
Appuyer l'accumulation de compétences en DapaOps dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients

Ce que nous aimerions constater
BS, MS ou doctorat en informatique, en informatique, en systèmes de traitement des informations ou dans un autre domaine connexe.
De 0 à 2 années d'expérience en utilisation des logiciels / outils suivants :
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Expérience en bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres et Cassandra.
Expérience en outils de traitement en pipeline de modèles et des données, en gestion du déroulement des travaux : Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Compétences en gestion de projets et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.

IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.

Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.

We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.

Machine Intelligence at Ericsson

It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.

Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through data insights.

Ericsson is hiring Junior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.

Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Junior Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and evolving them. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.

Your Roles and Responsibilities
Assist with the creation and maintaining of optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units

What we would like to see
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
0-2 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
Primary country and city: Canada (CA) || || Montreal || R&D
Req ID: 248749

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Tenstorrent is helping enable a new era in artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning with its breakthrough processor architecture and software. The company's mission is to deliver orders of magnitude better performance and efficiency for AI workloads from the datacenter to edge of Cloud by co-designing hardware, software and AI algorithms with our unique technology.
Tenstorrent's architecture scales from datacenter servers to IoT devices with dramatically improved efficiency, flexibility, programmability compared to legacy accelerators including CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and TPU-type processors. It is developed by our world-class team with deep expertise in computer architecture, hardware design and verification, systems engineering, compilers, software development, and machine learning algorithms.
Our engineering-based culture is focused on achieving the highest levels of AI innovation across all of Tenstorrent's technical disciplines. We constantly strive to blend best-in-class aspects of integrity, openness, diversity and collaboration throughout the company: from the CEO to the engineering leadership and to the newest employee who may be a recent college graduate. By joining Tenstorrent, you will be an integral part of a highly accomplished and distinguished team that has many years of experience at companies that include AMD, Arm, Intel and NVIDIA, and that thrives on delivering new, innovative products.
Based in Toronto with offices in Austin, Tenstorrent is growing quickly. And, we are proudly backed by top-tier Venture Capital firms including Real Ventures and Eclipse Venture Capital, as well as prominent industry luminaries.
Tenstorrent offers a highly competitive compensation package and benefits, and we are an equal opportunity employer.
Responsibilities:
Develop machine learning graph compiler
Participate in the co-design of Tenstorrent's hardware and software stack
Benchmark, analyze, and optimize performance of key machine learning applications across Tenstorrent's hardware and software stack
Develop performance analysis and estimation infrastructure that feeds into Tenstorrent compiler
Develop high-performance run-time engine
Integrate the Tenstorrent software into leading machine learning frameworks
Work closely with machine learning engineers to discover the hardware and software requirements of current and future machine learning applications
Qualifications:
BSc, MSc or PhD in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science;
Experience with algorithms, data structures, and software development in C/C++. Python expertise is welcome as well
Familiarity with and passion for any of the following - machine learning, compilers, parallel programming, high-performance and massively parallel systems, processor and computer architecture - is a plus

Title: Software Developer Co-op
Description:
About STN

SendtoNews is the 24th fastest growing tech company in North America, has been recognized as an industry leader in artificial intelligence and is the top ranked digital sports video platform in the US and Canada. The STN tech platform is used by 70+ leagues like MLB, NFL, NBA and PGA Tour, top tier news organizations like USA Today, LA Times, Chicago Tribune and brands like BMW, Google and Best Buy.

What does a Co-op at STN mean for you? Gourmet doughnuts on Friday, team lunch on Tuesday, free Nespresso all day every day, and heated PC vs Console debates that required more than one HR meeting last year. More than that SendtoNews offers you growth, opportunity and the ability to work with a team on the forefront of digital video technology. There is a steep learning curve but those who adapt acquire skills and knowledge that prepare themselves for the challenges of an fast paced and ever-changing tech industry.

Description and Job Requirements

Are you an experienced and adventurous JavaScript developer? Do you enjoy solving problems and having professional, courteous interaction with business partners? SendtoNews is looking for a Co-op Software Developer to join our development team to help build, test, support and maintain our products. This role provides an excellent opportunity for the successful applicant to become an expert in online video player development, video content management and online video advertising. A key component of this role will be troubleshooting video player implementations across our publishing partner sites and ensuring those partners are set up for success.

Responsibilities

Working within a publisher environment involving multiple Content Management Systems to analyze, troubleshoot and debug software programs, primarily in JavaScript and PHP
Communicating with STN’s partners via phone and email to troubleshoot issues and drive forward resolutions
Collaborate with STN’s Publishing Success Managers to help them implement technical solutions with our partners, including debugging and troubleshooting code interactions between our video player and a partner’s code
Actively listening and translating technical issues into concepts and actions which can be understood by publishers who may have less technical knowledge
Design and develop innovative solutions to client needs
Participating in the code development, code review, product testing and product release process
Review implementations of our product by our partners to ensure our technology is functioning optimally
Develop knowledge and skills with technologies that you are not familiar with
Work with the Development team to implement new video player, video content management, and video advertising features to meet the needs of our clients
Work with various internal departments to continuously improve on our ability to support our customers
Qualifications

Sound knowledge of debugging techniques and tools
Demonstrable experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and MySQL
Experience with Web Development
Knowledge of popular Content Management Systems (WordPress, MODX, etc.) a plus
Proven ability to explain technical concepts to a non/less technical audience
The ability to understand basic SQL queries
Understanding of the agile development process
Experience with Google Ad Manager is a plus
Familiarity with Model View Controller frameworks is also a plus
Preference will be given to those with experience with video player technology, including VideoJS, JWPlayer or FlowPlayer

Work Term Duration

8-month co-op work term preferred, will consider 4-month term.

Location

56 Bastion Square, Victoria BC

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Software Developer
Permanent full-time position
About the position
Imagia is looking for an experienced software developer to join its growing software engineering team. The applicant should be comfortable to adapt to new approaches, experiment and re-evaluate what was previously built. The candidate must be allowed to work in Canada.
This position is a full-time employment and can be located in our Montreal (head office) or Granby offices .

What you'll be accountable for:

Bring fresh ideas from all areas, including AI backend, data management platform and medical UIs.
Work closely with research team, AI engineers and other teams and develop products for our industrial partners.
Actively participate in the design, including requirements analysis, evaluation of technical options, and prototyping and implementation of our products.
Provide software design and programming support to research projects and products.
Test and document the products developed by the team.
Keep track of the evolving frameworks and their suitability for use within the team.
Suggest and engage in cross-team collaborations to meet project goals.

About you
The person our team is looking to welcome

At least 3 years of hands-on experience as a Software Developer.
BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject.
Solid knowledge of Python and C++ languages.
Experience in designing RESTful APIs.
Experience in writing concurrent/parallel applications.
Experience with Docker and containerization and in general.
The ability to produce high-quality code, ready for production in a continuously evolving environment.
Assets
Experience in Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and DevOps.
Experience with Cloud environments (such as Google Cloud), and with hybrid Cloud/On-Premise deployments.
Experience with database systems (both SQL and NoSQL)
Experience with ReactJS, VueJS or similar front-end frameworks.
Experience developing real-time applications.
Experience building medical products or working with standards such as ISO 13485/14971 and/or IEC 62304.
About us
Imagia is a dynamic company with the innovative mission of revolutionizing healthcare through artificial intelligence. The well-being of the community and employees, technological innovation and the company’s longevity are at the core of Imagia’s priorities.
Supported by a sound work structure and modern management tools, we offer working conditions focused on flexibility, equity and recognition, while developing our generous total rewards offer.
Our approach is defined by our quality services and ability to have a true positive impact on our clients. Make a real difference as part of a dynamic and driven team!
We offer a stimulating and focused yet fun work environment, modern facilities at the heart of Montreal’s new AI city, a competitive compensation and benefits package, but most importantly, the opportunity to join a group of highly qualified professionals with a genuine passion for health, science and progress. Imagia is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

Title: Conversational AI Designer / Concepteur en intelligence arti...
Description:
Français à la suite...
Conversational AI Designer
Automat is looking for an experienced e-Commerce marketer / designer for our Conversational AI projects on behalf of leading brands. The role involves a mix of user interface design, copywriting, user research and growth hacking – if you're excited by the opportunity to use emerging technology to help brands connect with and understand their customers in a personalized way, we want to talk to you!
The Role
As a customer experience (CX) designer, you will be responsible for designing and building compelling conversational experiences that delight consumers and make their lives easier, while also providing business value to our clients. As part of our Customer Delivery and Success team, you'll work directly with client teams of marketers and innovators, understand their end customers' needs, and implement innovative concepts using Automat's Conversational AI technology. You'll also conduct user research, measure performance, and update our design best-practices based on learnings. It's a unique opportunity to work with well-known companies within a nimble venture-backed startup where you can have an outsized impact.
Your Profile
You have experience in conversational customer experience
You have experience in e-commerce, advertising, marketing and/or copywriting (ideally two or more of the above)
You possess outstanding English verbal and written communication skills
You're detail-oriented, comfortable with data, resourceful, self-motivated and resilient
You're comfortable making and justifying design decisions in data-driven terms
You know your way around common analytics platforms such as Google, Adobe, etc.
You have a positive track record being part of an experienced and hardworking cross-functional team

Bonus points if you…
Have completed a degree in commerce, social sciences or engineering
Have experience with markup / scripting languages like HTML, CSS, or Javascript
Are talented at visual design, branding, film or multimedia design

What Automat offers:
Experience in the emerging area of Artificial Intelligence + e-Commerce + CX Design
The opportunity to work alongside a globally-recognized AI research team, using leading-edge technology
The chance to work directly with internationally-renowned brands and Fortune 100 companies
Outsized impact, as an early member of a Montreal-headquartered startup with offices (and investors) in Silicon Valley and New York
A supportive, smart, diverse and dynamic team, coupled with a transparent open culture
Competitive salary, great health benefits and a flexible “work from home” policy

About Automat
Automat is helping companies use AI to talk to their customers, to understand them and serve them better. We're the first Conversational Marketing platform powered by Artificial Intelligence and we believe in a world where every company can have a personalized one-on-one conversation with every customer, fan, and follower.

Concepteur en intelligence artificielle conversationnelle
Automat est à la recherche d'un spécialiste du marketing du commerce électronique / concepteur pour ses projets en intelligence artificielle conversationnelle pour des entreprises de renom. Le titulaire de ce poste accomplira diverses tâches comme le design d'interface, la rédaction technique, les études sur les utilisateurs et le piratage de croissance. Si l'idée d'employer une technologie émergente pour permettre aux entreprises de rejoindre et de mieux comprendre leur clientèle de manière personnalisée vous stimule, nous aimerions vous rencontrer!
Le poste
En tant que concepteur d'expérience utilisateur (EU), vous concevrez et bâtirez une expérience conversationnelle attirante qui plaira à la clientèle et lui facilitera la vie tout en générant une valeur commerciale pour nos clients. En tant que membre de l'équipe Exécution et réussite auprès de la clientèle, vous travaillerez directement avec les équipes du marketing et de l'innovation de nos clients pour comprendre les besoins de leur clientèle. Vous devrez aussi développer des concepts novateurs à l'aide de la technologie de l'intelligence artificielle conversationnelle d'Automat, puis les implémenter chez eux. De plus, vous ferez des études sur les utilisateurs, mesurerez la performance et mettrez à jour nos pratiques exemplaires en conception en fonction des leçons apprises. Nous vous offrons une occasion unique de travailler avec des sociétés bien connues au sein d'une entreprise en démarrage agile financée par du capital de risque où votre contribution sera remarquée.
Votre profil
Vous avez déjà travaillé en expérience conversationnelle avec la clientèle
Vous avez de l'expérience en commerce en ligne, en publicité, en marketing et en rédaction technique (au moins deux parmi ceux-ci)
Vous avez des aptitudes exceptionnelles en communication orale et écrite en anglais.
Vous vous souciez des petits détails et vous êtes à l'aise avec les données. Vous êtes aussi plein de ressources, motivé et résilient.
En plus de maîtriser le langage des données, vous êtes en mesure de prendre des décisions de conception et de les justifier.
Vous connaissez les plateformes d'analyse, comme Google, Adobe ou autres, sur le bout de vos doigts.
Vous avez déjà fait partie d'équipes interfonctionnelles expérimentées et dynamiques, et vos coéquipiers en gardent un souvenir positif.
Vous obtenez des points-bonis si...
Vous avez terminé un programme en commerce, en sciences sociales, en linguistiques ou en génie.
Vous maîtrisez le français (point-boni supplémentaire pour toute autre langue).
Vous avez de l'expérience avec les langages de balisage et de script comme HTML, CSS ou JavaScript.
Vous avez du talent en design visuel, en stratégie de marque, en cinéma et en conception multimédia.
Ce qu'Automat vous offre :
De l'expérience dans des domaines émergents tels que l'intelligence artificielle, le commerce en ligne et la conception d'EU.
La possibilité de travailler avec une équipe de recherche en IA reconnue à l'échelle mondiale et d'utiliser une technologie à la fine pointe.
La chance de travailler directement auprès d'entreprises de renommée internationale et faisant partie du Fortune 100.
D'être parmi les premiers membres d'une entreprise en démarrage dont le siège social est à Montréal et qui possède des bureaux (et des investisseurs) dans la Silicon Valley et à New York.
Une équipe dynamique, diversifiée, intelligente et très solidaire conjuguée à une culture ouverte et transparente.
Un salaire concurrentiel, de très bons avantages sociaux et une politique de télétravail souple.
À propos d'Automat
Automat aide les entreprises à utiliser l'intelligence artificielle pour s'entretenir avec leurs clients, les comprendre et mieux les servir. Nous sommes la première plateforme de marketing conversationnel optimisée par l'intelligence artificielle et croyons en un monde où toutes les entreprises peuvent avoir des entretiens individuels avec chaque client, partisan et abonné.

Title: Developer Technology Engineer - AI
Description:
NVIDIA is looking for a passionate, world-class computer scientist to work in its Compute Developer Technology (Devtech) team as an AI Developer Technology Engineer.
What you will be doing:
Study and develop cutting-edge techniques in deep learning, graphs, machine learning, and data analytics, and perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current- and next-generation GPU architectures.
Work directly with key customers to understand the current and future problems they are solving and provide the best AI solutions using GPUs.
Collaborate closely with the architecture, research, libraries, tools, and system software teams at NVIDIA to influence the design of next-generation architectures, software platforms, and programming models.
What we need to see:
Possess a PhD from a leading university in an engineering or computer science related discipline, or MS and 1+ years of relevant work experience.
Your works shows a strong knowledge of C/C++, software design, programming techniques, and AI algorithms.
3+ years experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++.
Strong communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management, and task prioritization skills.
Some travel is required for conferences and for on-site visits with developers.
Artificial intelligence, the dream of computer scientists for over half a century, is no longer science fiction. And in the next few years, it will transform every industry. Soon, self-driving cars will reduce congestion and improve road safety. AI travel agents will know your preferences and arrange every detail of your family vacation. And medical instruments will read and understand patient DNA to detect and treat early signs of cancer.
Where engines made us stronger and powered the first industrial revolution, AI will make us smarter and power the next. What will make this intelligent industrial revolution possible? A new computing model — GPU deep learning — that enables computers to learn from data and write software that is too complex for people to code.
#deeplearning

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable insurance companies to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide insurers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.
Duration: Permanent
Location: Keele and Steeles (TTC Accessible, free parking). Moving to Downtown Toronto soon.
Job Description
You will work with the data engineering at Daisy Intelligence and act as a valued member of the Research & Development team. You will be conducting applied research in the areas of farud detection optimization, biomimicry, statistics, machine learning, reinforcement learning, visualization and numerical methods.
Daisy Intelligence solutions involve modeling vast volumes of our clients' data, which requires leading edge computing and machine learning methods. You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.
Key Accountabilities
Mathematical model research, as well as literature research.
Mathematical models for fraud detection and risk management
Software solution design, programming development and testing.
Documenting and co-authoring internal research papers and patents.
Commercialization of successful applied research into software products that will be used by Daisy Intelligence delivery teams to service clients in the Insurance, Retail and Healthcare industries.
Technical Skills
You possess a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, where your research focused on the development of numerical methods.
You have strong programming skills with a minimum of 1000 hours experience using C/C++, and/or Python.
Experience using CUDA in a GPU development environment is an asset.
You have a working knowledge of database technologies with very strong SQL skills or ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data.
Strong mathematical skills with knowledge/interest in machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced statistics, parallel computing and operations research.
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
General skills and Attitude
You have strong leadership skills and leverage them to manage deadlines and priorities.
You are an excellent learner who can adopt to new technologies quickly.
You have an interest in solving complex business problems.
You are interested in the creation of new and leading-edge technology.
You possess strong English written and oral communication skills.
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines.
You desire to advance the world of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Skills & Qualifications
Have 5-10 years’ experience in the areas of machine learning and mathematical modeling.
3+ years of experience in the area of fraud detection and/or risk management
Have a strong work ethic and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery.
Have an ability to find creative solutions to complex leading-edge problems.
Enjoy working on small high-performance teams.
Learn new capabilities and grow your expertise.
Why Daisy Intelligence?
Picture yourself building a successful career at Daisy Intelligence —working alongside other talented, driven individuals to deliver artificial intelligence solutions that are not out of reach for any organization. Daisy Intelligence transforms massive quantities of consumer data into profitable decisions. Our proprietary mathematical solutions simulate all the possible business scenarios that set our clients on the optimal path to grow their bottom line.
You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture: one that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. We are the future of analytics. Daisy Intelligence is located in Toronto, Ontario area. Please note our candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
Perks
Annual performance bonus
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
Skills development
Flexibility
Start-up culture

No agencies or B2B services please.

Title: FPGA Design Engineer
Description:
Tenstorrent is helping enable a new era in artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning with its breakthrough processor architecture and software. The company's mission is to deliver orders of magnitude better performance and efficiency for AI workloads from the datacenter to edge of Cloud by co-designing hardware, software and AI algorithms with our unique technology.
Tenstorrent's architecture scales from datacenter servers to IoT devices with dramatically improved efficiency, flexibility, programmability compared to legacy accelerators including CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and TPU-type processors. It is developed by our world-class team with deep expertise in computer architecture, hardware design and verification, systems engineering, compilers, software development, and machine learning algorithms.
Our engineering-based culture is focused on achieving the highest levels of AI innovation across all of Tenstorrent's technical disciplines. We constantly strive to blend best-in-class aspects of integrity, openness, diversity and collaboration throughout the company: from the CEO to the engineering leadership and to the newest employee who may be a recent college graduate. By joining Tenstorrent, you will be an integral part of a highly accomplished and distinguished team that has many years of experience at companies that include AMD, Arm, Intel and NVIDIA, and that thrives on delivering new, innovative products.
Based in Toronto with offices in Austin, Tenstorrent is growing quickly. And, we are proudly backed by top-tier Venture Capital firms including Real Ventures and Eclipse Venture Capital, as well as prominent industry luminaries.
Tenstorrent offers a highly competitive compensation package and benefits, and we are an equal opportunity employer.
Tenstorrent is designing machine learning systems which will re-define the state-of-the art for ML processing in many application areas – from many-chip data center systems to tiny battery powered devices.
As an FPGA design engineer in our System Engineering team, you will be focusing on architecture and design of interconnect solutions for multi-processor systems, as well as FPGA emulation of Tenstorrent's AI processors.
Responsibilities:
Participation in next generation deep learning system architecture – a “full stack” effort spanning software, processor and system architecture teams
High speed digital design of new components targeting state of the art Xilinx and Intel FPGAs
Conversion of ASIC designs to FPGA for emulation purposes
Participation in PCB architecture and simulation
Bring up, debug, validation


Qualifications:
Bachelor or Master's in Electrical or Computer Engineering
Expert knowledge of hardware description languages (Verilog/VHDL)
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent understanding of computer architecture and logic design
Strong understanding of high-speed serial interfaces
Solid programming skills (C, C++, Python, Perl)
Experience using lab equipment: high speed oscilloscopes, logic and protocol analyzers, spectrum analyzers, etc.
Interest in and understanding of machine learning
Superior verbal and written communication skills

Title: Developer/Technical support specialist
Description:
