Title: Machine Learning Programmer
Description:
Job Posting

Job ID:

35282


Location:
Vancouver - Point Grey Campus

Employment Group:

Management&Professional (AAPS)

Job Category:

Scientific Engineering

Classification Title:

Scientific Eng., Level C

Business Title:

Machine Learning Programmer

VP/Faculty:

Faculty of Science

Department:

Computer Science

Salary Range:

$66,787.00 (minimum) - $80,176.00 (midpoint) - $96,212.00 (maximum)



Full/Part Time:
Full-Time





2019/10/14


Job End Date:

2021/10/15

Funding Type:

Grant Funded





Closing Date:

2019/09/29

Available Openings:

1





Guiding principle: "Midpoint" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.





Job Summary


This job is about producing open-source machine learning software in support of DARPA-funded research on "data driven discovery of models" (D3M - https://www.darpa.mil/program/data-driven-discovery-of-models) and "Learning with less labels" (LWLL - https://www.darpa.mil/program/learning-with-less-labels). The basic idea is to transition research from Dr. Wood's "programming languages and artificial intelligence" (PLAI) group at UBC (https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~fwood) into production-quality software that can be shared with other DARPA program performers and the world.

Our collective aim is to leverage techniques from deep learning, reinforcement learning, and probabilistic programming to a) fully automate machine learning (training dataset -> fully trained model) and to do so with orders of magnitude fewer labels (semi- and un-supervised learning).
The basic job will be to code, to high professional open-source standards, impactful algorithmic and modeling outputs from the PLAI group. Also, importantly, to respond to team and program requests for software outputs and solutions to challenge problems imposed by DARPA, etc.

This position is different to most industry machine learning developer positions in that the job holder will be implementing state of the art algorithms and working directly with and in support of the researchers developing these algorithms. For this reason, the job can be reasonably expected to be extremely challenging in terms of how fast the job holder will have to be able to take up and understand new techniques and technology. The positive consequence of this is that the job will not be boring.



Organizational Status


Reports to the faculty member responsible for the research grant and software development effort. Incumbent will also interact with other faculty, postdoctoral research fellows and students in the laboratory.



Work Performed


Design, develop, and implement custom machine learning systems based on current research
Translate laboratory research into open-source software
Respond, in code and produced outputs, to DARPA-specified challenge problems
Collaborate with research team, sponsor, and external team members
Participate in coordination calls with DARPA and external team members
Manage technical relationships with some DARPA and external team members
Document and maintain open-source software repositories



Supervision Received


Formally reports to Dr. Wood; daily supervision will be provided by the laboratory manager, postdoctoral researchers, and senior research PhD students in the group.



Supervision Given


On a case by case basis, student programmers (interns and the like) may be hired to assist the overall effort and direct management of their software practice and output may be expected. As well, junior PhD and MS students' software outputs may be managed throughout.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


Third and fourth year funding on both efforts is contingent on satisfactory performance on DARPA-specified challenge problems. Failure to perform could mean discontinued funding.



Qualifications


Undergraduate degree in Engineering or Applied Science. Machine learning foundation: Required: UBC CS340 (https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~fwood/CS340/) or equivalent. Includes: automatic differentiation, regression, classification, SVM's, logistic regression, random forests, conceptual understanding of test/training/validation and understanding of overfitting on the validation set in particular.
Desired: UBC CS540 (https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~schmidtm/Courses/540-W18/) or equivalent. Includes: reinforcement learning, Monte-Carlo tree search, stochastic variational inference, graphical models.
Desired: probabilistic programming (https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~fwood/CS532W-539W/) A minimum of 5 years of experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience. A reasonable candidate is a professional Python developer with a strong CS or statistics educational background, a high level of familiarity with the Python and PyTorch ecosystems, and an urge to do something more challenging, perhaps en route to a graduate degree or a ML-related startup.
Programming and related CS skills:required: Python, PyTorch, git, compiler and parser programming desired: SLURM, cloud-compute, shell-scripting, databases.





.
Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

Title: ETL Developer, Implementation
Description:
ETL Developer, Implementation
Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! In a fast-moving and competitive world, Daisy Intelligence helps retailers make better decisions that lead to higher profits and sales. We simplify and optimize the decision-making process around promotional product selection and pricing by automating category management processes. Retailers can streamline their promotional planning, while allowing their people to focus on high-value activities like new product development, customer service, and negotiating better deals with vendors. Using Daisy’s artificial intelligence (A.I.) software, retailers can embrace a new way to measure promotional performance and generate metrics that they have never had before. Daisy revolutionizes how retailers operate by letting them analyze data that uncovers the complex relationships between products. Higher margins are the result. For innovative retailers looking for a competitive edge, Daisy is a strategic partner who can help them take a new and better approach to promotional planning.
You will join a team of dedicated, entrepreneurial employees that are building a company out of the ordinary. We operate in a team-based culture. One that combines a strong customer focus with a devotion to improve everything we do. Daisy Intelligence is in the Toronto, Canada area.
As an ETL Developer on new client implementations, you will be on the forward edge of new customers. Working as part of our client onboarding team, you will help clients to realize meaningful business goals and strategies with the Daisy platform of products and services.
Accountabilities
Accountable for ETL development for new client implementations.
Lead an ongoing portfolio of client ETL implementations based on best practices and meeting internal efficiency and standardization objectives
Continuously collaborate with others on the onboarding team, particularly with data mapping role to quickly address questions and gaps and develop optimal solutions
Work with the Project Manager on project plans, milestones, and tasks.
Create, implement and maintain technical documentation
Maintain an in-depth understanding of Daisy’s suite of products and data warehouse practices and updates at all times.
Technical Skills
You possess a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems (or equivalent combination of skill and experience)
You have a strong working knowledge of database technologies with at least 3 years ETL Development experience
Excellent PL/SQL programming skills with a demonstrated ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data.
Expertise in a broad array of development tools (Hadoop / Big Data Ecosystem (HDFS/S3, Hive, Spark), Python
Proficiency working in Hadoop and DB2 in a Linux environment
Experience in retail industry custom or structured data integration design, implementation, and maintenance
Knowledgeable on business intelligence tools such as Tableau
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation
General skills and Attitude
You are an excellent learner who can adapt to new demands quickly
Team oriented collaborator particularly with client management, project management, data architects and development team
Have a strong work ethic, and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery
Adept communicator with the ability to translate difficult concepts into layman’s terms and act as the interpreter between technical and non-technical implementation stakeholders.
Have an ability to find creative solutions to complex problems
Strong English written and oral communication skills
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines
No agencies or B2B services please.

Title: QA Embedded Software Developer in Test
Description:
**English follows**
Newtrax
Newtrax a rejoint Sandvik Mining et Rock Technology comme une unité d'affaire indépendante. Newtrax croit que l'avenir de l'exploitation minière est souterrain, non seulement parce que les minéraux proches de la surface sont de plus en plus rares, mais aussi parce que les mines souterraines ont une empreinte environnementale beaucoup plus faible.
Pour accélérer la transition vers un avenir où 100% des activités d'extraction sont souterraines, Newtrax élimine la différence numérique actuelle entre les mines à ciel ouvert et les mines souterraines. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Newtrax intègre les dernières technologies de l'Internet des objets (IoT) et de l'intelligence artificielle afin de suivre et fournir des informations sur les opérations souterraines, notamment en ce qui concerne les personnes, les machines et l'environnement.
En tant qu'organisation apprenante dans un secteur mondial en rapide évolution, nos employés constituent notre atout le plus précieux. Nos valeurs fondamentales sont les suivantes:
Santé et sécurité
Citoyen gobal
Travail d'équipe et confiance
Excellence
Discipline financière rigoureuse
Pour en savoir plus sur nos produits, visitez la page suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ et pour voir les témoignages de nos employés, visionnez la vidéo suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
Vos avantages
Travaillez dans un environnement dynamique et rapide où vous aurez des opportunités de croissance.
Joignez une entreprise primée (Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec: prix génie innovation, sélectionné au palmarès Technology Fast 50 au Canada, Entrepreneur de l'année - Technologies de moins de 100 employés).
Travaillez dans un milieu collaboratif et positif, dans une entreprise à taille humaine.
Faites partie d'une entreprise en pleine croissance, présente dans le monde entier.
Profitez d’un espace de travail à aire ouverte au coeur du Vieux-Montréal.
Ayez un accès très pratique en métro, autobus, train ou vélo.
Travaillez avec des professionnels de l’industrie.
Bénéficiez d’une gamme d’assurances complètes et salaire compétitif.
Sommaire
En tant que membre de l’équipe de systèmes embarqués, vous travaillerez avec plusieurs développeurs de logiciels embarqués pour vous aider à tester les dernières technologies de pointe et s'assurer que tous les produits sont livrés à la plus haute qualité.
Le candidat idéal sera en mesure d'exécuter ses engagements dans un environnement au rythme rapide, de présenter des informations techniques en termes simples à différents niveaux de compréhension et de collaborer avec des équipes de service et de produit dotées de solides compétences en communication centrées sur la résolution de problèmes.
Vos responsabilités
Collaborer pour que les fonctionnalités soient bien définies avant le développement
Fournir des commentaires fréquents et réguliers à l'équipe
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre la plate-forme de test du logiciel intégré
Planifier, développer, coordonner et effectuer des tests pour plusieurs produits
Créer des scénarios de test et créer des suites de tests en mettant l’accent sur l’automatisation
Participer aux discussions sur la conception du produit et présenter les résultats des tests aux équipes d'ingénierie et à la direction
Participer au test du système
Recherchez et aidez à reproduire les problèmes des clients
Valider que tous les documents de conception sont exacts et mis à jour
S'assurer que toute la documentation est exacte et pertinente (notes de publication, manuels d'installation, d'utilisation et de maintenance, etc.)
Votre talent
BS ou diplôme équivalent en EE / Informatique ou dans un domaine connexe
Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience dans les tests / automatisation de tests de logiciels intégrés et des applications associées
Forte expérience de Linux embarqué
Compétences de haut niveau en programmation / débogage en Python, C / C ++, Qt, etc.
Expérience confirmée des réseaux de communication de données et des protocoles et technologies associés tels que TCP, UDP, multidiffusion, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP / HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, commutation de couche 2 et 3, pare-feu, NAT et principes de sécurité de base du réseau
Connaissance des réseaux LTE, WiFi, BLE et CAN est préférable
Capacité à travailler efficacement avec des équipes interfonctionnelles
Excellente communication verbale et écrite et compétences interpersonnelles éprouvées
Être orienté vers les résultats, motivé et doté d'un esprit d'équipe
Possibilité de voyager occasionnellement sur les sites des clients 10%
**Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte et ce, sans aucune discrimination.
_______________________
About Newtrax
Newtrax has joined Sandvik Mining and Rock Technology as a Standalone Business Unit. Newtrax believes the future of mining is underground, not only because minerals close to the surface are increasingly rare, but because underground mines have a significantly lower environmental footprint.
To accelerate the transition to a future where 100% of mining is underground, Newtrax eliminates the current digital divide between surface mines and underground mines. To achieve this goal, Newtrax integrates the latest Internet-of-Things and Artificial Intelligence technologies to monitor and provide insights on underground operations, including people, machines and the environment.
As a learning organization in a fast-paced global industry, our most precious asset is our employees and our guiding values are:
Health, Safety & Security
Global Citizenship
Teamwork & Trust
Excellence
Rigorous Financial Discipline
To learn more about our products visit the following page: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ and To see testimonials from our employees, view the following video: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
What’s in it for you?
Work in a dynamic and fast paced environment where you will have growth opportunities.
Join an award-winning company (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec: Prix Génie innovation, Selected as Technology Fast 50 in Canada by Deloitte, Entrepreneur of the year - Technology under 100 employees).
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment, in a human-scale company.
Be part of a growing company that has a global presence around the world.
Spacious open office in the heart of Old Montreal.
Super-convenient access by metro, bus, train or bike.
Opportunity to work with industry leading professionals.
Complete insurance package and competitive salary.
Summary
As a member of the embedded system group, you will work with multiple embedded software development teams to help testing the latest cutting-edge technology and ensure that all products are delivered to the highest quality.

The ideal candidate will be able to execute on commitments in fast paced environment, present technical information in simple terms to a variety of understanding levels, and collaborate with service and product teams with strong communication skills focused on problem solving.
Your responsibilities
Collaborate in ensuring that features are well defined ahead of development
Provide frequent and regular feedback to the team
Design and implement the embedded software testing platform
Plan, develop, coordinate, and perform testing for multiple products
Create test cases and build test suites with a focus on automation
Participate in discussions on product design and present test results to engineering teams and management.
Participate in system test
Investigate and help reproduce customer issues
Validate that all design documents are accurate and updated
Ensure all documentation is accurate and relevant (Release notes, installation, operation and maintenance manuals, …)
Your talent
BS or equivalent degree in EE/Computer Science or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in testing/test automation of embedded software and associated applications
Strong experience in Embedded Linux
High level skills in programming/debugging Python, C / C++, Qt, etc.
Demonstrated experience in data communication networks and associated protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, Multicasting, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP/HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, Layer 2 and 3 switching, firewalls, NATs and basic network security principles
Knowledge in LTE, WiFi, BLE, CAN bus is preferred
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Excellent verbal and written communication and proven interpersonal skills
Be result oriented, self-motivated and a team player
Ability to travel occasionally to customer sites 10%

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Position Description:
CGI has a future opportunity for a Data Scientist to join our team in Ottawa. Attributes that define our ideal candidates will include:

Have analytical curiosity, strong data-oriented skills and a statistical programming background
Possess a successful track record of designing and developing AI/ML algorithms for private or public sector solutions
Up-to-date with the latest technology trends, have a strong desire to constantly learn and be ready to put on the hacker's hat at any time to convert an idea into a demonstration
Highly detailed-oriented with exceptional organizational and follow-through skills
Self-started and able to execute without a lot of direction or oversight
Exceptional communication skills, with an ability to make advanced analytics concepts accessible and understandable to non-technical business users
Value collaboration and urgency; and have a passion for driving impact
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Solve some of the most challenging and impactful problems for financial services, insurance and the government by using artificial intelligence, machine learning, natural language processing and big data
Drive innovation into Analytics solutions and focus on humanizing enterprise software to achieve better customer experience and to enable data-driven business decisions
Work on high priority initiatives using advanced analytics, predictive modeling and a variety of data sources to produce actionable business insights
Ideate, conceptualize, design, develop and maintain AI/ML algorithms that provide data insights that drive operational efficiencies and cost savings
Build production grade models on large-scale datasets. Utilize advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, and data mining techniques
Provide guidance to a customer and project team with respect to technical feasibility, complexity, and level of effort required to deliver a solution
Work closely with other team members to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insights that measure business performance improvements
Assist in the development and delivery of pre and post sales POCs, presentations and proposals for client engagements
Travel periodically in support of sales and delivery as needed
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
At least 2 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects
2 years of hands-on experience using complex machine learning methods and algorithms
At least 2 years of experience working with one or more data mining tools such as R, Python, Scala or SAS
Hands-on experience working with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Cassandra, and/or Hadoop
Hands-on experience writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases such as Oracle, DB2 or SQL Server
Hands-on experience constructing and manipulating JSON and XML documents and working with NoSQL databases such as MangoDB and CouchDB
Good understanding of microservices architecture and hands-on experience working with REST APIs
Self-directed and demonstrable problem-solving skills
Knowledge of modern software development techniques and methodologies
Knowledge and practice of secure software development processes
Ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or information systems (or equivalent combination of skill and experience)
What grabs our attention

4 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects
4 years of hands-on experience using Machine Learning, Cognitive, and AI APIs
4 years of experience with both relational and NoSQL technologies
2 years of experience using data transformation and integration services such as Kafka Connect and/or Py.Spark
Knowledge of the Python data ecosystem using pandas and NumPy Experience building and deploying ML pipelines
2 years of experience working on predictive analytics and data mining projects for financial services, insurance, healthcare or the government
Expertise with Agile development methodology and Continuous delivery best practices
Knowledge of RPA automation tools such as UIPath or Blue Prism
Master's or PhD degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or information systems
What you can expect from us:
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

Title: Technical Product Owner
Product Designer
Description:
We're Ada. We're an ambitious team based out of Toronto that enables businesses around the world to provide incredible customer service. Our AI-powered platform has automated 16 million+ conversations for companies like Shopify, Telus, Upwork, and Coinbase – and we're just getting started.

Just as the field of machine learning continues to advance, so do we. And it is the passion of our people and dedication to our craft that continues to drive our dramatic growth.

We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer a new industry, and welcome those who want to join us.

We're looking for an experienced product designer to join our design team at Ada. This is an opportunity to do the best work of your life on a highly impactful and visionary product, at a time when our principles of excellent design are just emerging.

One of our products is in use by millions of people every single day to answer questions about our customers products. Our challenge is to craft a very refined, accessible and familiar experience. On our team, we work together to make all the interactions needed for a successful support conversation simple and flawless.

This is also a chance to impress a much smaller, but more passionate group of people (our customers) who spend the majority of their workday in our product, leading their bot's work flows, training new answers and gaining insight into the performance of their automation. The challenge with this product is to tackle problems at the intersection of machine learning and content management where existing interface patterns often do not exist.

Our team is small, agile and tight-knit. Design is deeply important to our entire company. We want everything we produce to be well-designed and for it to be part of our legacy.

---------
About You
---------

You have a deep respect for your craft and want to be the best at everything you do
You're not easily satisfied and dislike disorder and inconsistency
You're a clear systems thinker, problem solver and visual communicator
You have experience working on challenging projects and feature sets
You understand UX Design, research, & prototyping (low and high fidelity)
You're kind and direct with your feedback
You have an interest in artificial intelligence and making human-computer interaction simple (think Alan Kay, Steve Jobs, Bret Victor)
--------
Outcomes
--------

Along with our team, you will translate vision, feedback and ideas into shippable product designs
You will guide product research
You'll work closely with other designers, engineers, and our product managers to ensure everything we ship meets our standards of quality
We'll collaborate to build design standards and practices
You'll contribute feedback regularly towards improving our company and products
--------
About Us
--------

Ada is a rapidly growing company located at Spadina and Adelaide in Toronto, Canada's thriving AI ecosystem. We are backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners and Version One.
We provide our employees with competitive compensation, great health benefits, and ownership in our company.
Our work is rooted in kindness, curiosity, authenticity, trust, craft, and agility. We use these values to create a culture that encourages groundbreaking results, career progression, and community investment.
Ada is an equal opportunity employer. In fact, diversity is what drives our success – it's at the core of how we hire, communicate, and work. Like our Platform, we are inclusive to all, and combine our diverse backgrounds, skill sets and thinking to build the best experiences for our clients and their customers.

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Machine Learning/AI)
Description:
The Startup
Briq is altering the landscape for construction decision making. We are harnessing the power of data to build the industry's first construction data cloud. Leaders in automation, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Briq is helping construction companies minimize risk and maximize success.
The Skinny
Briq is ready for curious, charismatic, creative people to join the Engineering Team at one of the fastest-growing construction analytics companies.
Our team of strategists, leaders, data scientists, and change-makers are revolutionizing the world by providing data tools that improve decision-making in one of the most predominant industries today. Our clients are among the largest builders in the world; responsible for creating the infrastructure you thrive on and designing the cities you live, work and play in. They are hungry for better, smarter data and we are hungry for your talents to help make it happen.
The Skill
The Briq Engineering team is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to fuel our accelerated growth. We are rapidly growing and ready for someone who harbors a passion for crafting and deploying top quality, high-performing, secure systems to join the Briq family in evolving our platform and changing the world of construction.
The Principal Software Engineer will guide the engineering team in decision-making and best practices; ensuring a consistently high-quality product while:
Driving engineering culture of excellence in partnership with product teams
Leading technical direction on design, implementation, and deployment of software that satisfies the evolving needs of our customers
Coordinating leadership contribution and buy-in to design planning process across Briq products and services
Ensuring the use of data is woven throughout the Briq enterprise
Establishing organizational best-practices scalable across teams and products resulting in consistent, high-quality, industry standard-setting software systems
Building internal and external relationships as a Briq evangelist and thought leader
The Standard
To be successful as a principal software engineer, you will have exceptional leadership, communication and project management skills with a deep understanding of software systems at multiple levels of abstraction and an intrinsic desire to develop the skills and talents of others. You take a keen interest in international trends in engineering and leadership and harbor an above average emotional intelligence. Moreover, your background likely looks a lot like this:
Fifteen (15) years of experience in web-based software development/software engineering, data warehousing, or other client/server applications
Experience with a range of engineering skills including requirements collection, architectural design, documentation organization, and operations management
Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, PhD preferred
Actively participated in a development team operating at large scale
Technically led a team of software developers and demonstrated mentoring skills within the group
Experience with a wide range of programming language paradigms
Experience with relational and noSQL databases
Experience with web development platforms such as Rails
Experience with real world applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning
Proficiency with cloud computing providers such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Services, or Microsoft Azure
The Briq platform is used by construction leaders looking for meaning in their data. You'll join a highly collaborative and passionate engineering and product organization who are on a mission to help people see and understand data, dedicated to building a fantastic company and workplace, and are relentlessly focused on our customers and on building amazing products. Principal software engineers report directly to the CTO and work closely with the director of engineering to support all aspects of developing and operating our products.
Briq is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you think you have what it takes to thrive here, we want you!

Title: Senior Java Developer in Toronto
Description:
About RepRisk
RepRisk is a global leader and pioneer in data science, specializing in premium ESG and business conduct risk research and quantitative solutions. Since 2006, RepRisk has been leveraging artificial intelligence and curated human analysis to translate big data into actionable business intelligence and risk metrics. With daily-updated data synthesized in 20 languages using a rules-based methodology, RepRisk systematically flags and monitors material ESG risks and violations of international standards that can have reputational, compliance, and financial impacts on a company. Our flagship product, the RepRisk Platform, is the world’s largest database of its kind, consisting of 130k+ public and private companies and 30k+ projects of all sizes, in every sector and market. Leading organizations around the world rely on RepRisk as their key due diligence solution to prevent and mitigate ESG and business conduct risks related to their operations, business relationships, and investments.
Job Description
As a Senior Java Developer, you will be involved in all aspects of back-end software development within RepRisk, including design, implementation and operation. The role will primarily involve development and maintenance of data processing and language analysis solutions, mainly written in Java and PHP. There will be frequent opportunities to work on a broad range of technologies from data processing and integration, machine learning and NLP, databases (SQL/ORM) to deployment and operation on a Unix environment.
You will benefit from working with an experienced team in several locations that will offer support and the scope to greatly enhance your technical skills and knowledge. You will profit from an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies. We want to find someone who is keen to contribute ideas and who loves implementing clean and workable solutions to problems.
Responsibilities
Design and implement features in Java (Spring Framework)
Deploy, maintain and support existing software solutions (Java/PHP/Linux)
Create and update technical documentation
Software testing and quality assurance
Evaluate and identify new technologies
Candidate Profile
You have several years of experience in Java and a strong track record in design, implementation and testing of complex back-end applications. Strong analytical skills and profound knowledge in algorithms and data structures are required. You have the willingness to learn and explore new technologies to create fast, reliable and high-quality software solutions.
You are results-driven and maintain a pragmatic outlook without compromising quality. Proficiency in all areas of frontend development and the ability to cope with an agile environment should be among your established skills. The position requires strong self-management, the ability to deliver on agreed-upon tasks, and to manage expectations even when under pressure. You must be fluent in English.
Experience and Education
Solid experience in the tasks mentioned
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent qualifications
Interest in data analysis/machine learning would be an advantage
Experience in the following technologies would be a plus: Elasticsearch, Hazelcast, GraphQL, ActiveMQ, Keycloak or similar SSO technology.
What we offer
Being part a growing, experienced team that will offer support and the opportunity to enhance your technical skills and knowledge; ability to work in an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies
Entrepreneurial and dynamic work environment with a young and motivated international team within an established company setting
Open and flexible workplace
Opportunity to make a significant contribution to the field of sustainability
Note: work authorization for the respective location is required
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Cloud Solution Architect
Data Architect
Description:
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
Intelligence automatisée (Machine Intelligence) chez Ericsson:
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser un réseau 5G, l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies d'Intelligence artificielle (IA) - il sera vital pour nous de nous occuper de cette complexité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures que nous utilisons pour alimenter nos réseaux et services 5G. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie. Notre groupe international met au point des produits de pointe qui simplifient et automatisent les processus de nos produits et services, et apportent une nouvelle valorisation grâce à des informations sur les données.
Ericsson recrute des architectes expérimentés et seniors des données pour enrichir de manière significative son équipe Global AI Accelerator .
Description du poste :
Ericsson est à la recherche d'architectes des données compétents pour rejoindre son équipe d'experts MI en pleine évolution. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez évoluer et optimiserez notre architecture de données et de traitement en cascade (data pipeline), tout en optimisant la circulation et le recueil des données pour les équipes plurifonctionnelles. Vous êtes un expert en établissement de traitements en cascade (data pipeline) et du Datawrangling, qui aime optimiser les systèmes de traitement des données et les faire évoluer. L'Ingénieur de données soutiendra nos concepteurs de logiciels, architectes de bases de données, analystes de données et scientifiques en traitement des données concernant les initiatives portant sur les données, et assurera l'optimisation de ces dernières et des modèles. L'architecture devOps (dataOps) est la même pour tous les projets en cours. Vous êtes autonome et à l'aise lorsqu'il s'agit de réagir face aux besoins en DataOps de plusieurs équipes, systèmes et produits. Vous serez également responsable de les intégrer à l'architecture utilisée dans l'entreprise. Le bon candidat sera enthousiasmé par la perspective d'optimiser ou même de reconcevoir l'architecture dataOps de notre entreprise, afin de soutenir notre nouvelle génération de produits et de solutions stimulés par la MI.
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Créer et gérer des données optimales et modéliser l'architecture Pipeline en dataOps
Assembler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, qui satisfont aux conditions opérationnelles fonctionnelles / non fonctionnelles.
Découvrir, concevoir et améliorer les procédés internes : automatisation des procédés manuels, optimisation de la délivrance des données, re-conception de l'infrastructure au bénéfice d'une plus grande possibilité d'évolution, etc.
Établir l'infrastructure requise pour l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement optimaux de données, à partir de différentes sources de données en faisant appel à SQL et à des technologies « Big Data » reposant sur le cloud d'AWS, Azure et autres.
Travailler avec les parties prenantes, notamment l'équipe de la Direction, du service Produits, du service Données et Conception, pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et à satisfaire à leurs besoins en infrastructure de traitement des données.
Faire en sorte que les données soient séparées et sécurisées au-delà des frontières nationales, grâce à plusieurs centres de traitement des données et à des clients / partenaires stratégiques.
Créer des chaines de compilation (toolchain) pour l'équipe des scientifiques en traitement des données et d'analyse, qui les aident à créer et à optimiser notre produit, afin qu'il devienne le premier produit de l'industrie de par son degré d'innovation.
Coopérer avec les experts en apprentissage automatique et en traitement des données, afin d'améliorer le fonctionnement de nos systèmes de gestion du cycle de vie des modèles et de traitement de nos données.
Appuyer l'accumulation de compétences en DapaOps dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Ce que nous aimerions constater:
BS, MS ou doctorat en informatique, en informatique, en systèmes de traitement des informations ou dans un autre domaine connexe.
Au moins 3 ans d'expérience en utilisation des logiciels / outils suivants :
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Expérience en bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres et Cassandra.
Expérience en outils de traitement en pipeline de modèles et des données, en gestion du déroulement des travaux : Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont très poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont très solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.
*IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Machine Intelligence at Ericsson:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, MachineLearning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution
Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through datainsights.
Ericsson is hiring Experienced and Senior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.
Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing datasystems and evolving them. The Data Architect will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
What we would like to see:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
At least 3 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
You have advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
You have experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
You have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
You have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Data Architect: 3 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Language:
English (Preferred)
French (Preferred)

Title: Customer Service Representative, Cablevision

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
****English Version included below***
Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.
Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques expérimentes et seniors en traitement des données (Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.
Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.
Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Spécialiste Apprentissage Automatique-Scientifique en traitement des données (Data Scientist), vous devez très bien connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté
Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’apprentissage automatique ou en Science des données.
Expérience éprouvée dans la rédaction de logiciels de production
Grande expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Très bonnes compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Compétences éprouvées de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Bonnes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
* IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.
Ericsson is now looking for Experienced and Senior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.
Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data?
Role Summary:
As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.

Title: Développeur - Innovation | Developer - Innovation
QC - Customer Operations Business Intelligence Program
Description:
Req Id: 239305

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.
Big data is a big deal.

If you are passionate about transforming data into business value, this fast-growing, innovative field is where you want to be.

Bell’s Business Intelligence (BI) Graduate Leadership Program has something to offer for everyone interested in understanding how data and insights can influence how Bell runs its business.

We have highly specialized roles where analysts work directly with the latest tools and technologies transforming massive data sets into business value.
We also have customer experience roles that work side by side with our marketing partners to leverage the latest analytic and data science tools to design and create marketing and campaign programs.
Do you like to see the big picture? Join our BI strategy and planning roles that are defining our future roadmap and capabiliphaties.
Looking to broaden your skills and experience? Participate in an optional second rotation within BI or another area of the business.

Our mandate is to provide actionable insights and automate business decisions through analytics, driving strategic and operational improvements across the enterprise.

Some of the exciting projects we tackle include marketing optimization, customer and retail analytics, next-best-action, fraud detection, AI and Machine Learning and customer experience marketing. Our team is constantly iterating, learning and creating solutions that directly enhance Bell’s products and services.

This is a terrific opportunity for recent graduates or graduating students to help transform the organization in driving one of the most significant strategic mandates within Bell. As part of this team, you will have opportunities to work with new technologies, build project management skills and discover meaningful insights that will ultimately impact millions of customers.

Key Responsibilities:
Deliver key projects and data strategies by providing analytics, reporting and insights that result in better customer experience and marketing strategy
Leverage sophisticated analytical techniques including predictive modeling, text mining, forecasting, neural networks, segmentation and other data mining methods
Explore large, new sources of data; communicate and present insight opportunities to business teams across the organization to influence decision making
Translate business requirements into design, implementation and documentation of efficient BI processes
Implement and measure targeted marketing campaigns by leveraging predictive models and customer insights
Take part in defining and improving the overall architecture to create effective enterprise-level data solutions
Expand your knowledge of BI and new technologies through training opportunities

Required Competencies:
You are in the final year of study or are a recent graduate with a Bachelors or Masters degree in:
Mathematics / Statistics
Computer Science / Engineering
Management Science / Operations Research / Economics
Marketing / Commerce
Business Analytics / Business Intelligence
Or a related area
You are highly analytical, curious and can see beyond the numbers to determine the business impact driven by insights and metrics
You understand the basic principles of working with large and complex datasets
You can work with a team as well as with business partners, to inform, influence, support and execute on decisions and strategies
You have the ability to communicate quantitative results to a variety of audiences
You are able to manage multiple projects and priorities
Bilingualism (English and French) is an asset in Ontario and a requirement in Quebec

Preferred Competencies:
Data engineering focus:
Experience with prgramming languages such as Java, Scala, Python, C++
Expsure to development tools such as version control systems and IDEs
Prficiency working in Linux/Unix environment (eg. command line tools, shell scripting)
Knwledge of distributed computing frameworks and tools (eg. Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, MapReduce, Hive)
Development and production focus:
Experience with the design, develpment and maintenance of ETL processes, data marts, operational data stores and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Expsure to data warehouse technologies such as SQL Server, Teradata, SAS or others
Knwledge of data modeling and architecture (Normalized and multidimensional)
Data analytics / reporting focus:
Cnsulting with business stakeholders to create actionable insights & drive business value
Design practical user interfaces and layuts to convey data in a meaningful and actionable way for end users
Experience in transfrming data into insight using SQL, SAS, R, Hive or Python
Prficiency in efficiently extracting insights from data warehouse systems
Expsure to data visualization tools such as Tableau and MicroStrategy
Knwledge of statistical modelling and machine learning
Explre new sources of information to expand insight opportunities
Machine learning specialist:
Knwledge of ML Algorithms including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning modules, and text analytics
Experience with ML framewrks such as Spark ML, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, H2O, etc.
Highly driven t learn about the newest machine learning techniques and to apply them to solve business problems
Expsure to big data tools and technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark
Experience with relatinal data warehouse and fluent in SQL
Expsure to development tools such as version control systems and IDEs
Marketing analytics and campaign design:
Strng business acumen to connect the dots between business and data
Experience interpreting custmer data to identify new opportunities on how to best target and appeal to customers
Intrductory experience and desire to learn SQL based software
Experience in telecommunications is a plus

What our new grad leaders have to say:
“We work in a fast-paced environment, which allows us to learn about many unique parts of the business in short periods of time. I have the ability and freedom to continually leverage my ideas and research to help solve business problems.”

“To me, the best thing about working for Bell is the amazing people. I am surrounded by a very supportive team and, on a daily basis, I collaborate with highly talented individuals throughout the company to solve complex business problems.”

Start Date:
June 2020

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Grad Hire
Job Location: Canada : Quebec : Verdun
Application Deadline: 09/29/2019

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
