Title: Embedded Developer
Description:
**English follows**
Newtrax
Newtrax a rejoint Sandvik Mining et Rock Technology comme une seule entreprise unité. Newtrax croit que l'avenir de l'exploitation minière est souterrain, non seulement parce que les minéraux proches de la surface sont de plus en plus rares, mais aussi parce que les mines souterraines ont une empreinte environnementale beaucoup plus faible.
Pour accélérer la transition vers un avenir où 100% des activités d'extraction sont souterraines, Newtrax élimine la différence numérique actuelle entre les mines à ciel ouvert et les mines souterraines. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Newtrax intègre les dernières technologies de l'Internet des objets (IoT) et de l'intelligence artificielle afin de suivre et fournir des informations sur les opérations souterraines, notamment en ce qui concerne les personnes, les machines et l'environnement.
En tant qu'organisation apprenante dans un secteur mondial en rapide évolution, nos employés constituent notre atout le plus précieux. Nos valeurs fondamentales sont les suivantes:
Santé et sécurité
Citoyen gobal
Travail d'équipe et confiance
Excellence
Discipline financière rigoureuse
Pour en savoir plus sur nos produits, visitez la page suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/products/et pour voir les témoignages de nos employés, visionnez la vidéo suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
Vos avantages
Travaillez dans un environnement dynamique et rapide où vous aurez des opportunités de croissance.
Joignez une entreprise primée (Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec: prix génie innovation, sélectionné au palmarès Technology Fast 50 au Canada, Entrepreneur de l'année - Technologies de moins de 100 employés).
Travaillez dans un milieu collaboratif et positif, dans une entreprise à taille humaine.
Faites partie d'une entreprise en pleine croissance, présente dans le monde entier.
Profitez d’un espace de travail à aire ouverte au coeur du Vieux-Montréal.
Ayez un accès très pratique en métro, autobus, train ou vélo.
Travaillez avec des professionnels de l’industrie.
Bénéficiez d’une gamme d’assurances complètes et salaire compétitif.
Sommaire
Newtrax offre un environnement de collaboration composé de membres diversifiés et enthousiastes, respectés pour leurs talents uniques et habilités à assumer leurs responsabilités. En tant que membre clé de l’équipe de développement embarqué, vous serez chargé de développer des solutions permettant de capturer et de traiter les données en temps réel sur une plate-forme sans fil intégrée. L’objectif est de fournir des informations commerciales précieuses aux parties prenantes en appliquant une technologie d'estimation de distance pour pouvoir localiser les véhicules et le personnel afin d'atténuer les risques de collision.
Vos responsabilités
En tant que membre d’une équipe SCRUM, contribuer activement à l’architecture, à la conception, au codage et aux tests du micrologiciel intégré afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de l’entreprise.
Participer à la surveillance technologique et à la définition de normes de codage pour assurer l'efficacité, la résilience et la durabilité des systèmes.
Étudier les problèmes des clients et proposer des solutions et / ou des solutions de contournement
Assister l'équipe des opérations dans l'introduction de nouveaux produits et dans la recherche de problèmes complexes
Votre talent
Baccalauréat en génie logiciel ou en informatique, ou combinaison équivalente d’études et d’années d’expérience pertinente
2 ans ou plus d'expérience dans certains des domaines suivants: développement de microprogrammes intégrés, technologies sans fil, infrastructures de test d'unité, microcontrôleurs (MSP430, STM32), Linux intégré (ARM), bus de communication de véhicule (CAN)
Langages de programmation: C (obligatoire), C ++
Systèmes d'exploitation: Linux embarqué
Connaissance du langage de programmation: Go, Python
Système d'exploitation: FreeRTOS
Outil de distribution Linux: Yocto
Connaissance de la technologie Time of Flight: CSS, UWB
Compétences de débogage avancées (JTAG)
Connaissance pratique des méthodologies Agile et Scrum
Anglais et / ou français parlés et écrits
Forte compréhension technique des défis du développement de microprogrammes intégrés en temps réel sur une plate-forme aux ressources limitées (cycles Flash, RAM, CPU)
Haut degré de motivation personnelle et de capacité à travailler de manière autonome
Capacité d'adaptation dans un environnement de développement rapide
Solides compétences en communication et aptitude avérée à établir des relations avec des professionnels techniques et professionnels
Esprit d'équipe et compétences de partenariat pour une collaboration entre groupes
Possibilité de voyager occasionnellement sur les sites des clients
Pour appliquer, visitez: https://newtrax.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=79&source=Indeed
______________________
About Newtrax
Newtrax has joined Sandvik Mining and Rock Technology as a Standalone Business Unit. Newtrax believes the future of mining is underground, not only because minerals close to the surface are increasingly rare, but because underground mines have a significantly lower environmental footprint.
To accelerate the transition to a future where 100% of mining is underground, Newtrax eliminates the current digital divide between surface mines and underground mines. To achieve this goal, Newtrax integrates the latest Internet-of-Things and Artificial Intelligence technologies to monitor and provide insights on underground operations, including people, machines and the environment.
As a learning organization in a fast-paced global industry, our most precious asset is our employees and our guiding values are:
Health, Safety & Security
Global Citizenship
Teamwork & Trust
Excellence
Rigorous Financial Discipline
To learn more about our products visit the following page: https://www.newtrax.com/products/and To see testimonials from our employees, view the following video: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
What’s in it for you?
Work in a dynamic and fast paced environment where you will have growth opportunities.
Join an award-winning company (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec: Prix Génie innovation, Selected as Technology Fast 50 in Canada by Deloitte, Entrepreneur of the year - Technology under 100 employees).
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment, in a human-scale company.
Be part of a growing company that has a global presence around the world.
Spacious open office in the heart of Old Montreal.
Super-convenient access by metro, bus, train or bike.
Opportunity to work with industry leading professionals.
Complete insurance package and competitive salary.
Summary
Newtrax offers a collaborative environment of smart and enthusiastic team members respected for their unique talents and empowered to perform in their responsibilities. As a key member of the software development team, you will be responsible for developing solutions to capture and process data in real-time on an embedded wireless platform system with the end objective of providing valuable business insights to end customers. Apply distance estimation technology to be able to locate vehicle and personnel in order to provide situational awareness information to the operator in order to mitigate any potential collision.
Your responsibilities
As part of a SCRUM team, actively contribute to the architecture, design, coding and testing of the embedded firmware to effectively meet business needs
Participate in the technological monitoring and the definition of coding standards to ensure that systems are efficient, resilient and durable
Investigate customer issues and provide solutions and/or workarounds
Support the operations team in new product introduction and in investigation of complex problems
Your talent
Bachelor’s degree in software engineering or computer sciences, or equivalent combination of education and years of relevant experience
2+ years of experience in some of the following areas: Embedded firmware development, Wireless technologies, Unit testing frameworks, Microcontrollers (MSP430, STM32), Embedded Linux (ARM), Vehicle communication bus (CAN)
Programming languages: C (Mandatory), C++
Operating systems: Embedded Linux
Knowledge of Programming Language: Go, Python
Operating system: FreeRTOS
Linux Distribution tool: Yocto
Knowledge of Time of Flight technology: CSS, UWB
Advanced debugging skills (JTAG)
Working knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies
Proficient spoken and written English and/or French
Strong technical understanding of the challenges of real-time embedded firmware development on a platform with limited resources (Flash, RAM, CPU cycles)
High degree of self-motivation and ability to work independently
Ability to adapt in a fast-paced development environment
Strong communication skills with proven ability to relate with both technical and business professionals
Teamwork and partnering skills for cross-group collaboration
Ability to travel occasionally to customer sites
To apply, please visit: https://newtrax.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=79&source=Indeed
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
embedded: 5 years (Preferred)
Language:
English (Required)
French (Required)

Title: Backend Software Engineer / Développeur d'application Backen...
Description:
Backend Software Engineer (français à la fin)
Automat is looking for talented and experienced Backend Engineers who care deeply about building scalable and efficient software systems for inventing the future of Conversational AI. You love pushing the state of the art forward, follow the latest advancements in distributed systems, practice modern design patterns and build high-quality software delivered on time. You are resourceful, self-motivated and pride yourself on your creativity and ability to design elegant solutions to hard problems. You communicate well and love working as part of an amazing team.
Job Description
As a Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for building high performance, scalable and reliable systems that get used by millions of people. You will be working together with a diverse and talented team of engineers and researchers to build foundational components of our Automat's Conversational AI platform. These will include servers for training machine learning models, runtime systems that offer low latency interactions at scale, data analytics solutions to extract information from bot conversations, all deployed on a modern cloud infrastructure and secured to respect our users' data privacy.
Profile
Experience in distributed systems and micro-service architectures
Experienced in Functional Programming (Scala, Haskell)
Producing high-quality software, paying attention to details and delivering on time
Great team player
A plus
DevOps engineering (Docker, Kubernetes, Microservices, Continuous Integration,Ansible..)
Background in deep learning, statistics, probability, large scale data mining
About Automat
Automat is helping companies use AI to talk to their customers, to understand them and serve them better. We're the first Conversational Marketing platform powered by artificial intelligence and we believe in a world where every company can have a personalized one-on-one conversation with every customer, fan, and follower.

Développeur backend
Nous recherchons des ingénieurs-logiciels polyvalents, capables de concevoir, de construire et de mettre en œuvre un système logiciel destiné à la création d'une application-robot qui optimiserait les expériences de marketing conversationnel. Un système complexe basé sur des technologies avant-gardistes (Scala, Akka, Spray, Cats, programmation réactive, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.), une architecture moderne (Micro Services, CQRS, Event Sourcing, Eventual Consistency) et une base de code propre (code propre, conception pilotée par le domaine, etc.), l'accent étant mis sur le côté « ingénieur » plutôt que le côté « polyvalence ». Vous appliquerez la méthodologie kanban avec des équipes multidisciplinaires (analystes en informatique de gestion, équipes du marketing, développeur d'applications frontales, ingénieurs d'intelligence artificielle) afin de créer des logiciels au meilleur rapport qualité/prix.
Profil
Maîtrise des bases de l'informatique orientée objet, des structures de données et des algorithmes
Maîtrise de GIT
Expérience en programmation fonctionnelle (Scala, Haskell)
Connaissance de la programmation réactive fonctionnelle (Event Sourcing, diffusion en continu, CQRS, conception pilotée par le domaine, etc.)
Vous êtes intéressé par :
Programmation fonctionnelle réactive (Event Sourcing, diffusion en continu, CQRS, conception pilotée par le domaine, etc.)
Intégration continue (Travis, Jenkins, GoCD)
Outils de développement et d'exploitation, comme Docker
Atouts :
Ingénierie de développement et d'exploitation (Docker, Kubernetes, microservices, intégration continue, Ansible)
Ingénierie d'intelligence artificielle (mathématiques, statistiques, probabilités, apprentissage profond, apprentissage automatique, traitement automatique du langage naturel, exploration de données à grande échelle)
À propos d'Automat
Automat aide les entreprises à utiliser l'intelligence artificielle pour s'entretenir avec leurs clients, les comprendre et mieux les servir. Nous sommes la première plateforme de marketing conversationnel optimisée par intelligence artificielle et croyons en un monde où toutes les entreprises peuvent avoir des entretiens individuels avec chaque client, partisan et abonné.

Title: New College Graduate - Sensor Sales Engineer
Description:
Job Description
Job Description
Who: Cognex Corporation
Cognex is the global leader in the exciting and growing field of machine vision. With over $800 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup. Our people, proudly called “Cognoids,” take their work seriously, but not themselves. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.
Where:
We are looking to fill multiple positions based Toronto.
When:
We are seeking newly graduating seniors who will be available in June of 2020 when they finish their final year of school to start our comprehensive sales training program.
What:
Cognex Corporation invests in talent. One way we do this is through our Technical Sales Training Program, a full-time opportunity for recent college undergraduates. This program is designed to train and engage emerging engineering professionals that are interested in a career in technical sales. You will be solving real world problems for our customers in the manufacturing industry. We will train you to combine your technical and sales skills to provide cutting edge technology solutions to Cognex customers, in a consultative manner. Our accelerated and comprehensive on-boarding and training will enable you to Work Hard, Play Hard, and Move Fast!
The Technical Sales Training Program seeks to cultivate highly skilled, productive and committed Cognoids who will help drive Cognex’s future sales growth.
Cognex Essentials: Cognex Culture, Company History, Machine Vision, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Identification
Industrial Technology: Robotics, Internet of Things, Sensors, PLC’s, Pneumatics
Industry Knowledge: Automotive, Food & Beverage, Packaging, Consumer Electronics, Pharmaceuticals, Logistics
Sales Skills: Prospecting, Sales Calls, Closing a Sale, Negotiation
Business Skills: Time Management, Presentation Skills, C-Level Meetings, IT Tools, CRM
From classrooms, labs, and actual customer visits, you will spend your days immersing yourself in both Cognex Culture and learning to become a successful sales engineer. Once you have completed your on-boarding and training, the expectation is that you will be assigned to a territory that you will run with an entrepreneurial spirit, with the goal of growing the sales. Below are the requirements for the Sensor Sales Engineer position:
Essential Functions:
Responsible for achieving a defined sales quota at both current and prospective customer in the designated territory.
Travel onsite to customer manufacturing facilities and review applications / issues in order provide solutions to these applications
Follow up on sales leads and schedule customer onsite visits
Assists at trade shows and other marketing events
Coordinate more complex evaluations utilizing the Cognex Applications Engineering team
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Interested in a career in technical sales
Action-oriented mind set
PC literate with a working knowledge of MS Windows applications
Ability to work independently is required
Minimum education and work experience required:
Currently pursuing a STEM degree at a top school.
Engineering internship experience a plus
Additional Job Description

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (copy)
Description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play an integral role in the development of our flagship AI product offerings for enterprise. You will be part of a small, focused team working in fast paced environment.
Responsibilities
Architect, build, test, deploy distributed, scalable, and resilient Spark/Scala/Kafka Data processing, and Machine Learning model pipelines for batch, micro-batch, and streaming workloads. Experience in Scala development is required for this role.
Collaborate with data engineers to develop automated orchestration of data pipelines to find signals in client data
Collaborate with data scientists to develop automated orchestration of model pipelines to solve Cerebri AI business use case objectives
Proven experience in test automation for data and model pipelines
Deploy fully containerized Docker/Kubernetes Data processing, and Machine Learning model pipelines into Azure, AWS, GCP cloud environments and on-premise systems as necessary
Document Detailed Designs (including source to target mappings) and Code for Data Quality frameworks that can measure and maintain Data Completeness, Data Integrity and Data Validity between interfacing systems
Ensure all solutions comply with the highest levels of security, privacy, and data governance requirements as outlined by Cerebri and Client legal and information security guidelines, law enforcement, and privacy legislation, including data anonymization, encryption, and security in transit and at rest, etc.
Train and mentor junior team members
Acts as a Subject Matter Expert and a Thought Leader, continuously following industry trends, the latest competitive developments, and delivering papers and presentations at major industry conferences and events.
Qualifications
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, Machine Learning, BI, MIS, or an equivalent technology field
3+ years of production programming experience in Scala (emphasis in functional programming), Spark and Python
Proven experience in Spark (strong knowledge optimizing code for Spark jobs)
Able to program and understand data science and data engineering ideas in Python and translate into modular, functional components in Scala
Familiar with automated machine learning (AutoML) concepts would be an asset
Experience with Breeze would be an asset
Experience deploying containerized Docker/Kubernetes applications
Streaming and micro-batch application development experience would be an asset, including Kafka, Storm, NiFi, Spark Streaming, Confluent or equivalent
Production systems integration experience
Proficiency with Linux/Unix operating systems, utilities and tools
Big Data application architecture experience and in-depth understanding of the Big Data ecosystem, applications, services, and design patterns
Nice To Haves
Experience with the Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket).
Any other related experience with Big Data, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, machine learning and/or deep learning, predictive analytics

Problem Solver – You are proficient at using a combination of intuition and logic to come up with solutions
Detail Oriented – You are an expert at identifying nuances and aligning small details with larger objectives
Independent Worker – Your experience and capabilities allow you to require little instruction and guidance
Excellent team player – You are humble, ambitious and driven to make a difference

Title: Innovation Team
Description:
Position Status: Regular, Full time
Work location: Kitchener/Waterloo, Ontario
Job Overview:
Are you interested in helping to secure and enable reliable operations of a nation’s critical infrastructure? iS5 Communications develops products and solutions that do just that. Utilizing the iS5 designed secure networking and edge computing platform for Industry 4.0 and Industrial IoT applications, iS5 is developing innovative cybersecurity, industrial communications, big data, and AI/machine learning solutions for Smart Grids, Intelligent Transportation Systems, and other critical infrastructure industries. iS5 is opening a new innovation hub in Kitchener/Waterloo and is seeking individuals to help build the next generation solutions for iS5’s global customer base.
With an initial team of 6-8 people, the focus of the innovation hub will be to develop new products and features and drive them to a proof-of-concept or minimal viable product stage. If you are familiar with the McKinsey horizon model, we are focused on the horizon 3 side. Successful projects will be handed off to our core product team to finalize any further integrations into our core products. The core team will provide primary support and maintenance going forward and then we’ll move onto the next project. Projects will range in size and scope and we will involve external resources as required. If prototyping and experimenting with various technologies is something that excites you, this might be a good fit for you. We are starting from scratch so there is lots to do and you can help shape what it looks like!
Responsibilities and Duties:
Let’s get this straight from the start. There is no such thing as a perfect job description or a list of responsibilities that will state exactly what you will end up doing, especially for any role in this team. We will be building our team around the skill sets and strengths of the people we hire and will adapt accordingly. The below list is our starting point for the core skill sets we think we’ll need.
Cybersecurity Expertise

Embedded Development Expertise

QA / Test Automation Expertise

DevOps Expertise

Other nice-to-have’s include:
Knowledge of Networking Technologies and Protocols

Web/Frontend Development Experience

Backend Server Development Experience

Hardware Development Experience

Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / Big Data Experience

Agile Experience

Start-up Experience

Qualifications:
Similar to above, there are no hard requirements on your qualifications or experience. Everyone is unique so you just have to show us what you bring the table and help us understand why this will help us in the innovation team. The list below might be some of the typical qualifications or experience people have that we are interested in.
Diploma/Bachelors/Masters/PhD in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or other related discipline

Experience in a start-up like environment or other type of position that your role required you to wear multiple hats and just help out where needed

5+ years of experience in a software/hardware related role

Software development experience

Security consulting experience

At iS5 Communication Inc. our team is everything! You will have an opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-paced, and collaborative team. Some of the perks our team members have are:
Medical, Dental and Vision care benefits

Access to public transportation

Flexible work hours

Casual Friday dress code all week long

Employee Referral Programs

And more!

Interested In Joining our Team?
To apply for this position or view other career opportunities please submit your cover letter and resume to careers@is5com.com

Title: Software Engineer, Stadia
Description:
In school or graduated within last 9 months? We encourage you to apply to openings on the Student Jobs site
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in software development in one or more general purpose programming languages.
Experience developing gaming software and/or in the gaming industry
Experience with any of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed/parallel systems, machine learning, natural language processing.

Preferred qualifications:
Master’s degree, PhD, or experience in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, or Go.
Experience with or interest and ability to learn other coding languages.
Experience developing accessible technologies.
Experience with more than two of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed/parallel systems, machine learning, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, information retrieval, security software development.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.
Stadia is Google’s premier Video Game platform, designed for everyone. We are working on custom built hardware and rapidly evolving open source technology to deliver a seamless gaming experience across multiple devices. Stadia provides players new ways to discover, engage, and connect with content with no download required thanks to our cutting-edge data centers. Our team members are building the tools that will push game development to new levels, reducing the barrier to entry and bringing gaming to everyone. Through the power of Stadia, there is unlimited possibility.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: TM1/Planning Analytics (PA) Architect, Omnia AI
Description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Job Description
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.
As a member of our Data & Analytics Modernization team, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures – be it in the cloud or on-premise – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes.
Your role at Deloitte
As a TM1 / Planning Analytics (PA) Architect, you are passionate about data and technology solutions, are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. You will play an active role to implement innovative performance management solutions for our clients, to support enterprise-wide decision-making, improve finance operations, and create impact within their organization. You are enthusiastic about all things data, have strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are tech savvy and have a solid understanding of software development.
In this role, you will:
Be responsible for hands-on SME advising and implementing solutions, technical quality assurance testing of developer work products and training.
Lead a team of TM1/PA Developers.
Consult with clients to understand business challenges.
Identify functional requirements.
Drive the solution design and prototyping.
Qualifications
3+ years relevant experience implementing IBM Cognos TM1/PA.
Advanced development (rules/TI process authoring, complex calculation modeling) and troubleshooting skills in IBM TM1/PA.
Proven skills as a team lead or project manager on at least three full life cycle implementations.
Ability to guide and mentor a team of experienced developers.
Willingness for travel.
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
Strong level Microsoft Excel and data manipulation skills
We also value:
IBM Certifications in Planning Analytics.
Strong functional knowledge around financial systems and processes.
If you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. The TM1/PA Architect role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.
The time is right for you to join Deloitte. Get your career off to great start. What impact will you make?
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.
At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.
Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.
Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted
45502

Title: Data Scientist/Artificial Intelligence Expert
Description:
RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF THE MUHC

The Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre (RI-MUHC) is a world-renowned biomedical and hospital research centre. Located in Montreal, Quebec, the Institute is the research arm of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC) affiliated with the Faculty of Medicine at McGill University. The RI-MUHC is supported in part by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Santé (FRQS).

Position summary

The AIPHL lab of McGill University Health Center and Department of radiology is looking for a data scientist as part of a multi-disciplinary clinical team for developing medical AI applications
The successful candidate will be joining a dynamic team within an academic health center and leading research and development in medical applications of AI in collaboration with other academic groups as well as industry partners.
The approach will be open and multi-disciplinary, including working with different medical specialties within the hospital as well as collaborators from other institutions including health centers, non-medical academic groups with AI expertise, and industry.

General Duties

The candidate would be expected to take a leadership role under the supervision of the principle investigators in overseeing and developing optimal strategies and developing of algorithms for various AI applications that include but is not limited to analysis of medical images such as CT and MRI scans.
The candidate would be working with other team members within and outside the lab and would be expected to oversee successful completion of different projects conducted by the team from a data science perspective.
Provide supervision to trainees and necessary training to other lab members and/or trainees.
The successful candidate would be expected to take a leadership position and lead projects to completion.
Participate in grant writing, and manuscript preparation.
https://rimuhc.ca/en
Education / Experience
Should have a PhD degree
A successful candidate should have a strong background in machine learning applications including deep learning applications for medical image analysis.
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing would be a bonus.
Familiarity with medical physics and/or imaging would be an asset but not a requirement.
Knowledge/experience in radiomics would be an asset but not a requirement
Outgoing, excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to take initiatives, set priorities, time-manage, and resolve problems
Additional information
Status : Full time
Pay Scale: Salary competitive based of candidate’s qualifications and experience
Work Shift: 8am – 4pm, as per standard
Work Site: MUHC RI and department of radiology

To learn more about our benefits, please visit http://rimuhc.ca/en/compensation-and-benefits

THIS IS NOT A HOSPITAL POSITION.

NOTE: The masculine gender has been used for brevity and includes the feminine gender.
Equal Opportunity Employment Program
Le CUSM applique un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite les femmes, les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d’adaptation peuvent être offertes aux personnes handicapées qui en font la demande en fonction de leurs besoins.

Title: Technical Lead - Embedded System / Chef technique - Système...
Description:
**English follows**
Newtrax
Newtrax croit que l'avenir de l'exploitation minière est souterrain, non seulement parce que les minéraux proches de la surface sont de plus en plus rares, mais aussi parce que les mines souterraines ont une empreinte environnementale beaucoup plus faible.
Pour accélérer la transition vers un avenir où 100% des activités d'extraction sont souterraines, Newtrax élimine la différence numérique actuelle entre les mines à ciel ouvert et les mines souterraines. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Newtrax intègre les dernières technologies de l'Internet des objets (IoT) et de l'intelligence artificielle afin de suivre et fournir des informations sur les opérations souterraines, notamment en ce qui concerne les personnes, les machines et l'environnement.
En tant qu'organisation apprenante dans un secteur mondial en rapide évolution, nos employés constituent notre atout le plus précieux. Nos valeurs fondamentales sont les suivantes:
Santé et sécurité
Citoyen gobal
Travail d'équipe et confiance
Excellence
Discipline financière rigoureuse
Pour en savoir plus sur nos produits, visitez la page suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ et pour voir les témoignages de nos employés, visionnez la vidéo suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
Vos avantages
Travaillez dans un environnement dynamique et rapide où vous aurez des opportunités de croissance.
Joignez une entreprise primée (Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec: prix génie innovation, sélectionné au palmarès Technology Fast 50 au Canada, Entrepreneur de l'année - Technologies de moins de 100 employés).
Travaillez dans un milieu collaboratif et positif, dans une entreprise à taille humaine.
Faites partie d'une entreprise en pleine croissance, présente dans le monde entier.
Profitez d’un espace de travail à aire ouverte au coeur du Vieux-Montréal.
Ayez un accès très pratique en métro, autobus, train ou vélo.
Travaillez avec des professionnels de l’industrie.
Sommaire
Le chef technique système embarqué est un expert en logiciels qui fait des choix de conception de haut niveau et qui guide toutes les normes techniques, y compris les normes de codage des logiciels, les outils et les plates-formes.
Dans ce rôle critique, vous dirigerez l’aspect technique de tous les développements, en fournissant une architecture uniforme et cohérente sur toute la plate-forme afin d’unifier et de normaliser tous les développements. Le chef technique doit également interagir avec les clients, les chefs de produit et les développeurs afin d'envisager, modéliser et fournir des modèles et des conceptions initiaux pouvant être construits.
Vos responsabilités
Responsable de la conception architecturale offrant des performances techniques supérieures, des périphériques Edge aux serveurs.
Définir la feuille de route de la plate-forme qui est conforme à la vision du produit déterminée par la stratégie produit
Développer des prototypes pour démontrer et réduire les risques en matière de choix technologiques
Diriger les efforts pour créer des applications modernes et organiser tous les aspects logiciels, y compris les normes de développement.
Assurez-vous que la solution est sécurisée, testable, adaptable et évolutive
Documenter et unifier la structure de données sur la plate-forme
S'assurer que tous les nouveaux développements prennent en charge CI / CD
Évaluer les risques du projet et proposer des stratégies d'atténuation
Surveiller les performances techniques de l'équipe et rendre compte des métriques.
Écouter les commentaires des membres de l'équipe, résoudre les problèmes techniques et répondez aux questions techniques
Identifier les besoins en formation technique et assurer un coaching
Votre talent
Baccalauréat en génie logiciel ou diplôme équivalent avec au moins 5 années d’expérience
Expérience de travail dans un environnement agile en appliquant les valeurs et principes Agile
Excellentes compétences en communication et capacité à expliquer la vision de l'architecture
Un leader des périphériques IoT et Edge avec une vision de la conception de la solution de bout en bout
Forte expérience dans le développement de logiciels de conception pour CI / CD
Expérience avec la communauté de logiciels Open Source
Demeurer à jour avec la technologie IoT
Auto-dirigé, très motivé, bien organisé et soucis du détail
Connaissance des principes Store & Forward
Connaissance de l'automatisation
Capacité de communiquer en français et en anglais
Atout: expérience de Linux (Embedded et Server)
Atout: expérience en télémétrie de véhicule
Atout: expérience dans la science des données et l'industrie minière
Atout: connaissance de l’intelligence artificielle et de l’apprentissage automatique
Possibilité de voyager occasionnellement 10%

_______________________
About Newtrax
Newtrax believes the future of mining is underground, not only because minerals close to the surface are increasingly rare, but because underground mines have a significantly lower environmental footprint.
To accelerate the transition to a future where 100% of mining is underground, Newtrax eliminates the current digital divide between surface mines and underground mines. To achieve this goal, Newtrax integrates the latest Internet-of-Things and Artificial Intelligence technologies to monitor and provide insights on underground operations, including people, machines and the environment.
As a learning organization in a fast-paced global industry, our most precious asset is our employees and our guiding values are:
Health, Safety & Security
Global Citizenship
Teamwork & Trust
Excellence
Rigorous Financial Discipline
To learn more about our products visit the following page: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ and To see testimonials from our employees, view the following video: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
What’s in it for you?
Work in a dynamic and fast paced environment where you will have growth opportunities.
Join an award-winning company (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec: Prix Génie innovation, Selected as Technology Fast 50 in Canada by Deloitte, Entrepreneur of the year - Technology under 100 employees).
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment, in a human-scale company.
Be part of a growing company that has a global presence around the world.
Spacious open office in the heart of Old Montreal.
Super-convenient access by metro, bus, train or bike.
Opportunity to work with industry leading professionals.
Complete insurance package and competitive salary.
Summary
A technical lead in embedded system is a software expert who makes high-level design choices and guide all technical standards, including software coding standards, tools, and platforms.
In this critical role, you will lead the technical aspect for all development, provides a uniform and consistent architecture across the platform in order to unify and standardize all development. The technical lead also needs to interact with clients, product managers, and developers in order to envision, model and provide initial models and designs that can be built.
Your responsibilities
Responsible for architectural design that delivers superior technical performance from Edge devices to Server
Is key in defining the platform Roadmap that is in line with the product vision determined by product strategy
Develops prototypes to demonstrate and de-risk technology choices
Lead the effort to build modern applications and organize all the software aspect including the development standards
Ensure that the solution is secure, testable, adaptable and scalable
Document and unify the data structure across the platform
Ensure that all new development support CI/CD
Assess project risks and propose mitigation strategies
Monitor team technical performance and report on metrics
Listen to team members feedback, resolve any technical issues, and answer technical questions
Identify technical training needs and provide coaching
Your talent
Bachelor’s degree in Software engineering, Electrical engineering or equivalent diploma with a minimum of 5 years experiences
Experience working in an Agile environment applying the Agile values and principles
Excellent communication skills and capacity to explain the architecture vision
Detailed oriented
A leader in IoT devices and Edge with a view of the end to end solution design
Strong experience in developing software design toward CI/CD
Experience with Open Source software community
Keeps up to date with IoT technology
Self-driven, highly motivated and well organized
Knowledge of Store & Forward principles
Knowledge of Automation
Ability to communicate in both French and English
Ability to travel occasionally
Asset: experience in Linux (Embedded & Server)
Asset: experience in vehicle Telemetry
Asset: experience in Data science and the mining industry
Asset: Knowledge of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

Title: Software Development Engineer
Description:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline or industry experience.
5+ years of professional software development experience
Strong background in computer science basics (data structures, algorithms, etc).
Experience leveraging object oriented design practices in Java, C++ and or .Net.

Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come join a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.

We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for passionate and talented Software Development Engineers to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”

As a developer on our team, you’ll own code end-to-end from design to development, and work closely with senior technical leaders within the team and across AWS. You’ll have a sound understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical industry experience, working across the stack with technology involving modern web, SOA, NoSQL databases, AI, ML, Big Data and more.

What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that loves working together towards a common goal.
Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.
Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.
Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.
Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.
Learn & Grow: If want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a life time.
Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.
Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.
Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented pool of engineers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.
Learn more about Amazon Connect here.

Title: Jr. Software Developer / System Analyst
Description:
Job Summary
We are currently recruiting for a Jr. Software Developer who is ready to work in a fast pace, dynamic office environment. It is a high energy position which requires a winning can do attitude. Must have computer skills, good organization habits, be a problem solver, must work well with others, have good communication skills, be a quick learner, and multitask with attention to detail. This will be a permanent, full-time position for an entry level developer.
The candidate will be responsible for software development and will be working for a software company that produces software designed for real-time video processing and information management. Since this is a junior position, candidates are expected to be generally familiar with the skills necessary but motivated to learn more as required tasks progress. This position will report directly to the Manager of Software Development.
Duties and Responsibilities
Software design, development, and testing.
Develop secondary software utilities, test applications, unit tests and prototype applications.
Maintain, troubleshoot, diagnose and repair existing system software.
Produce documentation, manuals, user guides and other technical documentation.
Additional tasks as required, under the guidance of a mentor.
Skills / Attributes Required
Must be knowledgeable and familiar with one or more of the following technologies: C++08/11/13 STL (Linux and Win32), MFC, Boost, OpenGL before/after 3.3, Java, Javascript, JSP, Node.JS, Python, PostgreSQL, CSS and (X) HTML.
Familiarity with real-time network I/O, database access, thread management, graphics rendering, and/or video processing APIs / technologies • Familiarity with Internet related applications and protocols (eg. e-Mail clients, FTP clients, Web Browsers, XML, HTML, h264, mp4, SOAP, etc.).
Familiarity with software development methodologies.
Familiarity with source control, development environments, and debugging.
General understanding of IT infrastrcture (DB, networking, servers, some cloud, monitoring, etc.)
Self motivated, detailed-oriented and organized.
Candidate must be a team player and willing to teach and learn.
Be able to ensure quality and error checking is a priority.
Why Apply?
Searidge Technologies is a global leader in the Air Traffic Control space, boldly forging new paths bringing innovative technology, such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and augmented reality into operation. We are developing and integrating modern technologies to improve both the safety and efficiency of airport operations around the world. Our solutions have been adopted by some of the most advanced airports and ANSPs throughout North America, Middle East, Europe and Asia. We live and breathe innovation, and we expect the same of all prospective team members. Our developers are constantly engaged in fast-paced, challenging and highly rewarding work. We are looking for the best and brightest to join our highly-motivated team. We are an equal opportunity employer offering exciting work, a respectful and positive work environment, and a competitive benefits package. Are you looking to be challenged to produce high-performance system components that are robust and intuitive? Are you ready to push the envelope of how software-based tools and solutions are used in a safety-critical environment? Are you prepared to put your skills to the test? …. we want to hear from you.

Title: Machine Learning Developer
Description:
Organization Description
Headquartered in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, TerraSense Analytics uses and develops remote sensing technologies with a focus on deep learning for sensor intelligence. We are an innovative company, partnered with several research institutions to advance the development of UAV remote sensing technology, providing services to both the government and the private sector in the fields of utilities, natural resources, and security.
We appreciate and support our employees' diverse backgrounds and talents, and see their creativity as our greatest resource. We are developers, data scientists, resource professionals, and biologists living in the Okanagan who understand the industry inside and out. We have expertise with safety procedures, standard operating procedures, copying from Stack Overflow, and legislation and regulations in a variety of jurisdictions.
We strive for true innovation in the field of intelligent remote sensing. Our machine learning team develops custom deep learning solutions in-house to extract information from our sensor data. Our team has delivered Artificial Intelligence powered products to several industry clients and has developed industry-leading expertise in UAV remote sensing analysis using AI. From individual tree counts and species identification, ultrasonic utility monitoring systems, to aerial intelligence and surveillance, our AI Team continues to push the envelope on what is possible with deep learning and sensor data.
Job Requirements & Qualifications
Applicants should have the following experience:
Applicants should be able to program in Python and C++
They will have experience developing and maintaining deployable code
Ideal candidates will have experience developing/training deep learning algorithms
They will be a self-starter and enjoy working on a diversity of tasks in a start-up environment
Job Description
If successful, you will be working with the TerraSense Analytics machine learning team adjacent to UBC Okanagan to develop new AI platforms for the utilities, natural resource, and defense sectors. Integrating deep learning into deployable software will be your primary objective.
You will work to develop research-grade code as well as deploy industry-grade software solutions utilizing deep learning algorithms. Working closely with our data scientists who will provide you with high-quality datasets and even models, you will solve the challenges of creating deployable machine learning solutions at the edge.
Working in a start-up environment means working closely with a multidisciplinary team, including imaging specialists, data scientists, and other developers. Identifying creative solutions to challenging problems will be a constant part of this role, whether it be in data fusion, ensembles of neural networks, human-computer interaction and explainable AI, or IOT solutions.
*
*
Bonus Job Qualifications
The following skills count for bonus points:
Working with image / audio data processing, signal processing
A well-curated GitHub portfolio / open source contribution
Experience working with ‘cloud’ compute infrastructure (AWS, GCP)
Experience building GUI / interface using ( QT, C#)
Experience working with industrial IOT solutions ( LoRa, SigFox)
Due to the volume of applications we receive, only those selected for the interview process will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Experience:
Machine Learning: 3 years (Required)
Language:
English (Required)

Title: Developer Technology Engineer - AI
Description:
NVIDIA is looking for a passionate, world-class computer scientist to work in its Compute Developer Technology (Devtech) team as an AI Developer Technology Engineer.
What you will be doing:
Study and develop cutting-edge techniques in deep learning, graphs, machine learning, and data analytics, and perform in-depth analysis and optimization to ensure the best possible performance on current- and next-generation GPU architectures.
Work directly with key customers to understand the current and future problems they are solving and provide the best AI solutions using GPUs.
Collaborate closely with the architecture, research, libraries, tools, and system software teams at NVIDIA to influence the design of next-generation architectures, software platforms, and programming models.
What we need to see:
Possess a PhD from a leading university in an engineering or computer science related discipline, or MS and 1+ years of relevant work experience.
Your works shows a strong knowledge of C/C++, software design, programming techniques, and AI algorithms.
3+ years experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++.
Strong communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem solving, good time management, and task prioritization skills.
Some travel is required for conferences and for on-site visits with developers.
Artificial intelligence, the dream of computer scientists for over half a century, is no longer science fiction. And in the next few years, it will transform every industry. Soon, self-driving cars will reduce congestion and improve road safety. AI travel agents will know your preferences and arrange every detail of your family vacation. And medical instruments will read and understand patient DNA to detect and treat early signs of cancer.
Where engines made us stronger and powered the first industrial revolution, AI will make us smarter and power the next. What will make this intelligent industrial revolution possible? A new computing model — GPU deep learning — that enables computers to learn from data and write software that is too complex for people to code.
#deeplearning

Title: Sr. Technical Leader, Software Development
Description:
What You’ll Do

Cisco’s Customer Experience Design Group is looking for an exceptionally technical, creative, and talented Senior Technical Leader to work with our team of UX designers and UI engineers. The Technical Leader is responsible for overseeing all technical aspects of the team’s projects, working with UX leadership to identify and implement innovative technologies. You'll help us evaluate new and emerging technologies and determine applicability to current and future projects. You will architect and design new software product features, help drive projects to completion, define system technical use cases and architecture specification in alignment with business/product requirements. You will collaborate very closely with the business strategy, product management as well as engineering and the execution teams.

Who You’ll Work With

You will be part of an innovative experience design team responsible for overhauling the way customers and partners interact with Cisco. Our team develops forward-looking applications, solutions and services across cloud, desktop, and mobile platforms. This is a unique opportunity to drive an innovative technical roadmap for next generation applications and cloud services in big data analytics, machine learning, and advanced visualization.

Who You Are

You've got a strong background in system architecture and design, documentation, implementation and deployment, on projects. You have in-depth knowledge of modern development practices and frameworks, with a proven track record of leading, building, and delivering successful software projects across a range of modern technologies. You have experience delivering prototypes and MVPs on an accelerated timeline, as well as a hands-on ability to lead software projects and mentor junior engineers. You love solving problems, enjoy collaborating and communicating with internal and external team members, and are adept at overseeing the technical setup for projects, tools, and infrastructure. You are a strategic thinker (system level) that can look at the big picture, abstract workflows and provide technical assistance in technology to be used at the strategic level.

Our Minimum Requirements are:

Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent
10+ years of experience in building large scale, high performance, high availability full-stack systems
Experience with frontend technologies such as JavaScript, Angular, AngularJS, React
Fluency and facility with one or more of the following programming languages: Java, Scala, Python, GoLang, C#, Objective-C
Hands-on experience with Microservices, Container and Streaming technologies
Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop and other frameworks in Hadoop ecosystem, Elasticsearch, etc.)
Extensive experience with continuous integration processes and tools such as Jenkins, Chef, Puppet
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies – AWS, GCP, Azure
Excellent written and oral communication skills, able to communicate with all levels of internal technology teams and business teams

Ideally, you would also be familiar with:

Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Mobile, iOS and Android
Wiring front-end prototypes to back-end APIs
Working closely with a user experience team

Why Cisco

At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.

Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.

We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.
We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.
We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.

Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco
#LI-GD1

Intelligent Haptronic Solutions Inc. (IHS) is a medical robotics start-up company that focuses on research and development of industry leading surgical training simulation system. IHS has a team of industry leading researchers and experienced engineers that strive for advancing Haptic, VR and AI technology for surgical training applications. IHS is in partnership with Shenzhen Zhichu Computer System Co., Ltd which is responsible for product manufacturing, marketing and sales. embedded software design: 3 years (Preferred)

Title: QA Embedded Software Developer in Test
Description:
**English follows**
Newtrax
Newtrax a rejoint Sandvik Mining et Rock Technology comme une unité d'affaire indépendante. Newtrax croit que l'avenir de l'exploitation minière est souterrain, non seulement parce que les minéraux proches de la surface sont de plus en plus rares, mais aussi parce que les mines souterraines ont une empreinte environnementale beaucoup plus faible.
Pour accélérer la transition vers un avenir où 100% des activités d'extraction sont souterraines, Newtrax élimine la différence numérique actuelle entre les mines à ciel ouvert et les mines souterraines. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Newtrax intègre les dernières technologies de l'Internet des objets (IoT) et de l'intelligence artificielle afin de suivre et fournir des informations sur les opérations souterraines, notamment en ce qui concerne les personnes, les machines et l'environnement.
En tant qu'organisation apprenante dans un secteur mondial en rapide évolution, nos employés constituent notre atout le plus précieux. Nos valeurs fondamentales sont les suivantes:
Santé et sécurité
Citoyen gobal
Travail d'équipe et confiance
Excellence
Discipline financière rigoureuse
Pour en savoir plus sur nos produits, visitez la page suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ et pour voir les témoignages de nos employés, visionnez la vidéo suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
Vos avantages
Travaillez dans un environnement dynamique et rapide où vous aurez des opportunités de croissance.
Joignez une entreprise primée (Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec: prix génie innovation, sélectionné au palmarès Technology Fast 50 au Canada, Entrepreneur de l'année - Technologies de moins de 100 employés).
Travaillez dans un milieu collaboratif et positif, dans une entreprise à taille humaine.
Faites partie d'une entreprise en pleine croissance, présente dans le monde entier.
Profitez d’un espace de travail à aire ouverte au coeur du Vieux-Montréal.
Ayez un accès très pratique en métro, autobus, train ou vélo.
Travaillez avec des professionnels de l’industrie.
Bénéficiez d’une gamme d’assurances complètes et salaire compétitif.
Sommaire
En tant que membre de l’équipe de systèmes embarqués, vous travaillerez avec plusieurs développeurs de logiciels embarqués pour vous aider à tester les dernières technologies de pointe et s'assurer que tous les produits sont livrés à la plus haute qualité.
Le candidat idéal sera en mesure d'exécuter ses engagements dans un environnement au rythme rapide, de présenter des informations techniques en termes simples à différents niveaux de compréhension et de collaborer avec des équipes de service et de produit dotées de solides compétences en communication centrées sur la résolution de problèmes.
Vos responsabilités
Collaborer pour que les fonctionnalités soient bien définies avant le développement
Fournir des commentaires fréquents et réguliers à l'équipe
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre la plate-forme de test du logiciel intégré
Planifier, développer, coordonner et effectuer des tests pour plusieurs produits
Créer des scénarios de test et créer des suites de tests en mettant l’accent sur l’automatisation
Participer aux discussions sur la conception du produit et présenter les résultats des tests aux équipes d'ingénierie et à la direction
Participer au test du système
Recherchez et aidez à reproduire les problèmes des clients
Valider que tous les documents de conception sont exacts et mis à jour
S'assurer que toute la documentation est exacte et pertinente (notes de publication, manuels d'installation, d'utilisation et de maintenance, etc.)
Votre talent
BS ou diplôme équivalent en EE / Informatique ou dans un domaine connexe
Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience dans les tests / automatisation de tests de logiciels intégrés et des applications associées
Forte expérience de Linux embarqué
Compétences de haut niveau en programmation / débogage en Python, C / C ++, Qt, etc.
Expérience confirmée des réseaux de communication de données et des protocoles et technologies associés tels que TCP, UDP, multidiffusion, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP / HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, commutation de couche 2 et 3, pare-feu, NAT et principes de sécurité de base du réseau
Connaissance des réseaux LTE, WiFi, BLE et CAN est préférable
Capacité à travailler efficacement avec des équipes interfonctionnelles
Excellente communication verbale et écrite et compétences interpersonnelles éprouvées
Être orienté vers les résultats, motivé et doté d'un esprit d'équipe
Possibilité de voyager occasionnellement sur les sites des clients 10%
**Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte et ce, sans aucune discrimination.
_______________________
About Newtrax
Newtrax has joined Sandvik Mining and Rock Technology as a Standalone Business Unit. Newtrax believes the future of mining is underground, not only because minerals close to the surface are increasingly rare, but because underground mines have a significantly lower environmental footprint.
To accelerate the transition to a future where 100% of mining is underground, Newtrax eliminates the current digital divide between surface mines and underground mines. To achieve this goal, Newtrax integrates the latest Internet-of-Things and Artificial Intelligence technologies to monitor and provide insights on underground operations, including people, machines and the environment.
As a learning organization in a fast-paced global industry, our most precious asset is our employees and our guiding values are:
Health, Safety & Security
Global Citizenship
Teamwork & Trust
Excellence
Rigorous Financial Discipline
To learn more about our products visit the following page: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ and To see testimonials from our employees, view the following video: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
What’s in it for you?
Work in a dynamic and fast paced environment where you will have growth opportunities.
Join an award-winning company (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec: Prix Génie innovation, Selected as Technology Fast 50 in Canada by Deloitte, Entrepreneur of the year - Technology under 100 employees).
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment, in a human-scale company.
Be part of a growing company that has a global presence around the world.
Spacious open office in the heart of Old Montreal.
Super-convenient access by metro, bus, train or bike.
Opportunity to work with industry leading professionals.
Complete insurance package and competitive salary.
Summary
As a member of the embedded system group, you will work with multiple embedded software development teams to help testing the latest cutting-edge technology and ensure that all products are delivered to the highest quality.

The ideal candidate will be able to execute on commitments in fast paced environment, present technical information in simple terms to a variety of understanding levels, and collaborate with service and product teams with strong communication skills focused on problem solving.
Your responsibilities
Collaborate in ensuring that features are well defined ahead of development
Provide frequent and regular feedback to the team
Design and implement the embedded software testing platform
Plan, develop, coordinate, and perform testing for multiple products
Create test cases and build test suites with a focus on automation
Participate in discussions on product design and present test results to engineering teams and management.
Participate in system test
Investigate and help reproduce customer issues
Validate that all design documents are accurate and updated
Ensure all documentation is accurate and relevant (Release notes, installation, operation and maintenance manuals, …)
Your talent
BS or equivalent degree in EE/Computer Science or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in testing/test automation of embedded software and associated applications
Strong experience in Embedded Linux
High level skills in programming/debugging Python, C / C++, Qt, etc.
Demonstrated experience in data communication networks and associated protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, Multicasting, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP/HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, Layer 2 and 3 switching, firewalls, NATs and basic network security principles
Knowledge in LTE, WiFi, BLE, CAN bus is preferred
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Excellent verbal and written communication and proven interpersonal skills
Be result oriented, self-motivated and a team player
Ability to travel occasionally to customer sites 10%
