Title: Développeur QA de logiciels - Software Developer in Test
Description:
Company Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Today, we have some exciting news to share, as we officially announce the name of Nuance’s upcoming Automotive spin-off: Cerence! Upon spinning off from Nuance on October 1, our Automotive team will begin a new journey as Cerence, a pure-play, next-generation automotive software company fully focused on providing intelligent mobility solutions to our customers. “Cer” that rhymes with “air,” “ence” that rhymes with “sense,” Cerence is a new word for a new company. Visit cerence.com to follow along with our journey!

C’est avec fierté que nous vous annonçons aujourd’hui le nom de la nouvelle société issue de la scission de la division Automobile de Nuance qui sera : Cerence ! À la suite de la scission, notre division automobile entamera une nouvelle aventure sous le nom de Cerence, une société de logiciels automobiles de nouvelle génération, entièrement dédiée à fournir des solutions de mobilité intelligentes à nos clients. "Cer" qui rime avec "air", "ence" qui rime avec "sens", Cerence est un nouveau mot pour une nouvelle entreprise. Visitez cerence.com pour suivre notre voyage!
Job Summary / Sommaire du poste:
*English will follow*
Résumé :

L’équipe du serveur de traitement des langues naturelles (STLN) est responsable de la conception, du développement et de l’intégration de divers modules logiciels dans un environnement d’applications langagières comprenant des applications d’assistant personnel pour les plus grands fabricants de téléphones, de voitures et d’autres appareils intelligents.

Nous proposons à un développeur QA de logiciels l’occasion formidable de se joindre à une équipe de renommée internationale et de bâtir des fonctionnalités de serveurs qui sont au cœur des applications d’agents virtuels de Nuance alimentées par toute une gamme de technologies de pointe, comme la reconnaissance vocale, la compréhension des langues naturelles, l’intelligence artificielle, les données massives, l’infonuagique et plus encore.

Responsabilités :
Bâtir des essais de haut niveau pour les services infonuagiques liés au STLN
Collaborer avec les équipes de la recherche et développement, des gestionnaires de produits et des activités pour assurer la satisfaction de la clientèle sur toute la ligne
Participer aux sessions de conception technique des solutions
Contribuer à la résolution de problèmes d’assurance qualité de l’ingénierie en évaluant les différentes technologies et les divers outils
Travailler dans un environnement AGILE en intégration continue et la livraison continue
Concevoir et développer des projets d’assurance qualité de bout en bout, de développement des automatisations et de test d’exécution.
Effectuer les tâches liées à la sécurité et à la conservation des produits, outils et processus sous sa responsabilité.

Années d’expérience de travail :
De 2 à 4 ans

Compétences requises
Très bonne connaissance des normes d’assurance qualité comme la gestion des défauts, les tests de fumée, les tests de régression, les tests de caractéristiques, les tests de chargement et de rendement, etc.
Expérience avérée du scriptage, dont les scripts bash, shell ou python
Expérience avec l’environnement de développement Java
Expérience de programmation de systèmes d’exploitation répartis (avec les protocoles HTTP et REST, WebSockets, SOAP et gRPC)
Expérience des essais d’applications infonuagiques natives à l’aide de Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
Capacité d’analyser et de résoudre des problèmes complexes de façon rapide et créative
Bonnes aptitudes de communication écrite et orale; le langage d’entreprise est l’anglais
Excellent esprit d’équipe; savoir travailler avec des collègues à distance et de façon indépendante

Compétences privilégiées

Bonne connaissance de JavaScript et des autres éléments côté clients des applications Web
Connaissance de base en informatique Configuration et mise à niveau des machines et des systèmes d’essai

Études :
Baccalauréat ou diplôme d’études supérieures en génie électrique, en génie informatique, en informatique ou l’équivalent

Summary:

The Natural Language Processing Server (NLPS) team is responsible for designing, developing and integrating multiple software modules for the speech application environment, including multi-modal, personal agent applications for some of the world’s largest phone, automobile and other smart devices manufacturers.

We have an exciting opportunity for a software developer in test to join a world-class team building server-side functionality that is at core of all Nuance's virtual agent applications powered by a diverse array of state-of-the-art technologies such as voice recognition, natural language understanding, artificial intelligence, big data, cloud computing, and more.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with peers from R&D, product managers, and operations to ensure end to end customer satisfaction

Evaluate different technologies and tools to help solve QA engineering problems
Work in an agile environment with CICD
Design and develop end to end QA projects, write test plans, develop automation and execute tests.
Perform tasks related to securing and keeping the products, tools, and processes that you are responsible for securing

2-4 years

Required Skills:
Strong understanding of standard QA practices such as defect management, smoke tests, regressions tests, feature tests, load and performance tests, etc.
Good scripting experience e.g. bash, shell, python
Experience with Java development
Experience with distributed systems programming (protocols: HTTP/REST, WebSockets, SOAP, gRPC)
Experience with testing cloud native applications using Docker, Kubernetes etc.
Have the ability to analyze and solve complex problems quickly and creatively.
Good written and verbal communication skills; the language of business is English.
Strong team player, working also with remote peers, independent

Preferred Skills:

Good knowledge of JavaScript and other aspects of client-side web applications
Basic IT-knowledge: Setup and maintenance of test machines/systems

Education:
Bachelors or Graduate University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent

Location is in the heart of downtown

Situé au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal

Title: Senior Java Developer in Toronto
Description:
About RepRisk
RepRisk is a global leader and pioneer in data science, specializing in premium ESG and business conduct risk research and quantitative solutions. Since 2006, RepRisk has been leveraging artificial intelligence and curated human analysis to translate big data into actionable business intelligence and risk metrics. With daily-updated data synthesized in 20 languages using a rules-based methodology, RepRisk systematically flags and monitors material ESG risks and violations of international standards that can have reputational, compliance, and financial impacts on a company. Our flagship product, the RepRisk Platform, is the world’s largest database of its kind, consisting of 130k+ public and private companies and 30k+ projects of all sizes, in every sector and market. Leading organizations around the world rely on RepRisk as their key due diligence solution to prevent and mitigate ESG and business conduct risks related to their operations, business relationships, and investments.
Job Description
As a Senior Java Developer, you will be involved in all aspects of back-end software development within RepRisk, including design, implementation and operation. The role will primarily involve development and maintenance of data processing and language analysis solutions, mainly written in Java and PHP. There will be frequent opportunities to work on a broad range of technologies from data processing and integration, machine learning and NLP, databases (SQL/ORM) to deployment and operation on a Unix environment.
You will benefit from working with an experienced team in several locations that will offer support and the scope to greatly enhance your technical skills and knowledge. You will profit from an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies. We want to find someone who is keen to contribute ideas and who loves implementing clean and workable solutions to problems.
Responsibilities
Design and implement features in Java (Spring Framework)
Deploy, maintain and support existing software solutions (Java/PHP/Linux)
Create and update technical documentation
Software testing and quality assurance
Evaluate and identify new technologies
Candidate Profile
You have several years of experience in Java and a strong track record in design, implementation and testing of complex back-end applications. Strong analytical skills and profound knowledge in algorithms and data structures are required. You have the willingness to learn and explore new technologies to create fast, reliable and high-quality software solutions.
You are results-driven and maintain a pragmatic outlook without compromising quality. Proficiency in all areas of frontend development and the ability to cope with an agile environment should be among your established skills. The position requires strong self-management, the ability to deliver on agreed-upon tasks, and to manage expectations even when under pressure. You must be fluent in English.
Experience and Education
Solid experience in the tasks mentioned
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent qualifications
Interest in data analysis/machine learning would be an advantage
Experience in the following technologies would be a plus: Elasticsearch, Hazelcast, GraphQL, ActiveMQ, Keycloak or similar SSO technology.
What we offer
Being part a growing, experienced team that will offer support and the opportunity to enhance your technical skills and knowledge; ability to work in an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies
Entrepreneurial and dynamic work environment with a young and motivated international team within an established company setting
Open and flexible workplace
Opportunity to make a significant contribution to the field of sustainability
Note: work authorization for the respective location is required
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
****English Version included below***
Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.
Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques expérimentes et seniors en traitement des données (Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.
Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.
Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Spécialiste Apprentissage Automatique-Scientifique en traitement des données (Data Scientist), vous devez très bien connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté
Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’apprentissage automatique ou en Science des données.
Expérience éprouvée dans la rédaction de logiciels de production
Grande expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Très bonnes compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Compétences éprouvées de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Bonnes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
* IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.
Ericsson is now looking for Experienced and Senior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.
Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data?
Role Summary:
As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence

Title: Data Architect
Description:
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
Intelligence automatisée (Machine Intelligence) chez Ericsson:
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser un réseau 5G, l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies d'Intelligence artificielle (IA) - il sera vital pour nous de nous occuper de cette complexité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures que nous utilisons pour alimenter nos réseaux et services 5G. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie. Notre groupe international met au point des produits de pointe qui simplifient et automatisent les processus de nos produits et services, et apportent une nouvelle valorisation grâce à des informations sur les données.
Ericsson recrute des architectes expérimentés et seniors des données pour enrichir de manière significative son équipe Global AI Accelerator .
Description du poste :
Ericsson est à la recherche d'architectes des données compétents pour rejoindre son équipe d'experts MI en pleine évolution. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez évoluer et optimiserez notre architecture de données et de traitement en cascade (data pipeline), tout en optimisant la circulation et le recueil des données pour les équipes plurifonctionnelles. Vous êtes un expert en établissement de traitements en cascade (data pipeline) et du Datawrangling, qui aime optimiser les systèmes de traitement des données et les faire évoluer. L'Ingénieur de données soutiendra nos concepteurs de logiciels, architectes de bases de données, analystes de données et scientifiques en traitement des données concernant les initiatives portant sur les données, et assurera l'optimisation de ces dernières et des modèles. L'architecture devOps (dataOps) est la même pour tous les projets en cours. Vous êtes autonome et à l'aise lorsqu'il s'agit de réagir face aux besoins en DataOps de plusieurs équipes, systèmes et produits. Vous serez également responsable de les intégrer à l'architecture utilisée dans l'entreprise. Le bon candidat sera enthousiasmé par la perspective d'optimiser ou même de reconcevoir l'architecture dataOps de notre entreprise, afin de soutenir notre nouvelle génération de produits et de solutions stimulés par la MI.
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Créer et gérer des données optimales et modéliser l'architecture Pipeline en dataOps
Assembler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, qui satisfont aux conditions opérationnelles fonctionnelles / non fonctionnelles.
Découvrir, concevoir et améliorer les procédés internes : automatisation des procédés manuels, optimisation de la délivrance des données, re-conception de l'infrastructure au bénéfice d'une plus grande possibilité d'évolution, etc.
Établir l'infrastructure requise pour l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement optimaux de données, à partir de différentes sources de données en faisant appel à SQL et à des technologies « Big Data » reposant sur le cloud d'AWS, Azure et autres.
Travailler avec les parties prenantes, notamment l'équipe de la Direction, du service Produits, du service Données et Conception, pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et à satisfaire à leurs besoins en infrastructure de traitement des données.
Faire en sorte que les données soient séparées et sécurisées au-delà des frontières nationales, grâce à plusieurs centres de traitement des données et à des clients / partenaires stratégiques.
Créer des chaines de compilation (toolchain) pour l'équipe des scientifiques en traitement des données et d'analyse, qui les aident à créer et à optimiser notre produit, afin qu'il devienne le premier produit de l'industrie de par son degré d'innovation.
Coopérer avec les experts en apprentissage automatique et en traitement des données, afin d'améliorer le fonctionnement de nos systèmes de gestion du cycle de vie des modèles et de traitement de nos données.
Appuyer l'accumulation de compétences en DapaOps dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Ce que nous aimerions constater:
BS, MS ou doctorat en informatique, en informatique, en systèmes de traitement des informations ou dans un autre domaine connexe.
Au moins 3 ans d'expérience en utilisation des logiciels / outils suivants :
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Expérience en bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres et Cassandra.
Expérience en outils de traitement en pipeline de modèles et des données, en gestion du déroulement des travaux : Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont très poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont très solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.
*IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Machine Intelligence at Ericsson:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, MachineLearning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution
Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through datainsights.
Ericsson is hiring Experienced and Senior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.
Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing datasystems and evolving them. The Data Architect will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
What we would like to see:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
At least 3 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
You have advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
You have experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
You have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
You have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Data Architect: 3 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Language:
English (Preferred)
French (Preferred)

Title: Software Developer, CUDA
Description:
Software Developer, CUDA
Join us to be a part of exciting and disruptive growth! Daisy Intelligence is an artificial intelligence (A.I.) platform that transforms vast volumes of data into meaningful insights. Daisy exists to enable retailers to make smarter operational decisions using math and science. Our platform can simulate potential outcomes that will directly affect our clients’ profit and loss. Daisy gives voice to the facts and helps our clients prepare for a better future. Using our proprietary mathematical solutions, we provide retailers with a tool that helps them make the optimal decision in their strategic marketing and/or merchandising planning and promotions.
Duration: Permanent
Location: Keele and Steeles (TTC Accessible, free parking)
Job Description
You will work with the lead scientist at Daisy Intelligence and act as a valued member of the Computation team. Responsibilities will involve hands-on parallel computing, optimization, biomimicry, statistics, machine learning, reinforcement learning, visualization and numerical methods.
Daisy Intelligence solutions involve modeling vast volumes of our clients' data, which requires leading edge computing and machine learning methods. You will be part of creating the future of analytics and will have the opportunity to author and co-author patents for successful research initiatives.
Key Accountabilities
Parallelization of existing Daisy artificial intelligence software
Software solution design, programming development and testing
Documenting and co-authoring internal technical specifications, and patents
Commercialization of successful applied research into software products that will be used by Daisy Intelligence delivery teams to service clients in the Retail, Insurance
Technical Skills
You have strong programming skills with experience developing in C
Experience using CUDA in a GPU development environment is an asset
You have a working knowledge of database technologies with very strong SQL skills or ability to manipulate and analyze very large volumes of data
Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++
Strong mathematical skills with knowledge/interest in machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced statistics, parallel computing and operations research
Knowledge of or interest in data visualization methods and technologies
Strong technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel
General skills and Attitude
You are an excellent learner who can quickly adopt to new technologies
You have an interest in solving complex business problems
You love collaborating in the creation of new and leading-edge technology
You possess strong English written and oral communication skills
You are willing to work very hard to achieve deadlines
You desire to advance the world of machine learning and artificial intelligence
Skills & Qualifications:
Strong work ethic, and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment with continuous dead-lines for delivery
Ability to find creative solutions to complex leading-edge problems
Comfortable with working in small, high performance teams
Ability to adapt new capabilities and grow your expertise
Perks
Annual performance bonus
Group health benefits
Vacation allowance
Skills development
Flexibility
Start-up culture

Title: Full-Stack Developer, Omnia AI
Description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada
All Available Locations: Montreal
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.
Are you passionate about full-stack development, data and technology solutions, driven to learn about them and keep up with the market evolution, while working remotely with colleagues and clients? If you answered yes, then we have an opportunity waiting for you!
What will your typical day look like?
As a Full-Stack Developer based in our Montreal Canadian Delivery Centre (CDC) within our Omnia AI group, you will be part of a team that delivers new technology solutions or upgrades to our clients. We count on you to help clients define their requirements, design, develop or configure solutions, analyze client business processes, transform client data, test the solutions, and more. Basically, we expect you to work with your team and clients across the entire implementation cycle. You will play an active role throughout the entire implementation cycle, further building on your understanding of software development and/or configuration principles while working with both OpenSource and proprietary technology.

Key responsibilities and job functions include:
Create various custom applications that tailor towards different clients by working with multiple teams and understanding the business needs of both the clients and the internal teams
Work closely with product management, design, and analytic teams to define application requirements/user stories
Design and develop front-end interfaces, backend systems with multiple programming languages and frameworks
Consistently write effective code that is stable, secure, scalable and efficient
Accurately define effort requirements and manage personal workflow to ensure the deliverables are created on time and in budget
About the team
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.

Our Canadian Delivery Centre (CDC) team within our Omnia AI group is based out of Montreal and helps multiple clients replace, upgrade or maintain their information systems. We deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems. Our teams deliver “Big Data”, Robotic Processing Automation, Digital Content, Data Integration, and Analytical Solutions. Each one of these solutions leverages a different mix of new technologies to achieve a business outcome.

We have:
Leading methods and tools
Top professionals to coach and develop you
An open mind for new ideas
Opportunities to work with leading Canadian and global companies
Partnerships with top software providers
A dynamic and energetic workplace
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone with:

Outstanding communication skills and the ability to work fluently in English
A college or university degree and 4+ years’ experience building software solutions in a corporate or start up engineering environment using any or all of the following: full-stack Java, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Ruby, C++, or related technologies
2+ years’ experience developing web and mobile applications (iOS or Android), and front-end technologies including HTML, CSS, React, Ember, Angular, and others
Experience developing Data Transformation Processes (ETL) and/or databases development (Traditional or Big Data) would be a plus
Experience in developing technical solutions to business opportunities (i.e. improving client’s sales efforts)

If you believe you have what it takes to be a successful member of our team please apply now. We know your career is important to you and it's important to us, too. This role is just the first step of a highly successful career we can help you build.

The time is right for you to join Deloitte. Get your career off to great start. What impact will you make?
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You?
At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having a diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Title: Technical Specialist, Data Engineering
Description:
Get ready to digitally enable the good work at UHN, as you become a key part of data management evolution.

As a Technical Specialist reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Engineering, you have a specific focus on present and emerging data technology, you're an expert in core ETL/ELT concepts, cloud-based data management, Master Data Management and data analytics & visualization who has an extensive background with ADT / Health Information Systems. You are a SQL expert in several database management systems, and you rely on your seasoned technical abilities as well as your creativity to produce stunning data models and visualizations.

When it comes to Business Intelligence, you are ahead of the pack as you look to emerging cloud BI technology and NoSQL databases to supplement or replace on-prem or traditional data warehouse solutions, often doing so with agile projects. To round off your skills, data analysis is your forte: you excel in multiple components of analysis, primarily Business Intelligence, and you are known for effective and meaningful data visualizations and presentations. You are a master in reading the stories the data is telling you and visually sharing those stories with your stakeholders at all levels of the enterprise in meaningful ways. Finally, others describe you as a highly skilled team player with loads of emotional intelligence. Those looking to make a positive and meaningful impact on an agile team in the healthcare industry are most welcome to apply now.
Your daily impact will include:

Creating / maintaining data models, processes and ETL packages to feed data repositories
Working with executive level stakeholders on high visibility, real-time, responsive data visualizations used throughout the enterprise
Augmenting existing business data sharing processes and capabilities with modern tools and methodologies
Creating a road-map for feeding data warehouse data into data lake or cloud DW technologies
Contributing to a multi-million dollar Health Information System evolution project
Migrating on-prem reporting systems into present day cloud solutions
Leading the organization in setting standards for the visualization of descriptive and predictive analytics data
Writing advanced / complex SQL queries and scripts to pool data sources
Providing tuning expertise to technical business report creators
Developing efficient PL/SQL packages and SQL Server stored procedures
Pulling data from REST API's including HL7-FHIR / XML / JSON
ELT solutions in cloud-based / data lake data storage technologies
Developing new ways to more efficiently store and move data across the major hospitals of downtown Toronto
Microsoft SharePoint / embedded application development with Power BI reports and APIs
Positively disrupting how business decisions are made by re-developing business reports into meaningful, visual formats in current BI platforms
Empowering the business to create, maintain and share Business Intelligence, including the underlying data sets
Ensuring data can be fluidly and securely shared across the enterprise
Fulfilling Enterprise Data Warehouse maintenance responsibilities including data requests
Administering present-day BI tools and migrating data sets into newer technologies
Project and cross-team collaborative responsibilities not explicitly listed above
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor of (Computer) Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or related major required
8-10 years of extensive ETL/ELT building and monitoring experience for data warehouses and/or data lakes required
Demonstrable proficiency in Oracle 10/12/13c/18c , SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB
5-8 years of Descriptive Analytics reporting through Business Intelligence tools required
5+ years experience in building data cubes, slicing/dicing data, and access controls to share data sets between individual and roles required
MSBI solutions experience including Microsoft Power BI, SSRS / SSIS , proficiency in DAX programming required
Masterful SQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL, shell scripting and programming skills
Figure-it-out mentality with a positive, team-oriented attitude; a long history of charismatic self-starting and positive disruption
Proven ability to adapt priorities in a complex, fast-paced, fluid environment
Superior verbal, written communication and presentation skills to disseminate information to all business areas and levels of leadership
A history of working on agile / devOps teams
Working knowledge of Microsoft Power BI required
Preferred Qualifications
Master Data Management experience with multiple MDM solutions / architectures preferred
Experience in Healthcare Information Systems strongly preferred
Databases: Oracle 12c/18c/19c, MongoDB, Postres, SQL Server 2014 / 2016 / 2019
Advanced expertise with Microsoft Excel, pivot tables, formulas, functions
Microsoft Azure experience, including Azure Data Factory preferred
Proficiency in Azure Embedded applications development, embedding Power BI preferred
Big Data technology and NoSQL database experience preferred
Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) working environment
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) designation(s): Data Management and Analytics (BI Development, BI Reporting or Data Engineering with Azure)
Oracle Certified Professional designation(s): PL/SQL Developer, Cloud
Microsoft DAX and and/or MSBI/Power BI training transcript
Extensive experience with other BI tools (Cognos, Tableau)
Fundamental Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence training
Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification
Experience with Healthcare Information System migrations in Ontario an asset
HL7 / FHIR training transcript

Title: Lead Computer Vision Scientist
Description:
Company Overview:
25% of the Fortune 50 trust Samasource to deliver secure, high-quality training data and validation for the technology teams driving humanity forward. From self-driving cars to smart hardware, Samasource fuels AI. Founded over a decade ago, we're experts in image, video and sensor data annotation and validation for machine learning algorithms in industries including automotive, navigation, AR/VR, biotech, agriculture, manufacturing, and e-commerce. Our staff are driven by a mission to expand opportunity for low-income people through the digital economy, and our social business model has helped lift over 50,000 people out of poverty. Check us out on the BBC!

R&D at Samasource:
The Samasource R&D team is focused on delivering an integrated solution solving the most complex ML solutions for Fortune 500 companies. We use advanced AI and Software Development practices to build scalable, secure and efficient solutions covering multiple aspects of ML and AI, from data collection to annotation and building and operating ML models.

What You'll Do:
With a commitment to the success of our customers, you will use your outstanding development skills to deliver compelling computer vision solutions for the top Fortune 500 companies.

You will be responsible for developing and improving our technology to detect and track objects on images, videos and Lidar systems, and driving forward our computer vision technology offering, from research to productization. Through proper planning and delivery, you will work collaboratively with Product Management and your scrum team to deliver the best products and solutions to our customers.

Qualifications:
PhD or Masters in computer vision, image processing, artificial intelligence, or a related field, along with at least 10 years of industry experience.
Experience in leading computer vision projects, from prototype to delivery.
Proficient in Python and general OOP development.
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch, and computer vision frameworks such as OpenCV.
Familiarity with scientific computing libraries such as numpy, pandas, scikit.
Can develop and prototype new machine learning techniques, and run experiments to systematically improve model accuracy.
Understanding of service-oriented architectures.
Bonus Points:
Contribution to research communities and/or efforts, including publishing papers at conferences such as NIPS, ICML, CVPR, JMIV, SPIE, etc.
Experience with cloud Infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Comfortable working with a distributed team.

Location: This position is based in our new Montreal, Canada office.

Learn More:
AI's new workforce: the data-labelling industry spreads globally
Samasource announces company growth ahead of exhibition of fashion R&D open source dataset at CVPR 2019

Title: DevOps Specialist
Software Engineer, Stadia
Description:
In school or graduated within last 9 months? We encourage you to apply to openings on the Student Jobs site
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in software development in one or more general purpose programming languages.
Experience developing gaming software and/or in the gaming industry
Experience with any of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed/parallel systems, machine learning, natural language processing.

Preferred qualifications:
Master’s degree, PhD, or experience in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, or Go.
Experience with or interest and ability to learn other coding languages.
Experience developing accessible technologies.
Experience with more than two of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed/parallel systems, machine learning, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, information retrieval, security software development.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.
Stadia is Google’s premier Video Game platform, designed for everyone. We are working on custom built hardware and rapidly evolving open source technology to deliver a seamless gaming experience across multiple devices. Stadia provides players new ways to discover, engage, and connect with content with no download required thanks to our cutting-edge data centers. Our team members are building the tools that will push game development to new levels, reducing the barrier to entry and bringing gaming to everyone. Through the power of Stadia, there is unlimited possibility.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Intern
Description:
Job Field:
New Graduate / Student
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Building Location:

BGIS is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.
SUMMARY:
As part of the Finance team, you will be engaged and ready to support the team with data collection, engineering, analysis and data mining tasks, to support cross-departmental analyses.
The team’s role is to address complex business and Financial problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI is a rapidly expanding field which enables companies to remain competitive, and to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data and supporting cross-department analyses, creating and implementing ML models internally.
The intern will work cross-department on advanced analytics, data mining and automation projects. The intern will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models, with a focus on financial analysis, the energy industry and operational improvement initiatives. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the fields of Data Science / Artificial Intelligence, Finance and / or Energy. Ideal candidates would have a background in Finance, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, or Engineering programs
Roles and Responsibilities
We are looking for a team player who possesses / is interested in developing exceptional analytical skills, can learn quickly, and is truly motivated by solving impactful business problems
Create and operationalize ML models internally
Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal systems and external data sources
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify opportunity areas utilizing tools that can handle large data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)
Data Engineering to add value to collected data by creating features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management / data governance
Develop both simple and machine learning models to drive business success
Create dashboards to disseminate information to business audiences utilizing tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Create presentation decks to explain analyses and recommendations
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support Finance controllers and analysts with complex analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally
Required Knowledge & Skills
Academic or industrial experience in advanced analytics tools, such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS, Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, etc.
Academic or industrial experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Academic or industrial experience with databases, analytic applications, and/or programming languages preferred (i.e. data modeling, SQL, Java)
Recently completed, or working towards, a Master’s designation or university-level certification in Data Science, Analytics or AI
Technically and digitally savvy with an interest/passion in uncovering insights through analytics
Ability to tame and analyze large datasets and translate into actionable recommendations and meaningful stories
Collaborator, learner and a go-getter with a positive attitude
Confident in oral, written, and interpersonal skills
Strong customer focus and a total commitment to customer satisfaction
Desired Knowledge & Skills:
For this internship opportunity, BGIS is most interested in students who are serious about venturing into the Real Estate industry
Experience in the creation and use of big data environments is preferred
Recent graduates or undergraduate students completing their final two years are preferred

Title: Data Scientist

InSync Systems Inc. is a privately-owned boutique Canadian Resourcing and Consulting Services Company that works closely with a range of corporate clients across multiple industries to bring them solutions that effectively address their business needs.

Title: Specialist, Data Governance
Description:
Specialist, Data Governance
Specialist, Data Governance
At CN Rail, we work together to move our company—and our country—forward. We invest more than $100 million every year on projects and infrastructure. We harness the power of information to guide our decisions, and the Enterprise Architecture team is a critical part of the engine that keeps us in motion.
CN’s Enterprise Architecture Team is transforming our organization and is focused on building the future of rail technology. We are looking for the brightest, collaborative and most innovative minds in the industry to help us achieve our goals. If you are passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Industrial Internet of Things, big data platforms and enjoy solving complex problems, CN is looking for you.
Want to know more about the Enterprise Architecture team, and the meaningful work we do in Information & Technology?
ABOUT THE ROLE
As part of the Enterprise Architecture organization, the Specialist, Data Governance will be responsible for translating business strategy into a fit for purpose business and technology architecture that ensures stable, reliable, resilient and efficient service delivery that meet customer needs and enable innovation. Further, he/she will use and drive best-in-class Enterprise Architecture principles including a common service-oriented architecture, consistent technical frameworks and guidance, and a loosely coupled agile architecture across the organization.

This job is responsible to ensure – via data definitions, data policies and standards, governance rules, roles and responsibilities - that information is managed as a strategic business asset in the same manner as our tangible rail equipment.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with Business and IT Stewards to drive continuous improvement of our data management capabilities, practices, and outcomes to enhance both business performance and compliance levels over time through achievement of target information maturity model milestones.
Contribute to the construction and maintenance of the data stewardship network.
Help establish best practice and ownership of the corporate taxonomy and ontology, and develop rules for their use.
Develop standards, policies and procedures to support the creation and provide technical assurance for the on-going implementation of the data governance policy within the business.
Contribute to the implementation of the Data Governance Framework.
Elaborate business glossary with business Data Stewards and SMEs; determine data criticality in the context of identified business processes; Assess general data quality and identifies data issues.
Work with Data Quality Analysts and SMEs to determine root causes and business impacts of data issues; Assess existing data rules & responsibilities; Determine and prioritize data related risks with business Data Stewards and SMEs.
Recommend which data rules, responsibilities & data management processes should be implemented or changed.
Support and contribute to project management activities by participating in the scoping and estimating of project efforts, risks identification and mitigation measures recommendation, communicating activity status and providing timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems to the Project Manager.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (such as library science), or equivalent related project experience.
7+ years experience in architecture and implementation of complex technology systems
Sound Data Governance and Data Quality concepts knowledge
Strong ability to work in undiscovered, unstructured territories and to formalize processes that are currently not formalized
Strong ability to link technical element (i.e. Data Models) to business elements (i.e. Business process mapping)
Experience in business requirements gathering
The role requires sound communication skills to influence and orient business and technical audience toward a common goal that is satisfying all stakeholders
Strong ability to manage different stakeholder perspectives and resistance to change
Ability to deliver mandate with great autonomy – self-driven
Ability at taking decisions by understanding and explaining trade-offs between business enablement and economics impacts

Assets
Familiarity with Data Governance tools such AXON, Colibra, Datum etc
Knowledge of rail, transportation or logistics industry
Knowledge of best practices and latest trends in data management
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Title: Research Assistant (Data Science)
Description:
POSITION: PART-TIME, 12 MONTH TERM (WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF EXTENSION)
REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR, RESEARCH & BEST PRACTICE IMPLEMENTATION
UNIT: TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH
The Rick Hansen Institute (RHI) is a Canadian-based not-for-profit organization that drives innovation in spinal cord injury (SCI) research and care. By facilitating an international network of researchers, healthcare professionals, entrepreneurs, investors, people with SCI and their supporters, we strive to improve the lives of people living with SCI in Canada and around the world. The Rick Hansen Institute is proudly accredited by Imagine Canada.
This position presents a great learning opportunity for a candidate looking to build upon or expand their experience in the fields of computer science, engineering science, or statistics. RHI provides a multi-disciplinary environment where autonomy, critical and creative thinking are encouraged. The values that drive our mission are teamwork, collaboration, innovation, integrity and trust and exceptional outcomes.
Reporting to the Director, Research & Best Practice Evaluation, the Research Assistant will work closely with and take direction from the Senior Biostatistician on assigned projects. The Research Assistant will also work collaboratively with other RHI internal and external project team members and assist with the preparation of a technical report, possibly a manuscript for publication.
JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Research Assistant is responsible for:
Supporting the application of new methods in Data Science (e.g. machine learning, Fuzzy theory) using SCI data;
Linking and integrating data in different formats from a variety of data sources (both internal and external to RHI);
Writing and executing computer programs as required, using Matlab or R;
Generating standard and customized data reports;
Conducting data reviews, data quality assessments, and data analyses using databases, spreadsheets, and statistical software such as SPSS and R;
Learning programming techniques, health services and population health research methods, and other relevant information related to the project as required;
Working collaboratively with other RHI team members, including providing regular updates on activities, ensuring timely notification of issues or problems, and communicating with internal and external project team members;
Assisting with the preparation of a technical report, and possibly a manuscript for publication; and
Performing other duties as requested.
QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal candidate will have:
A Masters or PhD in a relevant discipline (Computing Science, Engineering Science, Statistics, etc.)
Experience using Matlab and R
Understanding of other statistical software such as SPSS and SAS
Two years of work experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence
Effective oral and written communication
Effective time management skills
Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy, analyzing and attention to detail
Ability to exercise tact, discretion, and confidentiality
Ability to interact effectively and positively with others
Ability to work independently and within a team environment in a fast-paced environment
Ability to identify and solve problems
HOW TO APPLY
Interested and qualified candidates can apply here by October 14, 2019. While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on the Rick Hansen Institute, please visit our website at www.rickhanseninstitute.org.

Possibility to build a career

Open, collaborative and tech-driven workspace

Eligibility to work in Canada
It’s important that you are eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.
