Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont très poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont très solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.
*IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Machine Intelligence at Ericsson:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, MachineLearning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution
Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning and other Artificial Intelligence technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is a key competence to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure that we use to power our 5G networks and services. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations to drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry. Our global group develop state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and create new value through datainsights.
Ericsson is hiring Experienced and Senior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.
Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing datasystems and evolving them. The Data Architect will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
What we would like to see:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
At least 3 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
You have advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
You have experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
You have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
You have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Data Architect: 3 years (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (Required)
Language:
English (Preferred)
French (Preferred)

Title: Senior Java Developer in Toronto
Description:
About RepRisk
RepRisk is a global leader and pioneer in data science, specializing in premium ESG and business conduct risk research and quantitative solutions. Since 2006, RepRisk has been leveraging artificial intelligence and curated human analysis to translate big data into actionable business intelligence and risk metrics. With daily-updated data synthesized in 20 languages using a rules-based methodology, RepRisk systematically flags and monitors material ESG risks and violations of international standards that can have reputational, compliance, and financial impacts on a company. Our flagship product, the RepRisk Platform, is the world’s largest database of its kind, consisting of 130k+ public and private companies and 30k+ projects of all sizes, in every sector and market. Leading organizations around the world rely on RepRisk as their key due diligence solution to prevent and mitigate ESG and business conduct risks related to their operations, business relationships, and investments.
Job Description
As a Senior Java Developer, you will be involved in all aspects of back-end software development within RepRisk, including design, implementation and operation. The role will primarily involve development and maintenance of data processing and language analysis solutions, mainly written in Java and PHP. There will be frequent opportunities to work on a broad range of technologies from data processing and integration, machine learning and NLP, databases (SQL/ORM) to deployment and operation on a Unix environment.
You will benefit from working with an experienced team in several locations that will offer support and the scope to greatly enhance your technical skills and knowledge. You will profit from an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies. We want to find someone who is keen to contribute ideas and who loves implementing clean and workable solutions to problems.
Responsibilities
Design and implement features in Java (Spring Framework)
Deploy, maintain and support existing software solutions (Java/PHP/Linux)
Create and update technical documentation
Software testing and quality assurance
Evaluate and identify new technologies
Candidate Profile
You have several years of experience in Java and a strong track record in design, implementation and testing of complex back-end applications. Strong analytical skills and profound knowledge in algorithms and data structures are required. You have the willingness to learn and explore new technologies to create fast, reliable and high-quality software solutions.
You are results-driven and maintain a pragmatic outlook without compromising quality. Proficiency in all areas of frontend development and the ability to cope with an agile environment should be among your established skills. The position requires strong self-management, the ability to deliver on agreed-upon tasks, and to manage expectations even when under pressure. You must be fluent in English.
Experience and Education
Solid experience in the tasks mentioned
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent qualifications
Interest in data analysis/machine learning would be an advantage
Experience in the following technologies would be a plus: Elasticsearch, Hazelcast, GraphQL, ActiveMQ, Keycloak or similar SSO technology.
What we offer
Being part a growing, experienced team that will offer support and the opportunity to enhance your technical skills and knowledge; ability to work in an agile development ecosystem using state-of-the-art open-source technologies
Entrepreneurial and dynamic work environment with a young and motivated international team within an established company setting
Open and flexible workplace
Opportunity to make a significant contribution to the field of sustainability
Note: work authorization for the respective location is required
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Scientist, Medical Imaging; Canada
Description:
Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact.
As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities.
Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life.

If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.
Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all.
Empower Your Future. Make a Difference.
Position Description
The Data Scientist is a key contributor to the success of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Medical Imaging team, the Imaging, Enterprise Imaging Solutions business unit, and Change Healthcare (CHC). This individual with versatile data science skills will create commercial-grade AI solutions for medical imaging products. He/she will participate to the optimization of our AI operations from data ingestion and machine learning modeling to integration into the end product.
The AI Medical Imaging team is responsible for creating AI enabled solutions, maintaining a culture of innovation with a startup mindset, and providing subject matter expertise for the benefit of Change Healthcare. While the AI Medical Imaging team has stakeholders throughout the business unit, it works most closely with academic and industrial partners and those parts of the organization responsible for product conception, design and development. The Data Scientist will work with all stakeholders to fulfill Company’s business needs.
Responsibilities:
Build and maintain large medical imaging databases
Develop data cleaning and pre-processing methods to normalize data and detect outliers
Optimize data transfer, data flows and data operations
Implement and document API’s for machine learning algorithms
Develop and deploy machine learning algorithms for medical imaging use cases
Collaborate with academic and industrial partners to collect and optimize data collection
Assist with product integration of machine learning solutions
Assist in development of machine learning web/UI applications
Minimum Requirement (Required):
5+ years in software development, preferably in medical imaging
5+ years of machine learning experience
Critical Skills (Required):
5+ years of programming experience in Python, R, JS and C/C++
5+ years of development in data modeling and machine learning, including practical experience of deep learning methods (CNN, RNN) and/or natural language processing
3+ years of experience in agile development
2+ year of experience with machine learning toolkits (TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Keras)
1+ years of experience with cloud-based storage and computing tools for machine learning
Experience with at least one of the public cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, Azure or IBM Cloud
Additional Knowledge & Skills (Preferred / Not Required):
Experience developing commercial Web/UI applications
Development experience with topological data analysis
Experience in CI/CD tools
Experience in automated functional/load/integration test tools
Experience of declarative languages such as XML, JSON, and YAML
Experience in ‘Linux/Unix’ OS and shell scripting
Soft Skills:
Strong written and verbal communication, and interpersonal skills
Highly self-motivated and directed. Results oriented
Cross-cultural and team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment
Education / Training:
PhD or MS in computer science, electrical engineering or related discipline or equivalent industry
experience.
Physical Requirements:
Limited domestic and international travel required (up to 5%).
Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system!

Title: Technical Solution Specialist - IBM Summit 2020 (Calgary)
Description:
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill consultative, client-focused, technical roles.

At IBM, we’re motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind, and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBM’s sales team, you will work with clients as they advance their digital transformation. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

Our Technical Solution Specialists are guided by IBM's purpose – To Be Essential.

Joining IBM is also more than joining a company, you are joining a community.
At IBM we are focused on helping communities take on challenges big and small. IBM brings the power of its technology, resources, and people to help with initiatives around the world, from education to health to resilience. As an IBMer, you would have opportunities to give back to your local community and make a difference through various programs.

Join a company where you can do your best work!

You will actively:
Engage clients to develop trust, credibility and develop long-term relationships
Help clients grow their businesses by solving strategic, technical and tactical business problems with IBM’s proven cognitive and cloud technology solutions
Partner with clients and demonstrate your technical expertise to assist your sales counterparts and maintain client satisfaction
Deliver industry-centric technology solutions to clients of all sizes and markets
Work in a changing environment where no two days are ever the same
Work with the client account team and drive revenue through in-depth, complex technical demonstrations, designing solutions, technical evaluations, and/or proof-of-concepts
Be ready to interact with a variety of other smart and highly motivated people daily
Please note: this is not a coding or development role. You will have the opportunity to leverage your strong technical expertise to consult with clients, helping them design technical solutions. This position requires a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients, IBM sellers and other teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Cloud, Cognitive/Artificial Intelligence, Internet of Things, Cyber Security, Technology Services, Systems Hardware, Global Finance or Digital Sales.

Summit Training
During the nine-month development program, we provide extraordinary technology, industry solution training, shadowing opportunities and consultative sales training through a combination of classroom and online resources, hands-on field experiences, and structured mentorship. We will equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to match the technical capabilities of IBM offerings to client requirements and help you grow as a leader.

After competing your Summit training, you will continue to develop your skills over the next 6 months “on the job” working with a job role mentor, engaging with clients shadowing and gaining deeper skills aligned to your business unit, offerings and territory. IBM is investing in more than one year of sales training and is committed to your success. After your first year, you transition to a full sales plan and continue working with clients and building a successful technical sales career. Are you ready to take your sales career to the next level?

This role may be for you if you show a proven track record of accomplishment in:
Conversant, knowledgeable and passionate about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
Team collaboration and leadership
Experience demonstrating business insight for long-lasting client relationships and results
Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction
We are currently hiring for the January 2020 cohorts.

Training period requires 30% travel.
All applicants must have the required work authorization to be able to travel to the US, and must have a valid driver’s license.

If you would like additional information about the Summit Program, please visit: http://www-03.ibm.com/employment/summit

Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent
Must be able to travel to the US
Valid Driver’s license
English: Fluent

Prior work experience in sales or service in the technology industry (up to 5 years)
Programming coursework or experience
Readiness to travel up to 25% annually

IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.

What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Research Scientist
Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are
At Adlib, we are redefining how the world manages and leverages unstructured information. As the global leader in Advanced Rendering technology, Adlib helps organizations in the Energy, Life Sciences, Insurance, and Banking sectors, among others, enhance content-centric processes by unlocking the value in unstructured content.
Who you are
You are really excited to be advancing our research to derive knowledge and insights from large corpora of structured and unstructured data. This is a unique opportunity to use a broad number of Artificial Intelligence disciplines such as Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, etc. to solve Data Science challenges. The resulting algorithms and products would become part of the Adlib Elevate platform and will have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe.
Our new Data Scientist will:
Identify, evaluate, and develop standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems.
Design and execute experiments to test and validate the solution and confirm the goals are achieved.
Develop and maintain Machine Learning systems to analyze, classify and extract data from content.
Research and create new Machine Learning systems and techniques to address needs, as well as building models to meet goals.
Collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data sources.
Transform unstructured datasets into structured data products.
Document developed solutions and communicate findings and achievements to other stakeholders at the company.
Collaborate with engineering colleagues to achieve the goals in a timely manner and improve solutions.
Acquire specialized domain knowledge required to be more effective in all of the required activities.
Leverage data mining techniques to extract insights from content.
Adapt the latest technologies in data mining and modelling to design and perform scientific experiments and tests.
Our new Data Scientist has:
PhD or MA in Computer Science or related field such as Mathematics or Statistics
Proven track record of delivering high quality Data Science solutions
Strength in developing and analyzing Artificial Intelligence techniques, such as Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Computer Vision algorithms.
Experience designing end-to-end Machine Learning pipelines.
Experience with distributed big data stores (e.g. Hadoop or others) working with TB+ scale datasets
Experience using clustering, regression and classification Machine Learning techniques.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Strong programming skills, expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures (Python, Java, .NET or equivalent).
Experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent critical thinking, creativity, design, and communication skills
What’s in it for you?
We wholeheartedly believe that maximizing work-life balance is one of the most important paths to high performance. To that end, we have an open-vacation policy and many programs to promote employee wellness. We have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement.
Adlib is located in Burlington, Ontario and many of our employees also enjoy a minimal commute which allows for maximum family and friends time.
Our company
Adlib's headquarters are located in Burlington, Ontario. As a company, we care about employee health and wellness and develop programs that align to achieving personal and professional satisfaction. We are also passionate about our community and participate in many local charitable events.
At Adlib we have a number of employee programs and benefits that drive our culture and values including but not limited to:
Fitness reimbursement
RRSP matching
No limit vacation
Extended maternity and paternity leave
Employee assistance programs, and much more
To learn more about this role please express your interest here or follow us on Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn for future opportunities.
Adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit – we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. Embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. Adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Title: Senior Software Developer (Req # 2019-072)
Description:
WHY WORK AT ROSS VIDEO?

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results.

If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

If that resonates, and you're someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we'd love to hear from you.

THE ROLE

We’re looking for a Senior Software Designer, working on the Embedded & Application level to help build out a new suite of exciting products. In this position, you’ll be designing, simulating and testing leading edge software solutions for a variety of customers in the commercial & military video markets.

You’ll work with a team of Hardware & Software developers to design requirements, support aggressive project scheduling, while verifying the functionality of both the embedded and application software solutions that you create. This means you’ll also be responsible for generating specification & design documentation to support cross functional elements of the new production integration (NPI) process.

As a senior member of the team, you’ll also provide support and guidance on the Hardware requirements which drive schematic development and other hardware components specifically related to the embedded control solutions. In order to ensure maximum quality, you’ll thoroughly self-test all of your designs, and will support DevTest & PV, which means reviewing test plans to align focus, validating feedback and debugging/fixing problems when needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

To be considered, you will have a minimum of 10 years of Embedded Software development experience, or equivalent. You will also possess Senior level Application Software design knowledge and experience in the development of complex IP-based video and audio systems in an embedded Linux environment utilizing C, JavaScript, HTML, USB protocols and network sockets. Experience with embedded Linux development and embedded microcontroller software design & OS/RTOS environments will also be required, as will familiarity with common development tools & IDE’s such as GCC, Make, Eclipse, etc., as well as version control solutions such as Subversion, Git, CVS, etc.

We operate utilizing agile development methods (specifically Scrum) so experience within this setting is required, as well as a demonstrated ability to provide accurate estimates for task & project durations, as well as the ability to use those estimates to drive towards completion. Strong debugging skills & proficiency with typical lab equipment (scopes, multimeters, etc.) and strong computer skills, with proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint & Word are also required within this role.

NICE TO HAVE

While not necessarily must haves, experience with the following would be beneficial:
Experience with USB Host and Gadget device development
Experience with Xilinx FPGA, Xilinx PetaLinux, Yocto development environments and JTAG pods
Experience with 10G/25G fiber networking, SFP+, and high-performance network switchers
Experience with network protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, SNMP, etc.), wireshark and network analyzers
Experience with HTML GUI design and deployment (LAMP, DOM, jQuery, Dojo, etc.)
Familiarity with professional broadcast markets, and associated digital audio and video standards
Familiarity with general circuit principles, uP design, and related PCB level troubleshooting
Experience with C#, .NET, Java, JSON, XML and Databases
Experience with Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning and AI-based hardware acceleration
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or Engineering
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

If the description of the role above sounds interesting to you, and if you feel you meet the qualifications described, we’d love to chat. In addition to the technical knowledge & skills, we’re looking for somebody with strong interpersonal skills, as well as the desire and ability to work both as part of a team, but also independently as required. Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition will also be useful traits for you to possess, in order to manage both the pace & complexity of some of the issues you’ll be tasked with. To this end, you’ll also be organized and a detail oriented self starter, who is able to self manage in order to meet aggressive deadlines.

We’re not looking for someone whose knowledge is set in stone – we want you to be able to learn new concepts quickly, and ultimately work towards finding creative solutions to challenging issues. You’ll be equally comfortable contributing as a day to day member of the team as you are in championing an idea to upper management.

IN A NUTSHELL

Do you have integrity, commitment, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Our client is an international telecommunications organization, dedicated to enabling their customers to thrive and prosper.

They are looking for Data Scientists – Machine Learning Specialists to join their dedicated AI lab based in Montreal.

Title: Data Scientist – Machine Learning Specialist
Location: Montreal, QC
Salary: Extremely competitive + benefits package + pension plan

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to Emily at emily.woods@groomassocies.com

As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.

Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within the organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in the organization to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of the offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within the organization.
Assist MI Competence build-up in the organization.
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
Requirements:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis

Title: Software Developer, Omnia AI - Co-op/Intern Winter 2020 (Tor...
Description:
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching.
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

We combine our AI and machine learning expertise with our business and industry acumen to execute on business problems and build tangible enterprise solutions, come check us out.
What will your typical day look like?

You will work closely with product management, design and analytic teams to create various custom applications that tailor towards different clients rooted through their business needs. By working with multiple teams from both client and internal teams, you will define application requirements/user stories, design and develop front-end interfaces, backed systems leveraging multiple programming languages and frameworks. You have the responsibility to accurately define effort requirements, consistently write effective code that is stable, secure, scalable & efficient, and manage your personal workflow to ensure the deliverables are created on time and within budget. You will become a contributor by influencing the building of the team.
About the team

Omnia AI, Deloitte’s Artificial Intelligence (AI) practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful AI transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes. We are looking for candidates that display initiative, creativity, out-of-the-box thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving, high design sensibility, attention to detail and executing deliverables to a variety of clients.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who is:
Enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science, computer engineering or other related programs
Driven to solve the problem at hand and bring their best ever day through positivity, communication and great time and task management
Quick to learn new technologies on your own and aren’t intimidated by new technologies
Exposure/experience in building software solutions in a corporate or start up engineering environment using JavaScript, PHP, Ruby, Python, C++ and/or Java / C#, HTML, CSS, React / Ember / Angular, etc.
Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by September 24th 2019.

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having a diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

We are passionate about helping you launch your career at Deloitte. Prepped is a free, digital and personalized, voluntary program that may provide the guidance and training you need to properly tackle your job search, and could prepare you for the next steps in the interview process. Prepped is currently only available in English, and is not a Deloitte created tool. Choosing to use or not use Prepped will not be weighted towards or against you. Get Prepped now at https://www.fullyprepped.ca/invite.

Title: Software Developer, Core Media
Description:
Job Description
At Avigilon we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Founded in 2004 in Vancouver, Avigilon has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. At Avigilon, you will find a culture of thought-leaders who are passionate about creating exciting new solutions for security and surveillance. We seek problem-solvers who are eager to rise to the challenges of a continuously evolving technological industry, and those who want to make an impact of the safety of people and businesses globally.

What will you be doing?
Designing features for our security monitoring solutions. We design and build everything from the hardware to the software for our video surveillance and access control systems.
Release high quality software to our customers for their mission-critical public safety and security systems through working on a cross-disciplinary scrum team with embedded UX, QA, and product management.
Researching and identifying new directions for security software, for example sifting through peta-bytes of data to bring suspicious activity into the user’s focus in real time. Having fun. We run annual hack-a-thons, have hockey and soccer teams and lot of great people.
We want you to succeed, so you’ll need:
A degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related technical discipline.
Experience with C++ (ideally C++11/14)
An unending desire to learn (hint: can you demonstrate this?)
Team fit and culture are very important to us. We have a keen eye for people who:
Are self-motivated and take the initiative to get things done.
Have demonstrated a strong desire to innovate.
Have earned a high level of trust from past employers and colleagues.
Are unafraid to try.
Do their best work as part of a team.
When you join us, the technologies and processes you’ll be working with include:
Primarily C++ with Microsoft Visual Studio
Test Driven Development
Digital video and audio codecs
Real-time and multi-threaded systems
Network protocols and disk I/O
Berkeley DB
Agile Scrum
Git and Mercurial
As a full-time employee at Avigilon, you are eligible to receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes MSP, extended health, dental, and medical insurance while travelling. You will also receive a health spending account to cover additional healthcare costs, such as vision care, RMT and chiropractor visits.

Title: Senior AI Programmer
Description:
Job Description
Vice Versa Games is a boutique studio that provides consultation and outsourced co-development specialized in Artificial Intelligence and Gameplay for AAA games.
We have extensive experience shipping console titles with the Unreal Engine, and we pride ourselves on delivering outstanding work product, at a level of polish required by industry leading developers.
Vice Versa Games is looking for an experienced Senior AI Programmer to work full time at our Vancouver office.
You’ll be responsible for building AI behaviors, decision logic, core AI systems, and the tools necessary to bring our AI characters to life. You will collaborate with both onsite and offsite designers and animators to design and develop exciting & engaging experiences.
At Vice Versa Games, we value talent, enthusiasm, initiative and teamwork. In turn we provide an environment with a large degree of freedom and autonomy.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with both onsite and offsite game designers, level designers, and programmers to design, implement and maintain core AI systems, AI characters & tools
Write clean, maintainable, portable code
Optimize and fix bugs in existing AI or gameplay systems
Contribute ideas towards all aspects of game development within the team
Skills and Experience
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent training and professional experience
5+ years of game development experience, with at least one AAA game shipped.
Fluent with C++ and object-oriented programming principles
Strong math skills (linear algebra and trigonometry)
Excellent understanding of AI architecture, algorithms, and pathfinding techniques
Ability to work with a distributed development team
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Self-motivated, strong work ethic, and able to work independently
Willing and able to mentor junior programmers
Strong passion for gameplay and games in general, with the ability to critically analyze other games on the market
Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus
Benefits
Competitive Salary
Health and Dental Insurance
Vacation & Flex Days
Employee Incentive Program
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
SEND YOUR RESUME TO JOBS@VICEVERSAGAMES.COM

Title: Research Assistant (Data Science)
Description:
POSITION: PART-TIME, 12 MONTH TERM (WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF EXTENSION)
REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR, RESEARCH & BEST PRACTICE IMPLEMENTATION
UNIT: TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH
The Rick Hansen Institute (RHI) is a Canadian-based not-for-profit organization that drives innovation in spinal cord injury (SCI) research and care. By facilitating an international network of researchers, healthcare professionals, entrepreneurs, investors, people with SCI and their supporters, we strive to improve the lives of people living with SCI in Canada and around the world. The Rick Hansen Institute is proudly accredited by Imagine Canada.
This position presents a great learning opportunity for a candidate looking to build upon or expand their experience in the fields of computer science, engineering science, or statistics. RHI provides a multi-disciplinary environment where autonomy, critical and creative thinking are encouraged. The values that drive our mission are teamwork, collaboration, innovation, integrity and trust and exceptional outcomes.
Reporting to the Director, Research & Best Practice Evaluation, the Research Assistant will work closely with and take direction from the Senior Biostatistician on assigned projects. The Research Assistant will also work collaboratively with other RHI internal and external project team members and assist with the preparation of a technical report, possibly a manuscript for publication.
JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES
The Research Assistant is responsible for:
Supporting the application of new methods in Data Science (e.g. machine learning, Fuzzy theory) using SCI data;
Linking and integrating data in different formats from a variety of data sources (both internal and external to RHI);
Writing and executing computer programs as required, using Matlab or R;
Generating standard and customized data reports;
Conducting data reviews, data quality assessments, and data analyses using databases, spreadsheets, and statistical software such as SPSS and R;
Learning programming techniques, health services and population health research methods, and other relevant information related to the project as required;
Working collaboratively with other RHI team members, including providing regular updates on activities, ensuring timely notification of issues or problems, and communicating with internal and external project team members;
Assisting with the preparation of a technical report, and possibly a manuscript for publication; and
Performing other duties as requested.
QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal candidate will have:
A Masters or PhD in a relevant discipline (Computing Science, Engineering Science, Statistics, etc.)
Experience using Matlab and R
Understanding of other statistical software such as SPSS and SAS
Two years of work experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence
Effective oral and written communication
Effective time management skills
Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy, analyzing and attention to detail
Ability to exercise tact, discretion, and confidentiality
Ability to interact effectively and positively with others
Ability to work independently and within a team environment in a fast-paced environment
Ability to identify and solve problems
HOW TO APPLY
Interested and qualified candidates can apply here by October 14, 2019. While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. For more information on the Rick Hansen Institute, please visit our website at www.rickhanseninstitute.org.

Title: Software Developer, Tools & Infrastructure
Description:
Job Description
At Avigilon we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Founded in 2004 in Vancouver, Avigilon has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. Title: Software Tester
Description:
Job Summary
Location: Ottawa, Ontario
Industry: Civil Aviation
Job Type: Software Tester (QA)
About the Job
We are currently recruiting for a software tester who is ready to work in a fast-paced, dynamic office environment. It is a high energy position which requires a winning can-do attitude. Must have computer skills, good organization habits, be a problem solver, work well with others, have good communication skills, be a quick learner, and multitask with attention to detail.
The candidate must be interested in software testing and willing to test software as a primary daily task. The candidate will be responsible for the quality assurance of all company software (real-time video processing and information management). This is a junior position with no previous experience required; candidates are expected to have a general understanding of Windows and Linux Operating Systems, software installation, configuration and exploration, basic understanding of computer hardware and have a strong sense of detail and analytical skills. Candidates are expected to be motivated to learn more skills as required. The position will report directly to the VP of Software Engineering.
Duties and Responsibilities
Examine and analyze existing applications and quickly come to an understanding of the system features
Identify software defects and design insufficiency within existing applications
Understand technical testing scripts and strictly follow detailed test procedures
Write, amend or improve test documents and procedures
Search for, evaluate and incorporate automated testing tools into the testing process
Install, configure and manage software of different types and versions in Windows and Linux environments (GUI and terminal)
Build, configure and maintain test beds using provided hardware (computers, displays, network equipment, sensors, etc.)
Communicate constantly and effectively with the software development team to thoroughly report issues found and cooperate with the developers for test planning
Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of testing tools and practises
Collaborate with the QA Lead for QA management (project audits, process documentation, follow ups).
Skills / Attributes Preferred
Previous testing experience is an advantage but not required
Software development experience is an advantage but not required
Must be knowledgeable and familiar with software and Operating System installation, configuration and maintenance
Familiarity with configuring real-time video processing software is an advantage (i.e. VLC).
Familiarity with DevOps tools (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka) is an advantage
Familiarity with software development methodologies is an advantage
Familiarity with SVN and Git, IDEs (MSVC / Code, Eclipse & NetBeans), debugging tools and methods is an advantage
Solid understanding of *nix systems administration and services (specifically Ubuntu & RH distros, eg. startup services, package managers, network & firewall admin, user & group admin, system health monitoring, shell scripting, kernel hacking, etc.) is an asset
Broad and working understanding of network technologies and administration (eg. LAN, Wifi, Radius, DNS, VPN, Routing, etc.) is an advantage but not required
Experience creating technical diagrams and drawings using diagram tools (eg. Microsoft Visio) is an asset.
Optional: understanding of cybersecurity threats, solutions and best practises
Optional: Knowledgeable and familiar with protocols and technologies related to cybersecurity (eg. Data encryption, authentication, access control)
Knowledge of and experience with ISO 27001 standard is a plus
Knowledge of and experience with Quality Assurance Process (ISO 9001:2015 or similar) is a plus
Excellent time management and scheduling skills
Analytical skills to resolve challenges and problems
Ability and willingness to learn new technologies
Strong attention to detail
Self-motivated and innovative
Excellent communication skills both written and spoken
Why Apply?
Searidge Technologies is a global leader in the Air Traffic Control space, boldly forging new paths bringing innovative technology, such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and augmented reality into operation. We are developing and integrating modern technologies to improve both the safety and efficiency of airport operations around the world. Our solutions have been adopted by some of the most advanced airports and ANSPs throughout North America, Middle East, Europe and Asia.
We live and breathe innovation, and we expect the same of all prospective team members. Our developers are constantly engaged in fast-paced, challenging and highly rewarding work. We are looking for the best and brightest to join our highly-motivated team. We are an equal opportunity employer offering exciting work, a respectful and positive work environment, and a competitive benefits package.
Are you looking to be challenged to produce high-performance system components that are robust and intuitive? Are you ready to push the envelope of how software-based tools and solutions are used in a safety-critical environment? Are you prepared to put your skills to the test? .... we want to hear from you.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
IN A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE DATA SCIENTIST YOU’LL:
Have a Passion for Continuous Improvement
Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads and service manager/owners
Proactively mine data warehouses to identify trends and patterns and generates insights for business units and senior leadership
Research and implement cutting-edge techniques and tools in machine learning/deep learning/artificial intelligence to make data analysis more efficient
Determine requirements that will be used to train and evolve deep learning models and algorithms

See the Big Picture
Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows with required information
Perform large-scale experimentation to identify hidden relationships between variables in large datasets
Develop frameworks and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through social media platforms i.e., wikis, blogs, instant messaging, etc. and traditional sources such as e-mail and SharePoint.

Be a Strong Communicator
Visualize information and develops engaging reports on the results of data analysis using data visualization tools
Advise product teams on new products, features or updates through data-based recommendations
Support user experience specialists and information architects to enhance information visualization through development of dashboards and user interfaces
Distribute best practices to analytics and product teams and provides consultations for their data-based experimentations

WHAT KIND OF SKILLS SHOULD YOU HAVE?
The obvious qualities: Dedicated, Imaginative, Professional and…
Up-to-date knowledge of machine learning and data analytics tools and techniques
Strong knowledge in predictive modeling methodology
Experienced at leveraging both structured and unstructured data sources
Willingness and ability to learn new technologies on the job
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision

You’ll have experience with the following:
Experience using statistics and machine learning to solve complex business problems
Experience conducting statistical analysis with advanced statistical software, scripting languages, and packages
Experience with big data analysis tools and techniques
Experience building and deploying predictive models, web scrapping, and scalable data pipelines
Experience with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services is desirable

YOU HAVE DEGREES, CREDENTIALS OR CERTIFICATIONS IN:
Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, statistics, economics, or related fields

DO YOU LIKE PERKS? SO DO WE!

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer an RRSP with company match, gym membership and several health and welfare plans including company paid Short-Term Disability and Basic Life.
Casual dress (prepare your jeans game, because that’s what we wear on most days).
Creative work environment. We always welcome innovative ideas to make our process better.

Java Developer

Title: QA Embedded Software Developer in Test
Description:
**English follows**
Newtrax
Newtrax a rejoint Sandvik Mining et Rock Technology comme une unité d'affaire indépendante. Newtrax croit que l'avenir de l'exploitation minière est souterrain, non seulement parce que les minéraux proches de la surface sont de plus en plus rares, mais aussi parce que les mines souterraines ont une empreinte environnementale beaucoup plus faible.
Pour accélérer la transition vers un avenir où 100% des activités d'extraction sont souterraines, Newtrax élimine la différence numérique actuelle entre les mines à ciel ouvert et les mines souterraines. Pour atteindre cet objectif, Newtrax intègre les dernières technologies de l'Internet des objets (IoT) et de l'intelligence artificielle afin de suivre et fournir des informations sur les opérations souterraines, notamment en ce qui concerne les personnes, les machines et l'environnement.
En tant qu'organisation apprenante dans un secteur mondial en rapide évolution, nos employés constituent notre atout le plus précieux. Nos valeurs fondamentales sont les suivantes:
Santé et sécurité
Citoyen gobal
Travail d'équipe et confiance
Excellence
Discipline financière rigoureuse
Pour en savoir plus sur nos produits, visitez la page suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ et pour voir les témoignages de nos employés, visionnez la vidéo suivante: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
Vos avantages
Travaillez dans un environnement dynamique et rapide où vous aurez des opportunités de croissance.
Joignez une entreprise primée (Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec: prix génie innovation, sélectionné au palmarès Technology Fast 50 au Canada, Entrepreneur de l'année - Technologies de moins de 100 employés).
Travaillez dans un milieu collaboratif et positif, dans une entreprise à taille humaine.
Faites partie d'une entreprise en pleine croissance, présente dans le monde entier.
Profitez d’un espace de travail à aire ouverte au coeur du Vieux-Montréal.
Ayez un accès très pratique en métro, autobus, train ou vélo.
Travaillez avec des professionnels de l’industrie.
Bénéficiez d’une gamme d’assurances complètes et salaire compétitif.
Sommaire
En tant que membre de l’équipe de systèmes embarqués, vous travaillerez avec plusieurs développeurs de logiciels embarqués pour vous aider à tester les dernières technologies de pointe et s'assurer que tous les produits sont livrés à la plus haute qualité.
Le candidat idéal sera en mesure d'exécuter ses engagements dans un environnement au rythme rapide, de présenter des informations techniques en termes simples à différents niveaux de compréhension et de collaborer avec des équipes de service et de produit dotées de solides compétences en communication centrées sur la résolution de problèmes.
Vos responsabilités
Collaborer pour que les fonctionnalités soient bien définies avant le développement
Fournir des commentaires fréquents et réguliers à l'équipe
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre la plate-forme de test du logiciel intégré
Planifier, développer, coordonner et effectuer des tests pour plusieurs produits
Créer des scénarios de test et créer des suites de tests en mettant l’accent sur l’automatisation
Participer aux discussions sur la conception du produit et présenter les résultats des tests aux équipes d'ingénierie et à la direction
Participer au test du système
Recherchez et aidez à reproduire les problèmes des clients
Valider que tous les documents de conception sont exacts et mis à jour
S'assurer que toute la documentation est exacte et pertinente (notes de publication, manuels d'installation, d'utilisation et de maintenance, etc.)
Votre talent
BS ou diplôme équivalent en EE / Informatique ou dans un domaine connexe
Minimum de 3 ans d’expérience dans les tests / automatisation de tests de logiciels intégrés et des applications associées
Forte expérience de Linux embarqué
Compétences de haut niveau en programmation / débogage en Python, C / C ++, Qt, etc.
Expérience confirmée des réseaux de communication de données et des protocoles et technologies associés tels que TCP, UDP, multidiffusion, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP / HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, commutation de couche 2 et 3, pare-feu, NAT et principes de sécurité de base du réseau
Connaissance des réseaux LTE, WiFi, BLE et CAN est préférable
Capacité à travailler efficacement avec des équipes interfonctionnelles
Excellente communication verbale et écrite et compétences interpersonnelles éprouvées
Être orienté vers les résultats, motivé et doté d'un esprit d'équipe
Possibilité de voyager occasionnellement sur les sites des clients 10%
**Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d’alléger le texte et ce, sans aucune discrimination.
_______________________
About Newtrax
Newtrax has joined Sandvik Mining and Rock Technology as a Standalone Business Unit. Newtrax believes the future of mining is underground, not only because minerals close to the surface are increasingly rare, but because underground mines have a significantly lower environmental footprint.
To accelerate the transition to a future where 100% of mining is underground, Newtrax eliminates the current digital divide between surface mines and underground mines. To achieve this goal, Newtrax integrates the latest Internet-of-Things and Artificial Intelligence technologies to monitor and provide insights on underground operations, including people, machines and the environment.
As a learning organization in a fast-paced global industry, our most precious asset is our employees and our guiding values are:
Health, Safety & Security
Global Citizenship
Teamwork & Trust
Excellence
Rigorous Financial Discipline
To learn more about our products visit the following page: https://www.newtrax.com/products/ and To see testimonials from our employees, view the following video: https://www.newtrax.com/careers/#career-opportunities
What’s in it for you?
Work in a dynamic and fast paced environment where you will have growth opportunities.
Join an award-winning company (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec: Prix Génie innovation, Selected as Technology Fast 50 in Canada by Deloitte, Entrepreneur of the year - Technology under 100 employees).
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment, in a human-scale company.
Be part of a growing company that has a global presence around the world.
Spacious open office in the heart of Old Montreal.
Super-convenient access by metro, bus, train or bike.
Opportunity to work with industry leading professionals.
Complete insurance package and competitive salary.
Summary
As a member of the embedded system group, you will work with multiple embedded software development teams to help testing the latest cutting-edge technology and ensure that all products are delivered to the highest quality.

The ideal candidate will be able to execute on commitments in fast paced environment, present technical information in simple terms to a variety of understanding levels, and collaborate with service and product teams with strong communication skills focused on problem solving.
Your responsibilities
Collaborate in ensuring that features are well defined ahead of development
Provide frequent and regular feedback to the team
Design and implement the embedded software testing platform
Plan, develop, coordinate, and perform testing for multiple products
Create test cases and build test suites with a focus on automation
Participate in discussions on product design and present test results to engineering teams and management.
Participate in system test
Investigate and help reproduce customer issues
Validate that all design documents are accurate and updated
Ensure all documentation is accurate and relevant (Release notes, installation, operation and maintenance manuals, …)
Your talent
BS or equivalent degree in EE/Computer Science or related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in testing/test automation of embedded software and associated applications
Strong experience in Embedded Linux
High level skills in programming/debugging Python, C / C++, Qt, etc.
Demonstrated experience in data communication networks and associated protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, Multicasting, QoS, RTP, TLS, SNMP, HTTP/HTTPS, DNS, DHCP, Layer 2 and 3 switching, firewalls, NATs and basic network security principles
Knowledge in LTE, WiFi, BLE, CAN bus is preferred
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Excellent verbal and written communication and proven interpersonal skills
Be result oriented, self-motivated and a team player
Ability to travel occasionally to customer sites 10%

Title: Specialist, Data Governance
Description:
Specialist, Data Governance
Specialist, Data Governance
At CN Rail, we work together to move our company—and our country—forward. We invest more than $100 million every year on projects and infrastructure. We harness the power of information to guide our decisions, and the Enterprise Architecture team is a critical part of the engine that keeps us in motion.
CN’s Enterprise Architecture Team is transforming our organization and is focused on building the future of rail technology. We are looking for the brightest, collaborative and most innovative minds in the industry to help us achieve our goals. If you are passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Industrial Internet of Things, big data platforms and enjoy solving complex problems, CN is looking for you.
Want to know more about the Enterprise Architecture team, and the meaningful work we do in Information & Technology?
ABOUT THE ROLE
As part of the Enterprise Architecture organization, the Specialist, Data Governance will be responsible for translating business strategy into a fit for purpose business and technology architecture that ensures stable, reliable, resilient and efficient service delivery that meet customer needs and enable innovation. Further, he/she will use and drive best-in-class Enterprise Architecture principles including a common service-oriented architecture, consistent technical frameworks and guidance, and a loosely coupled agile architecture across the organization.

This job is responsible to ensure – via data definitions, data policies and standards, governance rules, roles and responsibilities - that information is managed as a strategic business asset in the same manner as our tangible rail equipment.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with Business and IT Stewards to drive continuous improvement of our data management capabilities, practices, and outcomes to enhance both business performance and compliance levels over time through achievement of target information maturity model milestones.
Contribute to the construction and maintenance of the data stewardship network.
Help establish best practice and ownership of the corporate taxonomy and ontology, and develop rules for their use.
Develop standards, policies and procedures to support the creation and provide technical assurance for the on-going implementation of the data governance policy within the business.
Contribute to the implementation of the Data Governance Framework.
Elaborate business glossary with business Data Stewards and SMEs; determine data criticality in the context of identified business processes; Assess general data quality and identifies data issues.
Work with Data Quality Analysts and SMEs to determine root causes and business impacts of data issues; Assess existing data rules & responsibilities; Determine and prioritize data related risks with business Data Stewards and SMEs.
Recommend which data rules, responsibilities & data management processes should be implemented or changed.
Support and contribute to project management activities by participating in the scoping and estimating of project efforts, risks identification and mitigation measures recommendation, communicating activity status and providing timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems to the Project Manager.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (such as library science), or equivalent related project experience.
7+ years experience in architecture and implementation of complex technology systems
Sound Data Governance and Data Quality concepts knowledge
Strong ability to work in undiscovered, unstructured territories and to formalize processes that are currently not formalized
Strong ability to link technical element (i.e. Data Models) to business elements (i.e. Business process mapping)
Experience in business requirements gathering
The role requires sound communication skills to influence and orient business and technical audience toward a common goal that is satisfying all stakeholders
Strong ability to manage different stakeholder perspectives and resistance to change
Ability to deliver mandate with great autonomy – self-driven
Ability at taking decisions by understanding and explaining trade-offs between business enablement and economics impacts

Assets
Familiarity with Data Governance tools such AXON, Colibra, Datum etc
Knowledge of rail, transportation or logistics industry
Knowledge of best practices and latest trends in data management
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Intern
Description:
Job Field:
New Graduate / Student
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Building Location:

BGIS is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.
SUMMARY:
As part of the Finance team, you will be engaged and ready to support the team with data collection, engineering, analysis and data mining tasks, to support cross-departmental analyses.
The team’s role is to address complex business and Financial problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI is a rapidly expanding field which enables companies to remain competitive, and to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data and supporting cross-department analyses, creating and implementing ML models internally.
The intern will work cross-department on advanced analytics, data mining and automation projects. The intern will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models, with a focus on financial analysis, the energy industry and operational improvement initiatives. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the fields of Data Science / Artificial Intelligence, Finance and / or Energy. Ideal candidates would have a background in Finance, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, or Engineering programs
Roles and Responsibilities
We are looking for a team player who possesses / is interested in developing exceptional analytical skills, can learn quickly, and is truly motivated by solving impactful business problems
Create and operationalize ML models internally
Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal systems and external data sources
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify opportunity areas utilizing tools that can handle large data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, R, Python, etc.)
Data Engineering to add value to collected data by creating features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management / data governance
Develop both simple and machine learning models to drive business success
Create dashboards to disseminate information to business audiences utilizing tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Create presentation decks to explain analyses and recommendations
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support Finance controllers and analysts with complex analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally
Required Knowledge & Skills
Academic or industrial experience in advanced analytics tools, such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS, Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, etc.
Academic or industrial experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Academic or industrial experience with databases, analytic applications, and/or programming languages preferred (i.e. data modeling, SQL, Java)
Recently completed, or working towards, a Master’s designation or university-level certification in Data Science, Analytics or AI
Technically and digitally savvy with an interest/passion in uncovering insights through analytics
Ability to tame and analyze large datasets and translate into actionable recommendations and meaningful stories
Collaborator, learner and a go-getter with a positive attitude
Confident in oral, written, and interpersonal skills
Strong customer focus and a total commitment to customer satisfaction
Desired Knowledge & Skills:
For this internship opportunity, BGIS is most interested in students who are serious about venturing into the Real Estate industry
Experience in the creation and use of big data environments is preferred
Recent graduates or undergraduate students completing their final two years are preferred

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist
Looking for an opportunity to join a great, local success story that hasn't given up the agility and energy of its start-up DNA? MavTek is the trailblazing Montreal-based technology company you haven't heard of until now. We're building the next generation of large-scale e-commerce and video content delivery platforms, and yes, it's as much fun as it sounds!
To keep with up our rapid growth and fast-paced workflow, we're expanding our Engineering division and are looking for experts in Big Data and Data Science to extract and assess key data and implement real life solutions, influencing our business strategy and elevating our customer experience.
The successful candidate will join the Data team and be wholly responsible for the entire data pipeline from data collection, cleaning, and pre-processing, to training models and deployment into production.
Must Have:
Minimum of 3+ years experience in the data science and data architecture field
5+ years experience in a software engineering environment
Strong knowledge of data science techniques with the relevant mathematical background
Proven experience in delivering Data intensive projects
Proficient in Python, R, Spark or similar technologies
Demonstrate the ability to use big data analytics toolset (Shiny, Notebooks, etc.)
Expert in SQL and relational databases (preferably MySQL)
Knowledge of artificial intelligence (machine learning) frameworks.
Ability to work both independently or as a member of a team.
Good communication skills
Comfortable in lean environments with associated project management techniques and tools (git, continuous integration, automated testing, devops, etc.)
