Title: Développeur Full Stack // Full Stack Developer
Description:
Qui sommes-nous?
Celliers Intelligents offre aux professionnels des solutions intelligentes pour simplifier la gestion des inventaires de vins et spiritueux. Notre plateforme ALFRED utilise l’intelligence artificielle pour réduire au minimum les efforts de gestion. Le restaurateur est en mesure d’offrir à sa clientèle une carte des vins entièrement numérique et d’augmenter ses marges en réduisant les erreurs coûteuses.
Alfred c’est une application mobile, un site web et une boutique en ligne pour permettre aux amateurs d’acheter et de vendre des vins provenant de la cave des membres.
Nos valeurs
Notre entreprise opère en mode agile, sans structure hiérarchique où chaque membre de l’équipe est autonome, imputable et fiduciaire de rôles. La flexibilité et la conciliation des horaires de travail font partie des valeurs de bases de l’entreprise. Celliers intelligents c’est aussi une équipe de près de 20 personnes regroupant les meilleurs professionnels où la confiance est la base d’une culture basée sur le respect, l’intégrité, la rigueur et la discipline.
Travailler pour Celliers Intelligents
Nos bureaux étant installés dans un co-working au sein du quartier St-Roch dans la ville de Québec, vous y trouverez une ambiance de travail décontractée et respectueuse des individus. Le travail à distance et la conciliation travail famille fait partie de nos valeurs. Vous préférez travailler à partir du bureau ou n’importe où dans le monde et vous adhérez à nos valeurs ? Nous nous engageons à respecter vos besoins et préférences de travail.
Nous sommes en plein développement et plusieurs postes en technologie et en vente sont ouverts au sein de l’entreprise. Nous sommes à la recherche d’un développeur full stack.
Si vous êtes motivés à utiliser vos compétences en matière de balisage et de codage afin de développer la technologie Alfred pour grandir ensemble, alors n’hésitez plus à appliquer pour compléter notre équipe. Vous jouerez un rôle primordial dans la croissance et dans le domaine du développement web avec vos idées novatrices.
—
Nous recherchons un développeur full stack qui est capable de travailler à la fois sur les parties front-end et back-end d'une application. Une personne qui a des connaissances interdisciplinaires dans le domaine d'application, le code client et serveur ainsi que dans la technologie des bases de données.Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec nos sommeliers et notre équipe informatique. Votre travail permettra de construire des outils intelligents à l’aide de nos technologie d’apprentissage automatique.
Compétences recherchées:
Vuejs
SpringBoot
Flutter
La connaissance du français et de l’anglais est requise
Expérience et formation:
DEC ou Baccalauréat en informatique, génie informatique, génie logiciel ou toutes autres formations connexes
Minimum 3 ans d’expérience dans un domaine pertinent
Date d’entrée en poste : Courant août 2019
Salaire concurrentiel
Deux postes sont ouverts : développeur full stack sénior et développeur fullstack junior
—
Pour postuler, envoyez votre CV via le formulaire.
Nous sommes un employeur équitable et la diversité nous tient à cœur. Nous ne faisons pas de discrimination à l'égard de la race, de l'origine ethnique, de la religion, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge ou de l'état de santé.
L’usage du masculin désigne autant les hommes que les femmes et vise uniquement à alléger le texte.
__
Who are we?
Celliers Intelligents offers professionals intelligent solutions to simplify the management of wine and spirits inventories. Our ALFRED platform uses artificial intelligence to minimize management efforts. The restaurateur is able to offer his customers a fully digital wine list and increase his margins by reducing costly errors.
Alfred is a mobile application, a website and an online shop to allow wine lovers to buy and sell wines from the members' cellar.
Our values
Our company operates in an agile mode, without a hierarchical structure where each team member is autonomous, accountable and role trustee. Flexibility and reconciliation of working hours are part of the company's core values. Celliers intelligents is also a team of nearly 20 people bringing together the best professionals where trust is the basis of a culture based on respect, integrity, rigour and discipline.
Working for Celliers intelligents
Our offices are located in a co-working facility in the St-Roch district of Quebec City, where you will find a relaxed and respectful work environment. Telework and work-life balance are part of our values. Would you prefer to work from the office or anywhere in the world and adhere to our values? We are committed to respecting your work needs and preferences.
—
We are in the process of developing and several technology and sales positions are open within the company. We are looking for a full stack developer.
If you are motivated to use your tagging and coding skills to develop Alfred technology to grow together, then feel free to apply to complete our team. You will play a key role in the growth and development of the web with your innovative ideas.
We are looking for a full stack developer who is able to work on both the front-end and back-end parts of an application. A person who has interdisciplinary knowledge in the field of application, client and server code and database technology. You will work closely with our sommeliers and IT team. Your work will allow us to build intelligent tools using our automatic learning technology.
Skills sought:
Vuejs
SpringBoot
Flutter
Knowledge of French and English is required
Experience and courses:
DEC in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or any other related training
Minimum 5 years of experience in a relevant field
Date of commencement: During August 2019
Competitive salary
Two positions are available: Lead full stack developper and Junior full stack developper
—
To apply, using the form.
We are a fair employer and diversity is important to us. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or health status.
The use of the masculine gender refers to both men and women and is intended solely to simplify the text.

Title: Software Development, Pre-Development and UX (User eXperienc...

The position is permanent.

Professional SW Engineering, Development of Algorithms in C++ and Python

In one of the future’s domains: robotics and artificial intelligence
Mapping your work content to your interests and skills
The opportunity and competences to “change things” and to “leave own footprints”
Development of your personal and professional skills and competences
Highly flexible working condition and an attractive modern and professional working environment
In accordance with regulations of 01.03.2011, we hereby inform you that the minimal salary for this position according to the collective agreement is €2984/month (14/year). We are willing to overpay according to experience and qualification. The position is permanent.

Title: Research Engineering Intern/Co-op (January, 2020 Start)
Description:
Location: Toronto, Canada
L’Activité Mondiale Systèmes de Transport Terrestre fournit des solutions de signalisation ferroviaire pour les grandes lignes et les transports urbains, des systèmes intégrés de communication et de supervision, des solutions billettiques et les services associés.
Thales fournit des systèmes de commande de trains par télécommunications (CBTC) et des systèmes d’enclenchement destinés au secteur des transports en commun sur voie ferrée à l'échelle mondiale. Le centre de compétences pour la signalisation ferroviaire urbaine est situé au centre-ville de Toronto. Nous sommes le plus grand bureau situé au Canada et nous disposons d’un service pour chaque étape du cycle de vie du développement logiciel (SDLC). Cela comprend le logiciel, le matériel, la conception des systèmes, la vérification et la validation, les opérations, etc. Les équipes de services partagés dans les domaines des finances, des ressources humaines et des technologies de l’information sont également situées sur ce site. Notre espace de bureau est conçu pour fournir un milieu de travail sûr et durable qui correspond à la marque TRSS et qui favorise la collaboration. Le mobilier répond aux normes Greenguard, les appareils ménagers sont certifiés EnergyStar et les adhésifs et produits d'étanchéité répondent aux critères de faible émission. De plus, les portes coulissantes en verre laissent entrer la lumière dans les bureaux intérieurs qui offrent ainsi une vue sur l'extérieur. Venez vous joindre à la grande famille du Transport, ici à Toronto !
Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.
Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification & Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office. Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!
Position Title: Research Engineering Intern/Co-op
Duration: 4, 8 or 12 Months
Department: Transport
Location: Toronto
As a part of the research and technology (R&T) team, you bring your knowledge in robotics, computer vision, fusion algorithms, point cloud processing or machine learning to build, test and review next generation solutions for the transit market. You will be involved in research and development to create “proof-of-concept” products for the urban rail signalling domain.
Key Responsibilities:
Participate in the analysis of complex, real-time, autonomous system use cases
Understand the goal of a research project and support its execution
Analyze lab and field test results
Assist with multiple sensors and the latest software algorithms to control complex, safety critical systems
Become a highly productive team member and team player
Skills and Experience:
The successful candidate should have completed their third year in Computer Science or Electronics/Computer/Electrical Engineering or closely related field
Software development experience in C++
Exceptional scripting or programming skills in languages Python, R, Perl and Ruby
Practical experience of object oriented techniques, multi threading, socket programming, Windows
Knowledge of main concepts of Machine learning and Artificial intelligence
Active user of Linux and Git version control
Knowledge of STL, Boost, MFC, UML, and design patterns
Knowledge of modern software engineering practices, methods and tools
Demonstrated ability to follow instructions to deliver a quality technical solution on-time
Chez Thales, nous proposons des CARRIÈRES passionnantes, pas de simples emplois. Fort de ses 65 000 collaborateurs dans 56 pays, Thales a mis en place une politique de mobilité permettant, chaque année, à des milliers d'employés de faire progresser leur carrière tant dans leur domaine d’expertise que dans de nouveaux domaines de compétences, cela aussi bien dans leur pays d’origine qu’à l'étranger. Ensemble, nous pensons qu’adopter une politique de flexibilité est une manière plus actuelle de travailler. C’est ici que commence votre parcours exceptionnel, postulez sans tarder!
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Be part of our team! Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.
In this position, you will get to:

Work in a highly collaborative agile team environment to deliver industry leading digital solutions
Blaze a trail for nVent, demonstrating a DevOps culture, developing infrastructure as code along with the product code
Hands on experience developing solutions based on applying machine learning and artificial intelligence to the wealth of our unique product data

#LI-CO1
At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. Known for innovation, quality and reliability, our products connect and protect, consistently delivering value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers. Title: Chatbot Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
Master of Code Canada, our Canadian office, is located in Winnipeg, MB and opened its doors in 2016. Our team of 10 Masters focuses on building AI-powered chat and voice solutions. We work with tech start-ups, small and midsize businesses, and enterprise customers to deliver conversational experiences. A partial list of our global brands includes T-Mobile, LivePerson, Aveda, and the World Surf League.
Our team is comprised of technology enthusiasts who share a common passion for AI-driven technology and for delivering world-class conversational experiences. Whether it’s experimenting with Augmented Reality, Amazon Lex voice bots or having our work featured at Facebook’s F8 Developer Conference in 2017 and 2018.
Master of Code Global is a world-class software development agency with four offices and more than 190 team members worldwide. Established in 2004, our team provides full-service custom software development. The Canadian office works closely with Master of Code Global to deliver projects on a global scale for leading organizations.
Role Summary
Master of Code is rapidly expanding as enterprises shift their focus and investment in AI-powered solutions. Master of Code is seeking an Analyst to join our growing Analytics & Insights team. As an Analyst, you will turn data from world-class conversational applications into actionable insights for our customers.
Requirements
2+ years of meaningful experience in roles such as Analytics, Reporting, Data Analyst, Digital Measurement, Digital Marketing, etc. Added bonus if the candidate’s academic background included the study of Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics
Experience using analytic and measurement tools such as Web Trends, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Mailchimp
Experience working with Salesforce, Marketo, Heap and other sales and marketing analytics systems is an asset
Experience using data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau is an asset
From You
You are passionate about mobile, website and application measurement tools, email marketing measurement tools, data aggregation, A/B testing/multivariate testing, social media measuring tools
A proven track record of collaborating with high performing teams
You are interested in conversational experiences such as Facebook Messenger bots, Slack bots, Alexa bots, Telegram bots, Google Assistant, etc.
Proven ability to explain complex issues in clear, non-technical language; you should be comfortable dealing with internal team members and external customers
You’re biased towards action and enjoy the adrenaline rush of delivering great work under tight timelines
You embrace an entrepreneurial spirit; self-starter who is intrinsically curious
You enjoy working with a team of passionate people and can add both energy and positivity to the culture
Fluent in English with strong verbal and written communication skills
Responsibilities
Implement analytics tools and set-up custom analytics tracking
Identify required data and perform data aggregation
Build Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Measure and track performance metrics
Identify A/B tests to optimize user experience
Analyze bot analytics to identify optimization and conversion opportunities
Build custom reporting functionality and generate reports
Develop actionable insights and identify bot enhancements
Address complex problems and analyze large datasets to develop compelling, data-driven recommendations to optimize the digital marketing and sales funnel
Create digital measurement strategies, report design, KPI development, data visualization, dashboard creation, and strategic analysis
Maintain the data and reporting systems that help our customers understand the impact of their applications, campaigns and initiatives
Perform bot analytics including behavioral, conversion paths, goal funnels, behavior flows, audience metrics, demographics, conversation, event tracking, etc.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders from Design, Marketing, Business Development, Sales, and Innovation to drive critical insights that help our customers understand and optimize their digital marketing and sales funnel
Manage the day to day measurement functions ensuring the end deliverables are delivered on time, in scope and within budget
What do we offer?
We’re passionate about building conversational experiences using the latest technologies (often in beta) from tech leaders including Facebook, Google, Amazon, Microsoft and others. Every day we get to work with the latest in Artificial Intelligence, most notably machine learning and natural language processing. We work side by side with our customers exploring some of the most innovative chatbot use cases, features, and integrations in the industry. For instance, how can we supercharge a Fortune 500’s support team by leveraging the newly released WhatsApp Business API? We’ve become thought leaders at the center of the AI revolution.

The opportunity to build something special in Winnipeg excites us. As ‘builders’ we are comfortable with ambiguity and motivated by the challenge to rapidly grow the office. We are easily bored with the status quo and are constantly looking for ways to innovate.

While we have the support of a global company, the Winnipeg office operates like a bootstrapped startup. There’s never a dull moment, from hackathons to adrenaline-filled customer deadlines or pitching Augmented Reality solutions using closed beta products from Facebook. Do you miss the fast-paced startup culture? Obsessed with HBO’s Silicon Valley?
Location:
Winnipeg

Title: Software Development Engineer - Amazon Connect (AWS)
Description:
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design and data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis
Experience in modern programming languages, e.g. Java, C#, C++.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers? Looking for a job where your work can have direct and massive impact? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.

Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.

We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for passionate, talented, and experienced Software Engineers to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud. The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role in developing the next generation contact center, and get the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.

Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”

As a Software Development Engineer on our team, you’ll own code end-to-end from design to development, and work closely with other senior technical leaders within the team and across AWS. You’ll have a sound understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical industry experience, working across the stack with technology involving modern web, SOA, NoSQL databases, AI, ML, Big Data and more.

What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that loves working together towards a common goal.
Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.
Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.
Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.
Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.
Learn & Grow: If want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a life time.
Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.
Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.
Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented pool of engineers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.
Learn more about Amazon Connect here:
https://aws.amazon.com/connect/

Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Experience building scalable distributed systems with service oriented architectures

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

Title: Sr.Analyst / Data Scientist
Description:
Lieu:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
C’est toute une décision que de se joindre à une entreprise. Nous offrons des perspectives d’emploi à des personnes qui, comme vous, sont travaillantes, dynamiques et fiables.
Pourquoi ce role est-il important?
Reporting to the Manager of Advanced Analytics (Replenishment Optimization), the Senior Supply Chain Analyst will develop machine learning models using diverse datasets (structured and unstructured) to augment the decision making of supply chain colleagues, help automate replenishment processes, and optimize the flow of inventory to stores and DCs.
Accountabilities:
Apply Artificial Intelligence (AI)/ Machine Learning (ML)/ Deep Learning (DL) on large volume and variety of data to drive process improvement and automation in Supply Chain Replenishment
Work with business stakeholders and IT teams to identify areas of business that would benefit from ML solutions
Assess the available data by performing data exploration and visualizations
Implement data pipeline to ingest, clean, format and aggregate data; overcome challenges related to missing or corrupted data
Design scalable and deployable AI/ML/DL solutions; Partition data into training, validation and test sets, train and assess ML models, adjust hyperparameters etc.
Track model performance over time and identify techniques to improve model performance
Communicate ML theory, model design, results and its impacts to a variety of stakeholders
Research new breakthroughs and industry applications of AI
Additionally, act at as the organization’s data champion by identifying opportunities for novel data collection and approaches to improve data integrity
Qualifications:
Post-secondary education in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Machine Learning, Applied Math or Operations Research
Proficiency in MS Office, SQL, Python, R or any other programming language
Knowledge of big data systems – Hadoop, Teradata, Spark and/or Azure preferred
Experience with enterprise supply chain solutions (JDA, SAP) is beneficial
Creative problem solver with a passion for applying analytics to solve business problems
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects/priorities and meet deadlines, under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Comment R é ussir:
Chez Loblaw, nous recherchons toujours des personnes formidables pour continuellement renforcer notre culture. Nous croyons que les gens formidables façonnent nos valeurs, sont authentiques, bâtissent la confiance et créent des liens.
Si cela vous ressemble et que vous êtes ouvert d’esprit, que vous avez une bonne attitude face aux changements et que vous aimez les défis d’un environnement de travail aux détails dynamiques, postulez aujourd’hui.
En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.

Temps plein

Poste régulier
Loblaw considère que la diversité culturelle du Canada est une source de fierté nationale et un symbole de force. Nous nous sommes donné comme priorité de refléter la diversité croissante du Canada dans les produits que nous vendons, les gens que nous embauchons et notre culture d’entreprise. Des accommodements sont disponibles sur demande pour les postulants et collègues atteints d’un handicap.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
****English Version included below***
Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.
Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques expérimentes et seniors en traitement des données (Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.
Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.
Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Spécialiste Apprentissage Automatique-Scientifique en traitement des données (Data Scientist), vous devez très bien connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté
Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’apprentissage automatique ou en Science des données.
Expérience éprouvée dans la rédaction de logiciels de production
Grande expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Très bonnes compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Compétences éprouvées de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Bonnes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
* IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.
Ericsson is now looking for Experienced and Senior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.
Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data?
Role Summary:
As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence
DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.

Title: Junior Full Stack Developer
Description:
Based in Toronto, Fortran Traffic Systems Limited is a leader in the North American traffic industry and at the forefront of innovation in intelligent transportation management systems. With the arrival of transportation technologies such as Connected Vehicle/Automated Vehicle (CVAV) and Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X), Fortran is advancing its platforms to harness the multitude of benefits that these emerging technologies can provide to road operators and traffic management agencies. Fortran offers a challenging environment, rich in R&D, that fosters creativity and rewards excellence.
Job description
The Junior Full Stack Developer will be entrusted to develop cutting-edge software solutions for the next-generation of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) designed and produced by Fortran.
Recent graduates are encouraged to apply.
The successful candidate will be an integral part of a team developing high performance and sustainable V2X and ITS systems. Responsibilities include:
Utilizing quality focused software development practices and standards to develop full stack software solutions
Performing detailed analysis, design, unit-level code development, software integration and testing
Analyzing complex functions, procedures and problems to deliver creative, logical, and effective solutions that meets the specified requirements
Conducting / participating in design and code reviews, identifying potential problems and performance issues, providing feedback and corrections and evaluating code compliance to standards
Preparation of application operational / procedural documentation for users and technical support staff
Requirements
Experience and working knowledge in the following areas:
Web-based front-end application framework and web-based UI programming
Understanding of web development languages and technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavasScript/jQuery and NodeJS
SQL and NoSQL experience including (PostgresDB/PostGIS and MongoDB)
C++ back-end programming
Linux (or Unix) environment Operating systems principles and communication protocols
Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Organized, focused and persistent with the ability to work to the plan and meet delivery dates
Excellent problem solver and quick learner
Further consideration will be given to candidates that possess:
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Machine Learning, Data Mining or Machine Intelligence (Artificial Intelligence)
Real-time software development experience
Native mobile app development (Android or iOS)
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Head of Data and Analytics
Description:
Canada Drives embraces an innovative, experimental, and data-driven mindset that encourages creative solutions and relentless progress. Guided by young leadership and defined by its innovative, out-of-the-box thinking, Canada Drives attracts the best talent in Vancouver by combining the electrifying energy of a start-up with the hard-earned stability of an established company.

We have been recognized as the fastest growing company in Canada by PROFIT 500 and the winner of Entrepreneur of the Year in 2016 by the Ernst & Young Pacific Division fintech category award. We were named as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 2019. The company’s growth means there are tons of opportunities on the horizon. This millennial-friendly company is committed to developing leaders from within as it fine-tunes an online service that satisfies over one million customers a year.

Our office is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver and we want you to join our fast-growing team. Come and discover your potential with us!

The Opportunity - Head of Data and Analytics

Canada Drives is enhancing our operations through skills and technology; we’re building a unique team, processes, and technology to collect, aggregate, and analyze raw data into accurate, understandable, and actionable reports and strategies.

The Data Analytics Manager will lead a team of analysts and be responsible for defining the overall departmental vision, strategy, and roadmap. They will also help organize and align the Sales and Marketing departments with their day-to-day reporting and analytics.

The right candidate will have a combination of leadership, technical, analytical, and communication skills. By successfully leveraging these skills, the Data Analytics Manager will help improve our business operations across multiple departments.

Take your career to the next level and be part of a winning team!

What you’ll be doing:
Owning the data analytics processes and tools across the company
Managing the Data Analytics team (current staff of 4) and providing direction, vision, motivation, and mentorship
Developing a deep understanding of the key business drivers and revenue
Supporting data-driven decision making by providing stakeholders with accurate and timely information
Setting expectations for data analytics and providing clear communication to stakeholders
Providing meaningful insights to business managers
Managing dashboards, metrics, and reports to assist Sales, Marketing, Design, Customer Service, Dealer Services, and IT with their day-to-day operations and challenges
Managing and implementing new data projects such as data centralization and creating underwriting models
Supporting and promoting data governance
Analyzing data for new insights, loan performance, and optimization of underwriting models
Participating in strategic and tactical planning with Stakeholders
Using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Predictive Analytics
Analyzing website traffic and advertisement data including the daily tracking of customer applications and conversion rates
Working together with our in-house designers and developers to maintain and enhance our internal marketing tags and advertisements
Planning, executing, analyzing results of A/B test variations on our websites as well as providing recommendations for improvements
What you should already have:
Minimum 10 years of experience working with BI or Analytics
Minimum 5 years of experience directly managing and mentoring staff
Strong business-oriented skills to oversee the business strategy and processes, while turning data analysis into actionable information and insights
Strong leadership, problem-solving, and communications skills
Previous experience leading the development of data warehouses, data marts, dashboards, performance metrics, and reports
Hands on experience analyzing and mining data, slicing and dicing structures, and finding new areas of opportunity
Previous experience with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Predictive Intelligence
Excellent with Python, R and SQL
Excellent with Tableau, Microsoft Power BI and Excel
Deep understanding of dimensional data modelling
Good understanding of Google Analytics and Tag Manager
Familiarity with the Salesforce platform and modules (or comparable CRM)
Assets

Financial Industry experience
Master’s degree in Analytics related studies
Working knowledge of Project Management and Business Analysis
Experience with Agile methodologies
Good understanding of Adobe Target Manager and Audience

Title: Quality Assurance Sports Analyst
Description:
Come work for the team that’s boldly redefining the games you love. From Hockey, Soccer, Football to Lacrosse, Sportlogiq is at the forefront of the sport analytics revolution. We provide data-backed insights into team and player performance on a game-by-game basis. Join us in supplying the most accurate description of the game in real time.
What you’ll do:
You will be analyzing game video and ensuring that the raw data this is inputted into our state-of-the-art proprietary software system is accurate. By accurately and objectively breaking down each play, you will enable our pro teams and media clients to make more informed decisions, while also feeding vital data to our machine learning and artificial intelligence engine. A dedication to detail and accuracy, and an excitement for sports can go a long way!
What you’ll do:
Selected candidates will be tasked with analyzing sports video using the company's proprietary software system. Accurate data collection is of utmost importance and therefore the ideal candidate is someone who has a passion for detail and accuracy is comfortable using computer technology.
What you need:
Thorough / detail oriented
Ability to meet fast turnaround times
Speed and accuracy in data collection
Willingness to learn
Must be available 25hrs/week
A valid work permit which allows for more than 25 hours of work a week
Evening Availability (6:00 PM - 2:00 AM)
What we offer:
Part-time only
A comprehensive training program
$15- $17/ hour
Bonuses based on quality of work
Contract position until June 15, 2020 with a possibility of extension
*Training begins Tuesday October 22nd 2019 at 6:00 PM.
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Salary: $15.00 to $17.00 /hour
Experience:
Sports (Player/Fan/Coach/Referee): 1 year (Preferred)
Location:
Montréal, QC (Required)

Title: Data Architect
Description:
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
Intelligence automatisée (Machine Intelligence) chez Ericsson:
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser un réseau 5G, l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies d'Intelligence artificielle (IA) - il sera vital pour nous de nous occuper de cette complexité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures que nous utilisons pour alimenter nos réseaux et services 5G. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie. Notre groupe international met au point des produits de pointe qui simplifient et automatisent les processus de nos produits et services, et apportent une nouvelle valorisation grâce à des informations sur les données.
Ericsson recrute des architectes expérimentés et seniors des données pour enrichir de manière significative son équipe Global AI Accelerator .
Description du poste :
Ericsson est à la recherche d'architectes des données compétents pour rejoindre son équipe d'experts MI en pleine évolution. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez évoluer et optimiserez notre architecture de données et de traitement en cascade (data pipeline), tout en optimisant la circulation et le recueil des données pour les équipes plurifonctionnelles. Vous êtes un expert en établissement de traitements en cascade (data pipeline) et du Datawrangling, qui aime optimiser les systèmes de traitement des données et les faire évoluer. L'Ingénieur de données soutiendra nos concepteurs de logiciels, architectes de bases de données, analystes de données et scientifiques en traitement des données concernant les initiatives portant sur les données, et assurera l'optimisation de ces dernières et des modèles. L'architecture devOps (dataOps) est la même pour tous les projets en cours. Vous êtes autonome et à l'aise lorsqu'il s'agit de réagir face aux besoins en DataOps de plusieurs équipes, systèmes et produits. Vous serez également responsable de les intégrer à l'architecture utilisée dans l'entreprise. Le bon candidat sera enthousiasmé par la perspective d'optimiser ou même de reconcevoir l'architecture dataOps de notre entreprise, afin de soutenir notre nouvelle génération de produits et de solutions stimulés par la MI.
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Créer et gérer des données optimales et modéliser l'architecture Pipeline en dataOps
Assembler des ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, qui satisfont aux conditions opérationnelles fonctionnelles / non fonctionnelles.
Découvrir, concevoir et améliorer les procédés internes : automatisation des procédés manuels, optimisation de la délivrance des données, re-conception de l'infrastructure au bénéfice d'une plus grande possibilité d'évolution, etc.
Établir l'infrastructure requise pour l'extraction, la transformation et le chargement optimaux de données, à partir de différentes sources de données en faisant appel à SQL et à des technologies « Big Data » reposant sur le cloud d'AWS, Azure et autres.
Travailler avec les parties prenantes, notamment l'équipe de la Direction, du service Produits, du service Données et Conception, pour les aider à résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux données et à satisfaire à leurs besoins en infrastructure de traitement des données.
Faire en sorte que les données soient séparées et sécurisées au-delà des frontières nationales, grâce à plusieurs centres de traitement des données et à des clients / partenaires stratégiques.
Créer des chaines de compilation (toolchain) pour l'équipe des scientifiques en traitement des données et d'analyse, qui les aident à créer et à optimiser notre produit, afin qu'il devienne le premier produit de l'industrie de par son degré d'innovation.
Coopérer avec les experts en apprentissage automatique et en traitement des données, afin d'améliorer le fonctionnement de nos systèmes de gestion du cycle de vie des modèles et de traitement de nos données.
Appuyer l'accumulation de compétences en DapaOps dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Ce que nous aimerions constater:
BS, MS ou doctorat en informatique, en informatique, en systèmes de traitement des informations ou dans un autre domaine connexe.
Au moins 3 ans d'expérience en utilisation des logiciels / outils suivants :
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Expérience en bases de données relationnelles SQL et NoSQL, notamment Postgres et Cassandra.
Expérience en outils de traitement en pipeline de modèles et des données, en gestion du déroulement des travaux : Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Expérience en systèmes de traitement des flux : Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Expérience en langages de script orientés sur les fonctionnalités des objets / objets : Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Vous connaissances en SQL sont très poussées, et vous avez l'habitude de travailler sur des bases de données relationnelles, la création de requêtes (SQL), et connaissez très bien toutes sortes de bases de données / sources de données.
Vous avez de l'expérience en création et optimisation de pipelines de traitement de Big Data, en architectures et ensembles de données.
Expérience en analyse des causes profondes des données et des procédés internes et externes afin de répondre à des questions professionnelles spécifiques, et rechercher des opportunités d'amélioration.
Vos compétences analytiques liées à l'utilisation de jeux de données non structurés, sont très solides.
Vous avez créé des procédés prenant en charge la transformation des données, les structures de données, les métadonnées, la gestion de la dépendance et du volume de travail.
Connaissance pratique de la mise en file d'attente des messages, du traitement des flux et des banques de données «big data» hautement évolutives.
Solides compétences en gestion de projet et interpersonnelles.
Expérience du soutien et du travail avec des équipes plurifonctionnelles dans un environnement dynamique.

As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Machine Intelligence at Ericsson:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize a 5G network, MachineLearning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies- will be vital for us to handle that complexity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution

Ericsson is hiring Experienced and Senior Data Architects to significantly expand its Global AI Accelerator team.
Job Description:
Ericsson is looking for savvy Data Architects to join our growing team of MI experts. As a team member, you will be evolving and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as, optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. You are an expert data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing datasystems and evolving them. The Data Architect will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data and models devOps (dataOps) architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the dataOps needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s dataOps architecture to support our existing and next generation of MI-driven products and solutions initiatives.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain optimal data and model dataOps pipeline architecture
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and cloud-based ‘big data’ technologies from AWS, Azure and others.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and strategic customers/partners.
Create tool-chains for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and machine learning experts to strive for greater functionality in our data and model life cycle management systems.
Support dataOps competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
What we would like to see:
BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another related field.
At least 3 years experience using the following software/tools:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with Data and Model pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, Dataiku, etc.
Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
You have advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of other databases/date-sources.
You have experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and seek opportunities for improvement.
You have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
You have built processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Strong project management and interpersonal skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
